summary_comment: Professor Webb is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and ability to convey complex material clearly, making the subject accessible and interesting. Students appreciate her passion for the subject and her approachable nature, which encourages participation and engagement. Her classes are generally considered easy with straightforward tests, provided students attend regularly and take thorough notes.
summary_comment_short: Professor Webb is highly regarded for her clear teaching style and ability to make complex material accessible, particularly in her course on Dante's Inferno. Students consistently praise her passion for the subject and her effective methods of engaging students and ensuring they understand the material through class participation and comprehensive lectures.

Ratings.comment: TA promised to help me catch up, when I was absent for family emergency.  My grade suffered unncecessarily.

She is very clear in what she wants and what is important to know. Main thing is go to class! The subject matter is pretty interesting, and the tests were so easy, I got 100 on all the exams and quizzes. Definitely take this for an easy lit GEC if you are willing to take thorough notes and are interested in Italian culture.
I don't know how anyone could stay awake during this class. Literally the most boring class of all time.

One of my favorite profs at OSU. She's passionate about what she teaches and it shows. Gives extra credit to people for speaking up during class discussions. The tests are basically open-ended, but not difficult if you attend class and take notes. If you explain your answers she tends to give you most if not full credit.

She's pretty amazing at conveying the material and make it easy to follow the concepts of the Inferno. I completely suggest this class to anyone interested in Dante's Inferno or an easy GEC grade. Just take plenty of notes and you'll be gold.

I loved her class.  Just make sure you take notes tarting the first day of class because it's all you have to go off on for the midterm and final.  Not too hard tho.  So interesting.  Take her class for a GEC
Amazing amazing amazing! Take her...she is great at making students understand the importance of Italian culture. Great GEC class...highly suggest taking her!

This class was AWESOME! I actually enjoyed going to class! Webb is an awesome teacher! She gives a study guide for quizzes and exams. You only get tested on what she says in class so you do not really need to read the books. Very easy A. Definitely take this class!!

She is easily one of the best professors in the Italian department. She's always willing to help with any issue. Her classes are fun and always interesting. You'll have to put forth some effort but it's always worth it. She's an active scholar outside of teaching so taking her class is not only smart, it's a privilege.

Prof. Webb is amazing. This class was a joke and the quizzes and tests were very straight forward. But class attendance is must and also make sure to write down everything that she tells in class coz they appear on the exams and quizzes. I would recommend this class to nyone
Pretty easy class, if you go to class and take notes you don't have to do the readings.  Interesting literature and movies, she opens up the floor a lot which makes it more interactive...
Great teacher. Interesting stuff, too! I highly recommend this class if you need a GEC...
She is one of the best professors I have had here.  The tests and quizzes are very easy if you go to class and pay attention.  It was also very interesting.

Loved this class! Everything I needed to know for tests and quizzes was presented clearly in the notes. Go to class for the info and you won't even need to read. She is very enthusiastic and apporoachable.

One of the best classes I've taken this year. Organized class structure and excellent use of different mediums to show the material (ie powerpoints, movies, pictures). Learning is easy in her class because she is very interested in Italian culture and art and it spreads to her students. Great class and great professor.

Incredibly easy class; she's very, very kind and always willing to clarify.  An easy A, basically.  Her take on Dante does veer off of the traditional path, though.  She also might want to take Bible 101 because she got quite a bit incorrect regarding the basics of Christianity (ANY Christian denomination, esp. medieval Catholicism).

Prof. Webb is a GREAT teacher who really tries to make class fun.Her knowledge of Dante is amazing.She speaks Italian beautifully, and her lectures are very interactive.She is VERY approchable and kind.Always willing to help. TAKE HER.
She is amazing!  She makes class fun and the matrial exciting!  You'll become an Italian Major after one class with her.  She is also very smart and funny.  You'll love her.
I Loved Heather, she was amazing, definately take a class with her, it's delightful!!

Dr.Webb is an all around must have professor.  She is brilliant, funny, young and engaging.  She makes class fun.  You don't even realize how much you are learning because she makes it so painless.  She is great at what she does and the best professor by far in the languages, if not at OSU.  Take anything and everything you can with her.  She is fabulous.
No Comments

She speaks perfect flawless italian. U'll be totally immersed in italian in her class. She encourages students to think for themselves and her class is a lot of fun. More teachers like this are needed at the lower level, so that students don't get to 402 without being able to actually pronounce Ital

summary_comment: Professor Spencer is known for his extensive knowledge in his field, particularly in subjects like the Nazi era and German classes, where he is considered an excellent and inspiring instructor. However, his teaching style is often criticized for its dry humor and potential insensitivity, which can be off-putting to some students. Despite his clear communication and ability to make the subject matter engaging, his opinionated nature and tendency to push his ideals on students, combined with occasional rudeness and inappropriate comments, have led to significant
summary_comment_short: Professor Spencer is known for his extensive knowledge in his field, particularly in subjects like the Nazi era and German classes, where he is described as an excellent and inspiring instructor. However, his teaching style is often criticized for being dry and occasionally offensive, and he has been accused of being opinionated and disrespectful towards students who disagree with him.

Ratings.comment: I had Dr.Spencer as an advisor for French and Italian and he was incredibly unhelpful. Instead of solutions to missing credits he would try to push study abroad. I was short a course to graduate and asked if I could take a course over the summer, his solution? $15,000 study abroad program. He was also very rude on calls and at meetings.

The most concerning thing about Dr. Spencer is his opinionated nature and constant wish to push his ideals on his students. He rarely has respect for students' opinions when they contradict his. 
Then we have his signature catch phrase, "There's multiple ways to skin a cat," which he uses every time someone asks how anything will be graded.

A pompous, arrogant man comes off as having a heart, but deep insecurities make him dry and sarcastic. He lectures but isn't a fantastic instructor overall. A top-tier instructor should be inspiring; unfortunately, this Brit doesn't give that impression. Additionally, yelling at students is never acceptable.

Humor is dry and can be on the offensive side. Interesting lecturer. But he yelled at me multiple times. Like actually yelled. I know I was a problem student, but I do not think raising your voice at a student is ever okay.
You'll get whatever grade he feels like... so expect a B.

GREAT class. Dr. Spencer communicates clearly and intelligently and makes the subject matter even more interesting than it already is (the Nazi era). He is hilarious, but some people may misinterpret his humor as insulting. Don't take offense to him! Attend class and read and you will be fine! One of the best professors I've had!
Incredibly knowledgeable about the subject matter he teaches.  He does have a dry sense of humor that some might find offensive, but he is a great instructor.

I had Dr. Spencer for 4 German classes while I was at OSU. As a teacher, he was excellent and inspiring. You will learn a great deal from him. As a human being, he was an offensive and arrogant person exemplifying a poorly tuned moral compass. As a result, I found many of his comments to be inappropriate and unprofessional.
Very engaging teacher, knows his stuff, forces you to pay attention. Highly recommend his 299 class.

I've had Spencer for German 301, 550, and 299. Here's a quote from 299: "There are stupid questions, so don't ask me one." If you're willing to put forth the effort, you're golden. Otherwise..you're scenery.

Very good professor! His class was challenging, which improved my German substantially. He is harsh at times, but mostly because he's trying to perfect speaking, writing and comprehension skills. I would definitely recommend taking the classes he teaches, especially if your major is German. Also very well knowledged on the subject matter.

Dr. Andy is a really nice guy. Very funny as well. Expects students to put in the work and he does not grade easy. If you do what is expected for the class you will do fine. Other than that Andy is awesome!
Kind of mean for no reason sometimes

Dr. Spencer is incredible. Very funny, very articulate, very intelligent. I suspect that those who find him "arrogant" or a "horrible person" are actually those who may not be that bright, or might have such a healthy sense of entitlement, they cannot deal with a professor who demands excellence from them. Really enjoyed the class!

Out of all the professors I've had, I think I've liked Andy the best. However, he simply won't put up with people who are in a class for an easy A. If you apply yourself, do the work, and don't act like a total idiot, you'll be fine and most likely really enjoy the class!

I got the sense this class was much easier than his actual German classes.  As long as you show up and take some decent notes an A should be no problem.  He's very humorous, the only thing I had against this guy was he was pretty dominearing and I got a 9/10 for participation even though he didn't know anyone's name.  How'd he figure that?-no idea

I thoroughly enjoyed his class and learned a great deal.  He encourages independent thinking and gets the class involved.  He is very witty, and sarcastic at times, especially when people ask out of context questions or fall asleep in class, but I think it made the class even more enjoyable.  He is also very affluent with German culture.

He knows his stuff, but he is a jerk. It sucks that he has to be so arrogant and disrespectful to his students, it also sucks that many times he feels he needs to talk about things that don't have much to do with the class, and if you happen to disagree with his opinion, he will go out of his way to "shut you up" in his class.

He comes across well at first, but once you take more classes with him, you get to see his true side.  Some students do like him, but he makes enemies with other students who disagree with his far left agenda.  He's also the moodiest professor I've ever had.
Dedicated and hard working, willing to help if you're willing to learn.
Dr.Spencer is a very good lecturer, always interesting. He's really funny too. He is very helpful at his office hours. Not cuddly, but nice. The work was hard, but very fair for this level of German.

If you are a student, you are beneath him. He is generally unwilling to talk with students and they are usually treated with no respect inside and outside of class. Fairly intelligent person, which one has to respect and he is passionate about the subject matter. Assignments are difficult for no other reason than you do not know what is expected.
No Comments

I have yet to have a British professor at OSU who I didn't like--I don't know what it is. His humor is very dry, and if you're ever the butt of one of his jokes, take it in stride, he's just trying to keep everybody interested. Very smart, good level of difficulty.
very intelligent prof with great dry sense of humor.

His sarcasm makes class interesting and fun, and his interest in the subject matter gets students interested.  Those who say he's mean are just ****'s that can't take a joke.  However, German 301 is a **** because of the amount of work required...that's more than likely why people are bitter in their comments.

Taking a course on German Literature with Andy Spencer will turn out to really be "Marxist Political Ideology."  He's a total left-wing fanatic and doesn't know how to separate that from his classes.  He is also touchy, and if you happen to disagree with him, he'll shut you up.  Not the idea of a professor who promotes a diversity of ideas!

Make sure you do the readings and have your text in class.  Make sure you know exactly what he expects on assignments, and talk about what you are planning to do if you are not sure.  I know people who got As.
Very interested in teaching. Highly interactive class. Mistage forgiving and a great educator.

He is very knowledgable about the subject matter, and teaches in a very attention grabbing manner.  He is sarcastic, which makes lectures worthwhile.  Stay on his good side and you will not have to endure his wrath ;).  Those who say he does not "give" A's out may not have put forth enough effort, as I "earned" my A.

He acts like you are a waste of his time.  He tells you that he doesn't give out A's, because an A means you are perfect and nobody is perfect.  Don't take his class, he makes your life miserable.  He has no respect for anybody.

extremely rude, no respect for students, sexually harasses female students in suttle but obvious ways w/ rude comments, doesnt care if students are learning in 299, doesnt understand historiography, or how to teach history, gets all history from first source he picks up, including tourist brochures
Definately the best proffesor I've had since i've attending this university

Great prof!  Two tests, One 2-3 page paper, and another 5-7 pager, but all were graded fairly... I even got 100% on the midterm!  Very knowledgable and motivated about all aspects of German culture: art, cinema, literature, music, etc.  British accent is cool too.
horrible, horrible, horrible person and teacher
He was very nice and articulate in this class.  However I should mention this is an easy English-language course.
Definately knows his stuff, but the class format just didn't seem to work for some reason. Do all the reading, and you're fine, though.
extremely rude and has no respect for many of his students
Great Professor.  Very Difficult material at times, but the sarcastic humor is worth it.  It is with the highest regards that I recommend him.  Keep up with the work though!
Awsome class, taught with great knowledge and passion for material.
Intelligent, has a decent sense of humor, but is quite difficult and can be degrading and pompous at times.
Can be tough at first.  Focuses on what class is weak in.  Keep up and he's great.
No Comments
Difficult material, great teacher
Apparently thought it necessary to have a final paper, a written take home AND an in class final.
Interesting class, hard tests, beautiful accent

SEI.Subject: ARTSSCI
SEI.Class Name: Arts and Sciences Survey: Arts and Humanities

SEI.Subject: GERMAN
SEI.Class Name: Texts and Contexts II: 20th-Century German Language, History and Culture

summary_comment: Professor Benedetti is highly regarded for her engaging and creative teaching style, making her courses enjoyable and accessible. Students consistently praise her patience, understanding, and dedication to helping them succeed, often noting her exceptional niceness and fairness as standout qualities.
summary_comment_short: Professor Benedetti is highly regarded for her engaging and creative teaching style, making her classes enjoyable and memorable. Students consistently praise her patience, understanding, and genuine care for their learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Very nice.  Interesting.  Creative.  Charming.  Patient.
I took Criticizing TV as my second writing. She made the course fun and enjoyable.

Christina didn't speak Italian as well as some of my other Italian TA's, but she worked just as hard. She was very understanding and accomodating to me (I was going through some rough times during that quarter and had to miss class a lot).
Awesome teacher. Im disappointed she had to graduate.

Nice, sane and not vindictive.  Really cares about the students.  Always available to help people who ask.  I think she gets more kudos from the students than do all the other Italian 101-104 instructors.  Some of these same instructors never cease to be offensive, but Cristina wins the prize for niceness.
very nice and helpful and fun.  fair grader.  you can tell she really likes Italian.
Sie ist super. Seine Vogel fliegt gern!

summary_comment: Professor Basch is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, described as sweet and exceptionally effective in her role as a German 1101 instructor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Basch is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, characterized by warmth and effectiveness in instructing German 1101. Students find her approachable and engaging, contributing to a positive learning environment.

Ratings.comment: She was so sweet and an awesome German 1101 teacher!

summary_comment: Professor Bechhold, known as JJ, is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching skills and caring nature. Students praise his ability to make learning fun and engaging, breaking down complex concepts in an understandable manner. His dedication to student success is evident through his willingness to go above and beyond to assist them, though the course involves significant testing.
summary_comment_short: Professor Bechhold, known as JJ, is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, making classes engaging and fun while fostering a supportive learning environment. Students praise his passion for teaching, his willingness to help, and his ability to explain complex concepts clearly, though they note that while homework is minimal, there are frequent exams that are not difficult.

Ratings.comment: JJ was the best instructor I've had. He is truly caring and kind, he made classes extremely fun. He made me feel excited to learn as he is very expressive and entertaining. He also explains concepts very well. Super understanding and accommodating. Little homework but a lot of exams, which aren't difficult.

John Bechhold, JJ, is the best professor I had all of college. He is passionate about teaching and makes learning fun. I had him for ASL 1101 and 1102, I wish I could have him again for 1103. He cares about his students and is always willing to go the extra mile to help you. He made learning a new language fun and lectures were always engaging.

I WISH JJ was teaching my section of ASL 1103 next semester. This class was so fun and JJ was an amazing professor. He truly cares about students and their well-being and is always willing to help. He made class interesting and I learned so much from him beyond just ASL vocabulary and syntax. This is what a foreign language class should be like.

JJ was an amazing instructor. It can be scary trying to learn a new language and step out of your comfort zone but he made it a fun environment. I was excited to go to class even if it was early in the morning.
JJ is awesome. He's very ready to help students, and makes learning easy and fun. Get ready to take tests, that's most of what your grade is.

J.J. was an AMAZING professor. He truly cared about his students and their wellbeing. I would love to have him as a teacher again. He broke everything down and was very compassionate with anything that would happen.
Amazing professor! Cares about his students and wants you to learn. Attendance is not mandatory but is important if you want to do well in the class. Would 1000% have him as a professor again.

summary_comment: Professor Welch is known for her high standards and challenging curriculum, which significantly tests students' understanding of the material. While some students find her approach engaging and her office hours helpful, others struggle with the lack of clear guidance and the difficulty in finding assignments. Despite the challenges, many appreciate her commitment to improving their writing skills and overall academic performance.
summary_comment_short: Professor Welch is known for her high expectations and challenging curriculum, which significantly tests students' understanding of the material. While some students find her approach engaging and her office hours helpful, others struggle with the lack of clarity in assignments and the confusing organization of course materials.

Ratings.comment: I was so confused during her class. Her Carmen page was a mess and it was so difficult to find my assignments. Was having a pretty bad mental breakdown during the semester and when I tried to communicate that with her, she couldn't have cared less. You have a two test every two weeks, a technical exam one day and a written portion the next.

Pretty sure Dr. Welch is the Course Coordinator, so she definitely expects a lot from her students. The class was definitely very challenging and she is a tough teacher, but you really learn the material after the fact.

Yeesh. This class was tough and Im normally a good Spanish student. Its hard to tell what she actually wants from an assignment. The guidelines for the compositions are specific yet vague. I was always confused and she hides reading assignments and homework in her lecture PowerPoints so if you dont get to that slide in class you wont know.

I've never been so confused in a class before. There's really no lectures, just powerpoints with sentences and you fill in the blanks from the knowledge of several Spanish courses past Tests are seemingly easy, but when you get them back your essay will be covered in pen markings. No grades entered, hid assignments in announcements, just so so bad.

Homework and attendance are optional. The only real grades are the 4 exams and 4 essays. Worst exam grade is dropped. 2 attempts/essay and the final grade per essay is a false average (add 7.5% to the lower score). If you don't do the homework, at least go to class so you can practice for the essays. She is hard to please, and it's hard to get an A

Dra. Welch is simultaneously one of the most difficult, yet most engaging professors I have ever had. She has very high expectations for writing; an essay could answer the prompt and be grammatically correct, and you could still get a B due to writing style. She makes herself very accessible, and her office hours are very helpful!

What a genuinely amazing professor. It's rare at a big school like OSU to connect with a professor, but Dr. Welch really cared about our class and wanted us all to succeed as individuals. She's a tough grader, but only because she wants your writing to actually improve, and if you try hard in this class it will!

Wonderful professor and human being. She connected well with our class and genuinely cared about our well being and success. The assignments are very clear, and she offers rewrites to boost your grade. I am unsure of what grade I have in the class because she doesn't often use Carmen, but from my grades I see on papers, I think I'm doing fine.

Dr Welch is fairly tough prof, but you'll learn a lot. (Took it Fall 2018). This class doesn't require a crazy amount of time, but you must do the readings, come to class, and do the prep for the in-class writings. She sets pretty clear expectations beforehand, and she has you do rewrites outside of class so you can raise your grade, too.
She gives very good feedback on writing. DEFINITELY the hardest Spanish class I've ever taken but also the one that I've seen the most growth in. Has very high expectations, but they can be met.

It was like being back in high school again. Very structured course that demanded a lot of my time. She really wanted people to come to her office hours and looked down on you if you didn't make the time to go to them. Was kind of snarky and I think it's overrated here on this website how much she actually helps people improve their writing.

Dra. Welch is an excellent professor. Truly cares for her students and puts in every effort to help them succeed. The class itself is difficult, but she does an outstanding job in preparing you for the exams and the essays. My Spanish abilities greatly improved by taking her class. Visit her office hours for help, she is a very cool person too

Dr. Welch is an awesome professor, who really cares about her students! She makes time to meet with students outside of class and gives great feedback. Assignments/tests can pile up but with her feedback it is definitely possible to do well The ESL service learning project she does with the class is really cool and I enjoyed participating.

Dr Welch was a wonderful professor! She very clearly cared about her students and was always willing to help. The class is tough but if you put in the work it is very doable. This is probably the hardest Spanish class I've taken yet but I enjoyed it nonetheless.
This was the first Spanish class I really had to study. Dra Welch has high expectations, but will help you reach these.

Loves teaching and helping students. Take advantage of her help. The class is demanding with tests, compositions, and re-writes all semester but the class can be easily passed with a little work and willingness to receive help. She gives a lot of tips in class so don't miss!
Great teacher. She knows what she's talking about. Very hard grader. She expects a lot. After you get the hang of it it's fine.

Dra. Welch wrote the book for this class, so she is very knowledgeable. I didn't really like her as a person, but I think she was generally good at teaching the material. There was a test almost every other week plus four written compositions so it is a lot of work. Grading is tough, so make sure to take advantage of chances to get points back.

Each "test" is an essay, a mini essay, and a grammar portion. Meet with her to eval. each, she'll be there to help! HW not officially checked, some of it is on test though. Will not let slide little things that past prof'steachers  have (like starting sentence with "Porque"--it's "como").

Really great teacher- knows what she's doing and extremely willing to help! Go to her office hours and she will help you out a lot! The class is a lot of work but she will help you succeed if you seek it out.

Jill was a fantastic teacher. She not only made herself VERY available, but she created an entertaining and engaging classroom setting. Sometimes I was overwhelmed with the amount of "pruebas" we had, but they were never that difficult if you studied what she told you to. Don't listen to the people that said bad things about her. She's great :)
Very nice. Very helpful

She was a great professor. Indeed, she has high expectations (I worked very hard to get an A-), but students are forced to bring themselves to her standards and to really improve. She works hard to make classtime interesting, and I really respect and appreciate her. Good to take if you actually want to learn.
She was extremely helpful in office hours, but had very, very high expectations and didn't always convey specifically what she wanted from each paper. Really nice though.

Alternately helpful and frustrating. Has high expectations, which is great because it forces you to work harder and improve. These expectations are quite often murky, however, and it is therefore difficult to satisfy her, which is frustrating. Tough grader but cares about her students/wants them to get better.

Not an easy class, but very well worth it. Make a good impression during the first few days and particpate in class; then she will become less intimidating. She is a tough grader, but very helpful if you reach out to her. This is the first class I felt like I actualy walked away with improved spanish.
She was an excellent professor! I'm going to miss her in my future classes. She was a sweetheart.

Dra. Welch wasn't bad.  The key is to understand what she wants, and then it's just a matter of grammar and stuff.  She will always help you out in office hours too.  She can be intimidating, but don't let it scare you.  I didn't participate much, still got an A.  In the end I think she's a nice lady that just wants to help you learn-- and I did.

Fair teacher. Very nice and interested in helping her students but as previously mentioned, she wants so much information packed into a small space for the essay that you can't really make her 100% satisfied. You make the changes she asks of you and then she finds more mistakes to correct.

She is a great teacher, always willing to help outside of class. I enjoy the class but the tests and essays are difficult because she expects above and beyond of your writing skills. Sometimes I can't even write how she expects in English! Nevertheless, she is very kind and loves to get to know her students.

This was easily the worst class i have ever taken. Sra. Welch grades in an extremely subjective and harsh manner. Many of her comments are simply opinions and the grades are very harsh. If you want to receive a good grade and learn Spanish do not take her class.

She is a very nice woman but her essays are nearly impossible. She wants so much information in so little space that it's impossible to please her. The grading doesn't appear to be based on good grammar or writing. It is based on whether or not she simply liked your essay or not. At times it is unbelievably difficult to figure out the homework

Hands down the best Spanish professor I've had thus far at Ohio State. I feel my writing skills, grammar, and vocabulary all improved an AMAZING amount in just one quarter. From what I understand there is more work required in her class than other 403 classes, but if you are actually interested in getting better at Spanish I HIGHLY recommend her.

If you?re willing to work harder than any previous Spanish class, and your goal isn't an automatic ?A,? but rather improved writing skills greatly, then I would recommend Welch. If you?re only concerned about the grade, or if you cant invest a lot of time to this course, then other professors are known for giving higher scores on first drafts.
A challenging teacher, but definitely worth the effort! If you actually care about improving your writing, take this class. Attendance is mandatory but classes are interesting.

The work was fairly challenging but Sra. Welch was a really great teacher and helps a lot on  the papers, we got the opportunity to rewrite all of our essays for a higher grade.  This class definitely helped improve my Spanish writing.

While the course was difficult in the beginning, over time my grades improved and my writing improved as well. Profesora Welch definitely helped me become a better writer in Spanish and the assignments are pretty interesting too. This course was definitely harder than H401, but definitely worth the extra effort.
While overall a good course, her paper assignments sometimes lack clarity and her grading is very subjective. Picks favorites. She is the author of the textbook that we used in class.

JKW is an amazing teacher who is always available to help her students.  I feel like my Spanish writing greatly improved over the quarter, in addition to my grammar.  If you have the opportunity to take any class with JKW, do it!

The class was more work than 401 (not a ton), but it was well worth it.  I feel like I actually wrote good papers and my grammar/vocabulary seemed to get better along the way.  She is always willing to help.  If you want to feel like you accomplished something over the quarter rather than just reusing the skills you already had, take Welch!

Prof. Welch really wants you to succeed. It's not an easy class, but she will go out of her way to meet with you or extend deadlines to help you out. People may say she has favorites, but she will put the exact amount of effort into helping to you as do in your work. Can be picky on grading, but as she says, the more she writes, the more she cares.
JK Welch is a great teacher.  She's very accomodating and goes out of her way to help her students succeed.  She demands quality work, but is always available for help.
I was amazed at how much I learned in one quarter.  Her class was truly a pleasure, highly recommended.
Kind and understanding. Comments very helpful. Loved her class and would definitely go back!
Grades very very subjectivly. She has her favorites and if you are not one of them it will reflect in your grade.

Great prof. Really wants all of her students to succeed and doesn't get frustrated when students don't understand and she has to explain things several times. It was easy listening to her and I thought she graded really fairly.

Prof Welch was one of my better professors. She was always willing to answer questions during class and answered them quite clearly. She drops the lowest two quiz grades but the midterm and final are hard. If you are looking to improve your Spanish alot then take her but be advised she can be challenging and makes you think critically about Spanish

She has her favorites and if you're not one of them, it reflects clearly in your grade. I got an A because I knew my stuff, but I could tell she didn't like me at all. She grades very hard too. I compared my grade to someone who wrote an essay worse than mine and she gave that person a better grade. Also, she's not very clear

absolutely loved Jill, she is a very challenging teacher who encourages students to think for themselves.  You need to be enthusiastic and interested in learning.  She is by far the best Spanish prof. I have had within the Spanish department.  If you go to her office hours she is always willing to help, also ask good questions during class for help

Dr. Welch is one tough cookie!  If you genuinely want to learn, she will be there to help...but if you are not willing to work, you might as well not take this class.  It is very challenging but I believe I will be happy to have had her as a teacher once I'm finished because I am learning a ton!

She challenged students in their writing but at the same time gave multiple chances to bail yourself out from the projects that went bad by accepting multiple drafts, which really helped out the grade.  She's friendly and funny, but if you're not serious about putting in the effort and you don't give a****, then stay away!!!

She isn't bad and she isn't good. She genuinely loves what she's teaching and that's nice. Midterm was ROUGH so study hard for it. Definitely has favorites but not being one didn't seem to hurt me too much. The more funny and ridiculous your group projects are, the more she will like you. You get the grade worthy of your effort in and out of class.
J K Welch sucks. If she doesn't like you, then that'll reflect on your grade. Avoid if you can. She doesn't really explain what she expects on writing projects so good luck trying to please her.

Even though I got high grades of quizzes and tests, (95 and up) I still got a B+, because of project grades. VERY subjective. Plus the class sucks, it's a rehash of AP Spanish. Plus most of the other kids suck at Spanish.

Candyasses and those with big, fragile egos, stay away.  Anyone who really genuinely wants to learn Spanish and learn it well, you will love Jill Welch.  She's friendly and accessible, and she knows what she's doing.

Makes up her mind about your grade based on first impressions.  She knows her stuff but doesn't relate it well.  I went to her office hours, she NEVER seemed interested in helping me understand, only proving why what I did was stupid. Overall a very smart lady but extremely self-righteous and not interested how students fair in her class. AVOID!!

She's the absolute WORST teacher I've ever had. In class she teaches you absolutely NOTHING and then she makes up crazy stuff on the tests. Every activity was ridiculus and she makes up her mind about you before you even get a chance to prove otherwise. Her class is graded a lot on projects which basically means whether or not she likes you.

She is nice person but doesn't know how to teach effectively. Ex: Says one thing & does another, I was ill for several days (and I talked to her about it) but she STILL lowered my grade (I talked to her after she posted grades but wouldn't raise my grade), interupts u when u say an error.

Good teacher, cares about students and very willing to help. Only one major problem... she grades assignments strongly by opinion not necessarily by quality. (i.e. if she doesn't like the theme of your writing, you're getting points knocked off even if it's well written)

Dr. Jill Welch is awesome. In the 5 years that I've been at Ohio State, she is one of my favorite teachers. She is always willing to help out and she has a great sense of humor- I have never felt intimidated by her. She also wrote an awesome letter of recommendation for me.
One of my favorite professors.  If you show interest in learning the material, she will go out of her way to help you.  Learned a TON.
Amazing and helpful

It is a privilege to have her in class. You learn a lot more from her regarding grammar than most other instructors. However, nothing will ever be good enough when she grades your project. She has her PhD in grammar.

If you have a chance, or should I say the privilege of having this professor instruct you, you are lucky.  She is one of the best professors I've ever had.  As far as grading goes, if you put the effort and time in, your grade will reflect that.
She's nice and funny, class is enjoyable but can be discouraging because she's very strict in her grading.
Good prof, but grades hard. She is really nice though.
VERY NICE, but very difficult grading. She really cares about her students, and is helpful to students who go to office hours. But she has a PhD in Spanish Grammar. Nothing is ever good enough.

summary_comment: Professor Brintlinger is highly regarded by some students for her passion and engagement in the classroom, despite her challenging and demanding approach, which includes extensive reading requirements and strict grading. However, others find her classes difficult to enjoy due to snarky comments and a perceived lack of flexibility regarding the pandemic. Overall, her courses are seen as intellectually enriching but require significant effort and dedication.
summary_comment_short: Professor Brintlinger is highly regarded for her passion and depth of knowledge, though her teaching style can be challenging. Students appreciate her dedication to student success and the high value she places on engagement and learning, but some find her classes demanding and her comments sometimes unhelpful.

Ratings.comment: The course is incredibly interesting yet the professor made it difficult to enjoy. She clearly had too much time on her hands and would leave snarky comments instead of valuable criticism. She is not very understanding about the pandemic either. With that being said, the course was incredibly easy if you focus on the work and ignore her.

Very easy class bi weekly quizzes that you can do well on without watching the lectures. Weekly discussions also that are a majority of your grade, answer three questions and respond to two people extremely light course load.

This class was so boring. I would sit for an hour and a half while my life withered away. Not to mention she is extremely scatter brained and awkward. Also grades extremely hard for no reason. Definitely do not take this clsss if you need a literature GE

Dr. B is easily one of the best professors I've ever had and this was my favorite class I've taken at OSU. While there was a lot of reading (which is expected in a literature course), she knew when there was too much and was willing to move deadlines as needed. She took a personal interest in her students and was accommodating to personal problems.
Brilliant and accomplished professor who really cares about what she is teaching. Lectures are interesting. She expects participation. Very engaging. Highly recommend!

Professor Brintlinger's honors Russian literature class has been my favorite OSU class thus far. She expects a lot from discussion and papers, also asking you to read 100s of pages of literature before class, but I have learned so much. Be prepared for class and be willing to ask for help and you will love this class

Lots of reading, but that's to be expected in a lit course.  Pop quizzes over the readings; much more so towards the end of the semester.  She was a tough grader on papers and exams but fair.  Class discussion did not usually cover the books, instead she basically covered the background history or Russian.

Brillant, passionate professor; great at guiding discussions.  Provides many opportunities to get feedback and to grow intellectually. She cares SO MUCH about her students; she wants them to succeed!  I don't take classes for easy A's, I take classes to learn as much as possible; these are the kind of classes Prof Brintlinger teaches. Fantastic.

Very enthusiastic. Goes off on a lot of tangents without meaning to. A little scatter brained but knowledgeable and gets most of the information out. Only tests on what she has covered. Hard to follow sometimes.

Very enthusiastic and kind.  Get on her good side early on and you will notice you have her favor in class discussion and on tests.  She made the final optional and presented everyone their grade prior so they could weigh their options.  Highly recommended.

Good instructor, enthusiastic, however if she really really likes you and your analytical thoughts in class and what you bring to discussion and you miss class due to legitimate reasons, she berates you heavily for it.  Analytical people, beware.
Class time doesn't really add much or enhance the literature you've read.

I really enjoyed the class. It shows that Angela is very enthusiastic. She does give a lot of reading however, but I didn't think it was hard to keep up. Most of the class is discussion based, with 3-4 short essays, and a final.

I read these comments before taking the class, and was expecting someone entirely different...she was very insightful and I received better grades on papers every time than I normally do in other literature classes.  I didn't even do all of the reading.

The class was hard, but she was a big help during office hours and I saw big improvement between my first and second exam. Going to every lecture is essential; she gives out extra credit on exams based mostly on things she mentioned in class. I would recommend her, but only if you can keep up with the reading.
A 19th century Russian Literature course.
Pedantic and condescending.  What else can I say?  Don't ask her for any help with papers because you will have to write exactly what she wants.  Just avoid.
No Comments
Good lectures, but plays favorites with grading and in classes.  Really helpful with students she likes, impossible grader for those she doesn't.
Great prof!  I loved her class!
No Comments

SEI.Subject: RUSSIAN
SEI.Class Name: Vodka in Russian Society and Culture: Deconstructing Myths

SEI.Subject: SLAVIC
SEI.Class Name: Slavic Literature, Film, and Cultural Studies Professionalization Forum

SEI.Subject: SLAVIC
SEI.Class Name: Introduction to Slavic and East European Studies

SEI.Subject: SLAVIC
SEI.Class Name: Proseminar in Slavic and East European Literary & Cultural Studies

SEI.Subject: SLAVIC
SEI.Class Name: Introduction to Slavic and East European Studies

summary_comment: Professor Anagnostu is known for his rigorous and demanding teaching style, particularly in his General Education course, where students find the material challenging and the tests highly detailed. Despite his passion for the subject and willingness to engage with students, the lack of clear communication regarding grades and the extensive reading load contribute to a difficult learning experience. Students appreciate his genuine interest in teaching and his supportiveness during office hours.
summary_comment_short: Professor Anagnostu is known for making General Education classes extremely challenging, with detailed lectures, substantial reading assignments, and difficult tests that require memorization of specific details. Despite his passion for the subject and willingness to engage with students, the class structure and grading system can leave students feeling uncertain about their performance and overwhelmed with the workload.

Ratings.comment: SO HARD FOR A GE. If you love yourself dont take this class. You dont know your grade, lectures so boring, lots of reading, and tests are so hard. Have to remember specific details. Just dont take it.

He's definitely a nice guy. Biggest problem with him is the fact that he makes a GEC class WAAAY too hard. e does not post anything to Carmen making you feel like you are in the dark with regards to your grades. Plus the exams are short answer so the kinds of minuscule details you have to remember to score well is ridiculous.

Really cares about what you take from the class. For the final paper I asked to do something different than the original prompts and he was really excited to see what I would do with it. Being that he is teaching about his own culture he is very passionate and it helps make the long lectures not so terrible.

Excellent prof. - truly passionate & cares for class. Only had a midterm & term paper plus a final exam, so manage time wisely. No textbook - all readings on Carmen. Classes are lecture based; towards end of quarter, he had more class participation. His office hrs are helped and he's a really sweet guy. We watched films and documentaries as well.

There is a few hours of reading for each class, but it is generally interesting. The midterm and final were both hard, but he was very generous on final grades. There is a term paper that takes a bit of time as well. Overall a great guy who is passionate about his subject.

Takes the class way too seriously for a GEC credit. There is a lot of reading to do for almost every class period. There is a term paper and also a final at the end of the quarter, so if you aren't good with time management you might be in trouble there. He is very passionate about the topic, but the material is a bit dry.
Interesting class but grading was very peculiar, I really didnt know how I was doing until the quarter was over.
he's a great guy, geninuely interested in teaching-  you have to attend his class to hand in notecards but he's very straight forward and should be an easy A or A- for most
No Comments
I thought he was great.  Yes, he took the class very seriously- but his passion for teaching his culture was a refreshing change from the profs who put me to sleep with their monotonous lectures.
nice guy. overall interesting class BUT he takes the class TOO serious! too much reading and expects participation, too strict on attendance! (give me a break it is just a GEC class)

summary_comment: Professor Lechintan is highly regarded for her supportive and caring approach, often described as the "sweetest" and "nicest" professor by her students. She assigns nightly, though easy, homework and emphasizes attendance and participation, which can significantly impact grades. Her classes are generally considered manageable, with some noting they improved their French skills substantially.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lechintan is highly regarded for her supportive and caring nature, making the class accessible even for those returning to French after a long break. She assigns daily homework that is straightforward and emphasizes attendance and participation, which some find crucial for success in the course.

Ratings.comment: Hadn't taken french in 3 years but she was super helpful for all of us. Does speak in French for basically the whole class which is a little bit intimidating but it isn't that terrible. Homework every night but it's easy and all the tests are online.
She is super kind and very respectful. I hadnt taken French in a long time but she made it easy to step back into it. She really puts in a huge effort and is incredibly patient.
Great teacher, easy A if you do the homework and show up to class.
Adela is the nicest professor I've had at OSU so far. The class was relatively easy and she didn't grade very hard. The only catch is she grades heavily on attendance and participation

Adela is probably my favorite professor at OSU. She's super caring for all of her students and does whatever she can to help with any difficulties or issues that you are having in the class. She brings in treats sometimes and has fun activities to do in class. She's also super flexible and understanding. A++ professor. She's awesome, TAKE HER!
She's the sweetest lady I've ever met. SO helpful and tried her best to make the class easy. Brought us cookies for Halloween. She's the best.
such a sweetheart. the class was demanding at times-an essay was required at least once a week, but overall, it improved mt french greatly. available for help and very understanding.

Really good professor. I thought she made the class extremely easy, BUT make sure to attend since particpation points count. She was really nice, spoke clearly, and always helped you if you needed it. Overall, I thought it was a pretty good class.
Great instructor! Extremely helpful and a very fair grader; her class is a lot of fun; participation is very important so volunteer as often as you can and don't miss class.
COMENT
Super cutie!!
Always willing to help. Just ask. She is very interested in her students. And she's definitely not bad looking either...just make sure to pay attention to the MATERIAL in class! ;-)
No Comments
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Torrini-Roblin is highly regarded for her kindness and care towards her students, making the learning environment enjoyable and supportive. Despite the substantial amount of homework and frequent last-minute changes, students appreciate her enthusiasm, clear passion for the subject, and willingness to help, noting that these factors contribute significantly to their understanding and success in the course.
summary_comment_short: Professor Torrini-Roblin is highly regarded for her kindness and care towards her students, making the learning environment enjoyable and supportive. Despite the substantial amount of homework and frequent last-minute changes, students find her enthusiasm and clear passion for the subject material engaging and effective for learning.

Ratings.comment: She is so nice and very caring. I actually enjoyed reading the textbook she uses and I thought it was helpful. There is a lot of homework, but I think it helps for the exam. Her lectures can be a little all over the place but the class is fun!

A very nice person! If you have a problem with the material, reach out and she'll help you. She's very forgiving on the tests (IF YOU ASK FOR HELP). You shouldn't fail this course if you try. There is a lot of homework, but it's very helpful. My one complaint is that she makes lot of last-minute changes, which makes it hard to follow.

The class is hard and lots of work, but she is forgiving on tests and the homework is always graded on completion. She's a fun lecturer, clearly cares about her students, and loves the subject material. To succeed in the class, you should probably love the material, too.

Dr. Torrini-Roblin is really personable and cares that you learn applicable french and understand its nuances based on context. Lots of resources to practice and quite a bit of worksheets to do for homework but most of it is pretty helpful.

She was very enthusiastic and well-prepared for class! We moved really quickly through the lessons so you really need to stay on top of the homework! It's not hard, but there is a lot. There's a lot of quizzes and tests but they're short and not unmanageable. She teaches grammar in a fun way so it's easy to pay attention.

Very kind and energetic in the classroom. Sometimes the high energy can be a little overwhelming if you're just trying to get through a lecture, but that's much better than a Ferris Bueller-type monotone style. She makes the class much more interesting than most could with not-so-interesting material.
Gloria is SO nice, understanding, and loves her students. Class material was easy to comprehend, and she is more than willing to work with you to make sure you achieve the best grade possible.

Gloria is soooo nice and caring and is very willing to help you outside of class. But also, this grammar class was a ton of work. We had discussion posts every weekend about newspaper articles, and a lot of cahier exercises. There were 4 quizzes and 3 tests, and a final project. I definitely learned a lot though and she made grammar interesting.

I really appreciate Gloria. I went to see her outside of class for help on several occasions, and she went out of her way to clear things up for me. Her lectures could be a bit more organized, but the content is good and Gloria is really enjoyable to have in class. Don't forget to participate! Exams are fair. Assignments are reasonable.

Gloria is a very passionate instructor and really cares about her students and their success in the course. That being said, she is really disorganized and the class is sort of difficult to keep up with. She has difficulty explaining certain things and kept us past class time. The textbook was confusing and not engaging.

Gloria is amazing!! Love her and her class. Make sure you look at the syllabus and stay on track w the homework (which aren't due until the partiels), otherwise you'll be swamped the night before and wont have time to study. Nothing bad can be said about Gloria. She's the best French prof I've ever had! Do yourself a favor and take her class.

Gloria is such a nice lady! The class wasn't easy ngl. You have 5 quizzes, 3 exams, homework and discussions. French grammar is pretty difficult and confusing but she tries her best to teach it. Make sure you don't get behind cause next thing you know the end of the semester comes and you don't have things turned it. She's very helpful. Love her!

She was political (talked about trump constantly, including in test questions) which was bizarre for a grammar class and was bad at time management. We probably spend 1/3 of the class on a good day discussing grammar and the rest was devoted to whatever nonsense she decided to talk about. She did care for her students and the class wasn't hard.

My opinion of Dr. Torrini-Roblin grew throughout the year, but I still think her blind enthusiasm is exhausting and rather annoying. Clearly knows what she's talking about, but time management was awful. Homework was ahead of the lecture all year, so you learn the material and then go to lecture (or not) to learn the same thing.

I love Gloria so much. She is a delight to listen to and she is very helpful in and out of class. Take the time to stop by after class and introduce yourself, it goes a long way. Definitely need to do all of your homework and study hard for tests or you won't get a good grade, which can be tough, but I left knowing so much more french than before.

Had her for 5101 and for 3101.  Very helpful one on one and very very willing to meet even outside of office hours.  Meet with her often and she'll remember you well! (Took courses nearly 2 yrs apart). Lectures are a scattered (she moves very quickly) so reading the book is a must.  If things are unclear though she'll very willingly help you out.

This was the last french class required for my major. I feel really lucky to have had her, even for only one quarter. She is silly, and she makes class interesting. I'd suggest her to anyone taking french.

Gloria is the best! Her class goes by so fast and is always full of laughs. She always knows how to help the students and has a great sense of humor. If you have the chance to take a class with her DO SO IMMEDIATELY!
LOVE this woman. Made class easy and fun, you'll get an A if you take it seriously and do the work.
Gloria is awesome. The class has a lot of talking and interaction and she's laid back and nice. Very easy, too.
Gloria is absolutely the best.  You can't go wrong with her.
Great professor! She is always willing to help and does her best to make a boring grammar class fun. Best French professor I've had yet.
One of the best professors at Ohio State, without a doubt

Gloria is a great teacher and lots of fun in class.  She's always very kooky and high energy which keeps you from falling asleep.  She's very good at helping people who are clearly below the comprehension level, and she's always willing to help.  I LOVED her.
Truly awesome professor.  Take all your French classes from her.
I love her. She truly cares about her students and their learning.

I loved Gloria.  She was extremely helpful and made fun french.  Although I already find French fun she makes it funner.  She expects class participation and calls you out if you don't participate.  So expect that.  If you give an honest effort and work hard you will get a good grade.  She's always available to help you too.

best professor i've had. no joke. she makes french grammar actually interesting. didn't think that was possible. take this class if you want to be engaged and interested, do a reasonable amount of work and actually learn something. do not take this class if you want a boring lecture, no work, and an easy A without learning anything. pretty simple.

This prof was extremely difficult to follow, jumping about, yelling, tangents, grabbing faces, etc. She didnt teach, we did hours of hw every night in multiple books and corrected it together in class. Every question was answered with another question. NOT RECOMMENDED! if in doubt, find someone else for french grammar.
very interesting and enthusiastic with teaching.  grading is not entirely difficult and tests are fairly straight forward.  she speaks clear french.
She makes French so fun.  She was my Autumn Quarter French teacher my Freshmen year and she made me love college french.
she does a really great job of making the class as interesting as it could be.  she was very upbeat and always willing to help.
Gloria is very high energy and interested in teaching. attendance not mandatory, know the text and get a good grade. she makes french grammer about as interesting as it could be
teacher very understanding. helpful. a lot of homework that you must do to understand the class. tests require a lot of studying. if you do the work, the class is worth it

She is one of my absolute favorite French Teachers ever. She is extremely helpful in and outside of class, plus she is a riot. I love going to her class. She is amazing, and I am so glad I have her again for this quarter. TAKE HER CLASSES

This is a hard class no matter the teacher. However, Gloria makes it as fun as grammar can be. She is incredibly helpful and patient, and easy to understand. There was a wide range of skill starting at the beginning of the class, so be prepared to work really hard if you've been scraping by with the bare minimum until now.
Very helpful and available.  She tried her best to make class interesting and interactive.  None of the assignments were tough, take home final.
Really great instructors!
Hard class, but totally worth it! Gloria is awesome, she really tries to help her students grasp the difficult grammar concepts.
great teacher.  the class was hard because there was so much material, not because of the professor.

She is AMAZGIN!  I recommend her to anyone! She actually cares about her students and gets to know everyone on a personal level. She always makes time to help out anyone who is in need!  Even though this course was super hard, she made it enjoyable. I would have probably dropped the class if it weren't for her!

She's a great teacher, really full of energy and passionate about people getting involved in participating (aka- if you want to sleep or do other things in class, don't take her!). Doesn't expect you to completely understand her and is helpful both in and outside of class with any questions. I really hope I have her again in a higher-level French.
Excellent teacher and always willing to meet outside of class to help
Very effective teacher.  Genuinely interested in the subject.  Understands that not everyone is a French major and is lenient as long as you put forth an effort.  Def. take a class with her.

I think that if anyone else was teaching this course I would hate it, but she makes it a lot of fun and I think it has a lot to do with her personality.  She is very enthusiastic and fun.  She can explain things very well and she shoud get a raise cuz my room mate is taking the same class, but her class is not as fun...it's because of her teacher..
Very good lectures.  Helps out with midterms and final.  I learned more french from this class by far than any others.

Really nice woman.  Class was kind of average.  She was like every French teacher I've ever had in high school.  Good for the outspoken happy types.  Not as good for people who just want to go to class and do their work.  She really makes you participate.

AWESOME teacher!! She is very enthusiastic and very caring about students!  She's very quirky and fun, and keeps you involved in the class.  Lenient grader. Do the homework and study for the tests and you'll get an A!
She's amazing...awesome teacher, lenient grader.  She seriously makes you want to take French forever.
Awesome teacher.  very helpful and enthusiastic.  Really wants to see her students succeed.  I would recommend any class taught by her.
AWESOME professor! She's super helpful and a very leniant grader. I would definitely take a class taught by her again!

summary_comment: Professor Terada is known for her demanding yet supportive teaching style, requiring significant dedication from students to excel. She offers extensive personal support and is highly regarded for her kindness and approachability, making class both challenging and enjoyable. Students consistently praise her as a great and helpful teacher who goes above and beyond to assist them.
summary_comment_short: Professor Terada is known for her high standards and dedication to her students' success, requiring significant study time—about four hours a day—to excel. She is described as sweet, caring, and highly approachable, offering extra help and personal connections to support her students.

Ratings.comment: If you are willing to put in the work, then you will pass. On average, you should study 4 hours a day for this class alone in order to get an A. If you are struggling with the material, Terada sensei will meet with you outside of office hours. Very sweet and caring, wants to see her students do well, and tries to get to know you more personally.

Definitely not an easy A and you spend a lot of hours studying. If you are ready to put in the time and hours, basically your life, into studying Japanese then this is for you. If you notice that you are having trouble in the first few days then drop the course or talk with the professor but if you can put in the time and effort, then keep at it.

One of my favorite teachers.  Funny and nice and I swear she's got all three JSLs memorized.  I bothered her so much for recommendations but she still helped me out with him.  Love Terada-sensee!  I wish I could have class with her again T-T

I have had Terada-sensei for the last...2 years? And she has been great. She is just the sweetest person and so helpful. She makes class very fun and enjoyable. I will sorely miss having class with her now that I'm done with Japanese language :(
Great teacher!
great teacher and super sweet lady. really helpful. other reviews says she has high expectations but i think she only expects you to do the assigned work which is OK. oh, very hot!
nice and helpful, but has very high expectations.
She the sweetest person you could meet.  She is more than willing to explain something, more than once!
Like most other Japanese teachers in the department, she's awesome!
No Comments
Very wonderful teacher; well balanced person. Everything a student could hope for.

sweet and intelligent and yes, very cute. She definately demands that you know everything assigned so be ready. Her office hours are very helpful and she's always willing to give you as much help as you need.

SEI.Subject: JAPANSE
SEI.Class Name: Level Five Japanese II: Individualized Track

SEI.Subject: JAPANSE
SEI.Class Name: Level Five Japanese II: Individualized Track

SEI.Class Name: Level Four Japanese I: Classroom Track

SEI.Subject: JAPANSE
SEI.Class Name: Level Four Japanese II: Classroom Track

summary_comment: Professor Dawson is highly regarded for her effective teaching and adaptability, particularly during the transition to remote learning. Students appreciate her understanding nature, helpfulness during office hours, and the numerous opportunities for extra credit. Her lectures are engaging, though some find them challenging, and she is known for being responsive and supportive to students' needs.
summary_comment_short: Professor Dawson is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and adaptability, particularly during the transition to online learning. Students appreciate her understanding nature, helpfulness during office hours, and the numerous opportunities for extra credit, though some find the class challenging and require strong attention to detail.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Dawson is a great teacher and is super understanding. She adapted to COVID really well, and we didn't have any issues relating to that. She gives chances to correct answers on homeworks, is super helpful in office hours, and makes the lectures interesting. Definitely recommend.

I took this class as a GE and it was super interesting and really easy. There are so many opportunities for extra credit and she is very reasonable about everything. Almost all quizzes are open-note. Additionally, Dr. Dawson responded to COVID19 amazingly, I wish all my professors responded like she did. She really cares

A really kind and fun teacher. She's the head of the LING department at OSU, so she's very knowledgeable about her subject area. The class was a bit challenging, and required a bit of memorization. Grading isn't harsh and unreasonable like most college classes. I really enjoyed her class, and learned a lot from her

Hope is a great teacher, she does a good job at making the lectures understandable. She is very understanding with students, on more than one occasion she extended deadlines due to midterms or finals in other classes.  I wont say that the class is easy, certain sections were tougher than others. quizzes and exams were online so you could use notes.

This is not solely an English linguistics class and a lot of her quiz questions revolve around other language's linguistic features, add to of the fact that she is looking for very specific answers, almost verbatim.  Guided notes are not very helpful as most of the quiz questions are based on the lecture and the slides don't have all the info.

I took this as a GE and I'm glad I did. I added Hebrew as a minor after taking this class. If you attend class it's an easy A. She gives notes to fill in and is straight forward about grading. She is also super easy to contact she will respond to your emails fast and is super helpful. Class can be boring, but she tries to make it entertaining.

I took this as a GE. I'm also a Ling major. And I honestly don't reccomend this class if you're horrid at multiple choice quizzes and tests like I am. Hope is a lovely teacher, however you really have to remember everything she says in class, because she can put anything on these quizzes and tests, which are also long. She's very nitpicky.

Hope is really nice and always willing to help. Class is boring at times but I just think it's the nature of the course. If you're looking for a moderately easy GE this is it. However, there is a project that spans throughout the semester (relatively easy if you pay attention), some online quizzes and an in-class final. Also attendance is required.

Contrary to other reviewers, I won't say this is one of the easiest GEs out there to take.. Dawson is definitely there to help you, but her lectures are hard to learn from because the way she presents the information is pretty boring. She expects you to know a lot for the main quizzes and is pretty nit-picky when it comes to the projects.

Basically all you need to do is show up for class, do the online quizzes, and actually put a little effort in the project. This class is really great! I love this professor. Honestly, I never did anything in class, I just sat there on Pinterest so I could get the attendance points. Take this class!

She is a wonderful professor! Her classes are interesting and she's always willing to help. She responds to emails pretty quickly and explains your questions in detail. Great class, and definitely possible to get an A if you put in the work!

Extremely nice, helpful and understanding. Show up, follow along in your notes, one project that spans over the course = no midterms/final. You can do it in a group or on your own - easy either way. Weekly quizzes online. Boring, but a piece of cake!

How has this teacher not gotten a chili pepper? She is definitely good looking. The class is boring, like REALLY boring, but class is real easy. Show up, and put in a little effort. Easy B+ if not A or A-
She loves what she does! She is willing to help you. Take her class.
She is very helpful and easy to talk to and always answers questions promptly. Only bad thing is sometimes in class it becomes hard to pay attention towards the end.

She is very clear and helpful. She prints off all the notes and hands them out for you to fill out as she teaches which makes everything clear to study. No midterms simply online quizzes and tests that are open note. Loved the class!
Great teacher!  Always had time to answer questions, answers emails promptly, very understanding and easy to talk to!  Content of class is very interesting too!
super nice lady.  enjoys her subject and is always willing to help.  class is a bit boring but not hard at all.
Class was pretty easy, although the project was tedious. Good teacher, even if the material was boring.
challenging class, but maybe it is because i don't really know what is happening some of the times.  writes everything on the board.
Writes everything on board
very nice, and understanding teach.  Class itself is boring if you have no interest in learning a foreign language.  NO Exams!  Which was nice.  Class is not difficult at all.
Easy B, at least :)

Class was easy but boring as hell. The two projects for the class take up a lot of time and were each only worth 10% of your grade. All the tests and quizies are online and are open books/notes. However, the questions can sometimes be picky and can take a long time to complete. Like I said, the class is easy but it will keep you busy at times.
No Comments
No Comments

SEI.Class Name: The Basics of Language for Language Learners

SEI.Subject: LING
SEI.Class Name: The Basics of Language for Language Learners

SEI.Subject: LING
SEI.Class Name: The Basics of Language for Language Learners

summary_comment: Professor Knicely is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and genuine care for his students, despite his sometimes intimidating demeanor. Students appreciate his clear explanations and dry sense of humor, though some find his initial sternness off-putting. His classes are challenging but rewarding, leading to significant improvement in Chinese proficiency, and he is known for being supportive and flexible with extra help.
summary_comment_short: Professor Knicely is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and genuine care for his students, though some find his initial demeanor intimidating. His classes are challenging yet well-explained, and his dry humor adds an entertaining element to learning Chinese.

Ratings.comment: Mr. Knicely (or should I say Shi Lao Shi) is one of the best teachers I have had. He enjoys dry, subtle humor and is great at teaching Chinese. He truly cares about each of his students. Additionally, since the Chinese classes are generally pretty small, you will get to know each student personally. A lot of work, but worth it to learn a language!

Chinese is a challenging course, for sure, but Shi Laoshi (Prof Knicely) explains the concepts well. Hes somewhat intimidating but personable when theres confusion or need for clarification. TAs, who teach the class 4 out of the 5 days each week, are hit or miss (I had two great TAs and one less-than-great one).

There are only two things you need to get an A in Knicely's class: show up to class, and take the time to prepare the material. You will notice your Chinese ability greatly improve if you do so. Contrary to his stony countenance, he is amusing (only if you take the time to learn Chinese) and a good person to know for the future.

I thought he was intimidating at first, but over time I started to really like him. He can be funny sometimes. You are pretty much guaranteed an A if you show up with a good attitude and put forth your best effort. He doesn't expect your Chinese to be perfect since he knows everybody is still learning.

Despite a stony expression he's actually very funny, although I think most students didn't pick up on his jokes  (I often found myself to be the only person in the class laughing when he made a joke) which is why they may think he's rude. He's blunt. Don't be over sensitive. Ask for help if you need it and you'll find he's an excellent professor.

Decent professor. Really rude person in general. He is definitely my least favorite professor at OSU. Not very helpful but it's okay because his class was fairly easy. His Chinese teaching is exceptional. Hopefully he'll start working on his own personal attitude. Easy A.

Classes do not have easy material, but everything is explained well and if you pay attention and put in good effort, you will get an A. I have had him for three classes and he is one of my favorite teachers at OSU.

Shi Laoshi is fantastic. He will let you know what you're doing wrong, he is always willing to help and a is very flexible with meeting times. If you're in need of help, he will arrange other times to meet with you if you can't make it. He wants his students to succeed. He is quite funny, and very entertaining to have teaching you.

I had the opportunity to spend the summer in Qingdao when Dr. Knicely was the resident for the program. His quietness and stony appearance tends to intimidate people ( it scared the hell out of me at first) but he really wants his students to succeed. He will go FAR out of his way to help students if they are willing to put the work in.
Knicely is a good teacher and seems to enjoy his job.  I see him around quite a bit, meeting with students and such.

I hated this guy. so old-fashioned. learning a new language should be fun, right? well, forget it with this guy. plus, don't expect any regard from him. he'll just stare at you. so rude. doesn't treat his students so "knicely".

Classes were very involved. You had to know what you were doing everyday when you came to class, though the material for each day was relatively little compared to other classes. Read, practice, and succeed. Knicely was interesting, helpful, funny, and sometimes rather strange. An overall good professor.

I think he is a excellent teacher. He likes people who ask questions when you dont understand something and also he likes people who know alot of differet facts about the culture and language. People say that he is intimidating but I think for the most part he is fair.

He can come across as intimidating but he means well and knows what he's talking about. Do not take this class if you don't plan to work hard. He also grades very difficultly at the beginning like others in this department but don't get discouraged because the grading gets easier if you study and show you care!
He can be a little intimidating at first, but once you get to know him he is nice and well intentioned.  He is knowledgeable.
very reasonable except he has an american accent when speaking chinese.  a nice guy with good intentions.  work hard and get on his good side and you'll be fine.
easy class , but felt grades were adjusted.  wont return most emails. must ask questions.  was not clear on quiz and writing assignments = must ask questions.
he's willing to work with students if and when they need it.  he sure doens't make the class a breezwe, but if you study, you won't have a problem
very hot
Good instructor, ask if you don't understand.
