summary_comment: Professor Parker is highly passionate about his lectures and known for his helpfulness and willingness to assist students, though some find his teaching style monotonous due to his lecturing approach. He encourages active engagement through in-class assignments and promotes a positive learning environment with humorous interactions. Grades are submitted at the end of the semester, reflecting comprehensive coverage of course material.
summary_comment_short: Professor Parker is highly passionate about his lectures and very supportive, providing excellent feedback and willingly offering additional help. While some find his teaching style lecture-only and his voice annoying initially, most adapt and appreciate his humor and facilitation of class discussions. Grades are submitted only at the end of the semester, with nearly guaranteed high marks for those who complete the work.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Parker is a super passionate lecturer and overall just a nice guy. His feedback is amazing and he is super helpful and willing to help. I actually thinks he like when students ask for further help or clarification. Although attendance isn't mandatory, there are in class assignments occasionally that can go towards participation!

Overall, pretty good. Found his voice really annoying, which sucked at first cause he is lecture only, but you get used to it. He is pretty funny and facilitates good class discussion. Never submits any grades until the end of the semester, but everything should be a 100 as long as you did it.

summary_comment: Professor Wong is highly regarded for her expertise and clear explanations of French grammar, though her classes are noted for being challenging with frequent cancellations and disorganized PowerPoint presentations. Students appreciate her fairness in testing and willingness to accommodate students' needs, but some find her demeanor somewhat distant and her communication could be clearer. Overall, many students recommend her classes despite occasional organizational issues.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wong is highly regarded for her expertise and clarity in teaching French, though her classes are noted for being challenging with frequent cancellations and disorganized PowerPoint presentations. Students appreciate her fairness in testing and willingness to accommodate individual needs, but some find her sometimes distant and unclear in communication.

Ratings.comment: She is a great professor and I highly recommend her classes!

Most challenging French class I've taken thus far. Solid amount of hw though tests are fair. Prof Wong was absent often and cancelled class a few times. Nice lady but powerpoints were disorganized and had errors almost every lecture. Class discussion is encouraged but not necessary. Appreciated group work and discussion.

Wong was somewhat standoffish and didn't seem interested in the wellbeing of the class. This was a new course concerning second language acquisition, which is one of her specialties, but I felt like she didn't commit to us. She was also curt for no reason and didn't communicate due dates as clearly as she could've.

Prof. Wong knows her stuff. Her expectations for the class are clear and not overly complicated. You'll be expected to have a solid understanding of French to generally know what she's talking about. She's very clear when she explains grammar and will let you speak English if necessary (it just won't help your participation grade).

Professor Wong is an awesome teacher. She's the department chair of French and she definitely knows what she's talking about. I had some health issues this semester, and she worked with me way more than she could have. She even wrote me a recommendation letter. Excellent professor.
Great Professor Overall. The class is pretty entertainment and she's a very fun person. Her exams and quizzes are extremely fair and she understands that her students are not yet fluent speakers.

Wynne Wong is an amazing teacher and genuinely nice person. Learning a foreign language can be difficult, but Wynne makes it seem natural. Wynne wrote the OSU French Department Textbook, so she knows what she is talking about. She is a very interesting person, and the class is enjoyable simply because she is the one teaching it. The class is easy.

Classes were fun, especially since this was French 1 and we got to learn all the fun vocabulary. She has an interesting sense of humor, but at least she HAS a sense of humor! Sometimes if you ask a question she doesn't always answer clearly, and she is hard to connect with on a personal level. I wouldn't even try. She's okay.

She presents material in a really dull way.lectures are boring and not helpful in preparing for projects or tests. She is also unhelpful, unclear and unapproachable which makes it impossible to know what's expected. I did not enjoy this class largely because of her lack of skill as a teacher and unfriendliness. Accent is hard to comprehend.

pretty good teacher, sometimes the material choice was a bit of a stretch, but overall a good teacher. french201.01 is dumb, but she is a good teacher. we could use all notes, dictionary, and books on all tests and quizzes. the final was a video project, pretty fun.

It was a new class that quarter, so I had to cut her some slack as far as preparation.  As the quarter progressed, things fell into place.  This is an interesting alternative to the literature based French 201.
No Comments

Her accent is really difficult for me to understand-definitely not what I'm used to. Class comprised of lectures, 2 oral presentations, and a paper. The lectures are fairly straightforward, but boring. Lacked organization in terms of assigning projects. I found it extremely difficult to connect with her on a personal level, even in a class of 13.

SEI.Subject: FRIT
SEI.Class Name: Teaching French and Italian at the College Level

SEI.Subject: FRIT
SEI.Class Name: Teaching French and Italian at the College Level

summary_comment: Professor Lassche is known for his thorough and intentional approach to grading, providing clear guidelines and constructive feedback to help students succeed. He maintains a balanced workload and is praised for his supportive and engaging teaching style, though assignments are required due to departmental mandates.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lassche is known for his thorough and intentional approach to grading, providing clear guidelines and constructive feedback to help students succeed. He is highly regarded for his ability to make the subject engaging and is genuinely invested in his students' learning.

Ratings.comment: He is very intentional with his grading and gives constructive feedback. Genuinely wants students to succeed and gives clear guidelines for papers.
Rob was a great professor. The workload wasn't crazy and he gives good feedback on your writing. Would definitely recommend him!

Literally so amazing! He Lowkey does assign a bit of homework and the class is mandatory but that's because of the department requirements. But Rob is very chill and funny. He also genuinely wants you to learn Spanish and himself is super smart.

summary_comment: Professor Campbell is highly regarded for her passion and dedication to teaching French, making the subject engaging and effective for students. Her classes are known for their supportive and enjoyable atmosphere, with a strong emphasis on participation and regular homework that enhances learning. Students consistently praise her kindness, feedback, and genuine care for her students' success.
summary_comment_short: Professor Campbell is highly regarded for her passion and dedication to teaching French, making the subject engaging and accessible. Students consistently praise her supportive and caring nature, her ability to make the classroom environment comfortable, and her generous and insightful feedback.

Ratings.comment: Definitely one of my favorite professors at OSU. She is very passionate about teaching French so it makes it a lot easier to learn, and as long as you put in some effort you should do fine. Of all French classes, I've definitely learned the most from her class. If you have the option to take one of her classes, I would 100% recommend her.

Professor Campbell was one of the best professors I've had! She is very passionate about what she teaches and genuinely cares about her students. There's quite a bit of busy work, but all of it is interesting and straightforward. Participation matters, but she makes her classroom a very comfortable environment. Highly recommend her classes! :)

Hated having to take a language for my degree as I always struggled with learning French. Professor Campbell was my favorite professor by far as she was incredibly understanding and made the lectures engaging. Gives great feedback on how to improve and made participation seem not so scary.

Dr. Campbell was more of an assistant to the lead professor and helped a lot with grading. She is so unbelievably kind and gives amazing feedback on assignments. She is very understanding when it comes to absences as long as you have a written excuse like a doctor's note. I believe she will be leading her own section in future semesters.

I took 2101.01 Grades essays and quizzes very generously and gives lots of good feedback on essays. Homework before every class is a short reading and some questions, nothing particularly time consuming or difficult. You need to speak in class for weekly participation points and there is one group project on a reading throughout the semester.

Dr. Campbell is amazing! She is super sweet and her class was always fun! There is hw every class, but it's factored into participation points so it's not awful. She takes your feedback very seriously which is nice.

Dr. Campbell is an incredible professor. She is caring, knowledgable, and you can tell she genuinely enjoys teaching French. Daily homework assignments and participation both factor into your grade, but the class was very enjoyable and the content was great.

Absolutely loved Dr. Campbell! Daily textbook homework, but was super easy. Would 100% take it again just because she was absolutely amazing. Attendance is part of your participation grade, but since it's a language it's useful to be there every day. Mandatory attendance allowed me to not have to study for tests.

I really liked professor Campbell, just make sure you pay attention to due dates and remember that the class is very fast paced, so dont get behind. Other than that shes great and likes to teach. Shes very helpful and accommodating.

Dr. Campbell knows her way around the French language. The material was relevant, and the assignments were practical. Tests were not too challenging as long as you studied. The short paper and final project were relatively painless as well. I learned so much from her. My only criticism is that I wish she didn't speak as much English in class!

Dr. Campbell was extremely helpful and always wanted her students to succeed. Don't bother with the hard copy textbook, just do the online homework. She taught in French but if there's any confusion she switches to English quick. She made getting my language geneds super easy. Lots of extra credit, highly highly recommend.

Dr. Campbell is by far one of my favorite professors at osu. She cares about all of her students and genuinely wants everyone to understand the material and succeed. The entire class is only in French but shell switch to English whenever people are confused. Shes funny and keeps your attention the entire class. Highly highly recommend.

Dr. Campbell is an outstanding professor. She genuinely cares about each student and wants to see them succeed. The class requires a certain amount of work to be put in, but if you do the homework on time, show up to class, and study a decent amount, it is easy to get an A.
Kelly was easily one of my favorite professors ever. He class isnt difficult, shes super nice, and extremely attractive. Take her class if you can.

Best french teacher I've had. Easy grader, kind, understanding, explains tough concepts well. Speaks clear French, and in English if she senses confusion. Understands that most students take this as a GE. Expects participation, but gives lots of opportunities. Definitely take her class if you can!!

Dr. Campbell was great for this course! She took the time to make sure each person understood the lecture and was willing to answer any questions. She made class enjoyable while holding her students to a high standard. I learned a lot from her and would definitely recommend!

Dr. Campbell was the best French teacher I have had. My previous French teachers in high school were uninspiring and unhelpful, but Dr. Campbell cared about her students' learning and helped whenever she could. Weekly quizzes aren't bad and tests are fair. Dr. Campbell made French fun again!

Amazing Teacher. Sticks to syllabus, very accommodating, and understanding, fair grader, lots of group work, easy going. You have to participate to get an A but the assignments are small and test a very straight forward and easy. If you read and give minimal effort you should get an A but if you don't participate she will count it against you.

Dr. Campbell is very, very helpful. I had her for a French grammar class and she really understands how to take complex material and break it down for students. She is always willing to meet. Really nice person. I would definitely take another class of hers in the future.
loved her! best french teacher I have had. Easy as long as you go to class!

Great teacher!  She speaks clearly and is sure that we all understand what is being discussed.  There is homework, but it was never really difficult and it will help come time for exams.  Exams are easy if you pay attention.  She gives you a lot of questions and get the option to answer the ones you choose.  Highly recommended!
Loved her class with a passion. Best French teacher I've ever had (and I've had seven). She's very understanding and willing to help. Easy class, fun to be there.
Dr. Campbell was the best professor I had my first quarter at Ohio State. She was very fair and helpful, I definitely recommend her to anyone who is willing to work to keep up with her class!

She made taking the final GEC requirement manageable. There are quizzes every class but if you read you can do well on them! She grades easier compared to other French teachers. Highly recommend for French 104.03!!

Kelly is an exceptional instructor. She is extremely well-organized and structured, which I find essential in learning a foreign language. She maintains a balance of being authoritative and personable. You don't come by that often. She's a natural and I hope to have her again!!
She is very energetic every day. Very clear on what is expected. Prepares students well for tests.

Kelly is an extremely caring instructor. I have had two quarters with her and am sad to leave her classes. She cares first and foremost about the success of her students, and she does a good job making her class into a friendly environment where everyone gets to know each other.

I absolutely loved her! She really cares about her students and their understanding of the language. I never thought I would do well in college level french, but she made it very easy to learn! I would recommend her for anyone...I wish I could have all my french with her!
Absolutely love her. Very clear, and her focus is making students better in french, not trying to fail them. also very approachable for help. if you can get her for french, do it! she's the best!

An amazing prof, highly recommended!  She has a very easy accent to understand, works very well with students, & is willing to work outside of class when you're struggling (which happens with language).  She is neither a harsh nor easy grader, & wants her students to be successful & understand French.  Wish I could take all of my French with her!
Uses a powerpoint, very nice.
She speaks only in French which may seem terrifying at first but it is easily the best way to learn. A lot of speaking but it's not that bad and she isn't too picky on pronunciation.
No Comments
I would definitely reccomend her.  Her quizes are easy and she is easy to understand unlike some other foreign language teachers.  She is also very helpful.

She was very helpful and taught the material very well. The only problem is that she is an incredibly nitpicky grader. When taking the tests make sure you do not spell anything wrong and that you double  check everything. Also, compared to the other secionts of French, her quizes are alot more difficult.

summary_comment: Professor Heller is highly knowledgeable and caring, making her classes engaging and fun, though her lectures sometimes focus on personal preferences that may not align with all students' interests. Her teaching style includes frequent quizzes and in-class presentations, and while she is generally forgiving on projects, her class organization can be disorganized, leading to confusion and frustration among some students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Heller is highly knowledgeable and caring, making her classes engaging and fun, though her teaching style can be disorganized and her grading system confusing. Some students find her expectations demanding and her communication regarding due dates and assignments inconsistent.

Ratings.comment: Smart.  Thorough.  Only problem prof was always talking about doctoral graduation gowns were always superior to those of lowly undergraduates.
Prof Heller is such a kind person. She cares a lot about her students. This class was super fun and interesting, and she's super knowledgeable. Be prepared for in-class presentations!

Prof Heller is an incredibly thoughtful and kind professor. She is caring and compassionate. She assigns a decent amount of homework, but it was never overly difficult or took very long to complete. The few projects required time and work, but she was a pretty forgiving grader when it came to them.

This is not a great class. You have quizzes before every class, and attendance is graded which impacts your grade a TON. This class was so incredibly disorganized with little to no guidance on due dates or grading criteria. Took over 2 months to grade assignments. Avoid this class!

This course focused on French culture in regards to cooking, and was so fun and interesting! While there are always quizzes due before class and can be hyper-specific when addressing assignments, we get two attempts, so it's not hard to do well! Assignments vary from reading to grammar to movies, so it keeps things interesting!

I'm a French major, & I HATE this class. You teach yourself, have quizzes before every class (w/ grammar she rarely goes over), & class is boring w/ unhelpful discussions. She's SO disorganized & changes due dates w/o warning. Grading system makes NO sense. Good person, but BAD French teacher. It's not difficult, but it feels like a waste of time.
I'm a French major and this professor makes me want to quit the major. She's rude, not very accomodating, requires a lot, is disorganized, cannot figure out technology, and grades very slowly.

She's a very passionate professor and loves the subject matter. Manageable readings and quick quizzes/discussion posts. The exam isn't too difficult with written responses, multiple choice, and labeling the French map that we talk about in class. Highly recommend for a literature class that doesn't require French. Instead of textbook, good books.

She is a really dedicated professor who truly cares about our progression in French. However, I think that she taught at a higher level of French than we actually were at. Her exams were really difficult for this level of French, almost as if formulated for Native Speakers. But my French skills are much better afterward, and I am grateful for that.

Dr. Heller is a true educator. She prepares her lectures in a fashion that are told like a story, and she's inspiring the way she presents the material. She gives a good deal of work, but is willing to be flexible, but it's because she truly cares about students learning. When I found out she was teaching another class, I didn't hesitate to sign up

Prof Heller is smart, demanding, and challenges you. Lazy students who haven't learned basic math and love complaining about how a heavily weighted final paper will affect their grade more than rather insignificant quizzes won't like her but Heller doesn't care about appealing to the lazy millenial crowd. an intellectual, not an entertainer.

I never missed a class, participated in class discussions, never missed any quiz or assignment, did all the reading, got full grade in all my quizzes. My grades dropped from 98% to 85% after the final. The final was 8 pages long, single spaced, 8 font. It represent 45% of our total grade, and she expects you to remember all the 1000 reading we did.

Heller is very passionate for french literature. She is good at analyzing french texts, however will take 1.5 hours to talk about one single poem/text which can be dry and boring sometimes. We had to read a lot of difficult texts. She always goes over 5-10mins, assignments are helpful yet not much direction given. yet a very lovely lady!

Strictest attendance policy I've ever had in a class. Seemed unprepared at classes usually go over by 5-10 minutes. Boring lectures with little substance. Tried to make a literature class into a fashion class yet failed to connect the two of the connection was very weak. Lots of group projects which were more substantive than the lectures.
Her explanations are not clear and she is not helpful. She is also unapproachable. Class is very dry and boring. Assignments are not clear.

Took her class my first quarter, freshman year. I can honestly say that Professor Heller has been one of my favorites here. Class is fairly easy if you attend and pay attention. You don't really have to do the readings if they bore you. She's very entertaining and aways has the most wonderful hats I have ever had the pleasure of seeing.
Dr. Heller is an outstanding teacher. I truly wish that more professors were as fun and passionate about the material they were teaching as she was.
Class was extremely boring, class wasn't what I expected.  This was honestly the worst class I have ever taken throughout all of high school or college

class was quite boring. she goes off on many tangents and NEVER finishes a lecture on time. so info is interesting but it is alot shoved into such little time. shes does tell u tho what will be on the quizzes and the test and there is plenty of bonus which helps. alot of readings which are really boring and only a little relevant

Her lectures are very broad and not clear on what she wants you to know. Her lectures do not just focus on the time period specified in the class syllabus. She is also a horrible lecturer, it is impossible to pay attention. Do noy take this class or any class she teaches for that matter!

In her lectures she goes off on tangents, it is imp to try to focus b/c questions on obscure details mentioned in lecure will show up on tests. If you do the reading it is helpful, but not necessary to pass the tests.  Her quizes are very easy b/c she tells ahead of time EXACTLY what is on them. She gives alot of extra credit & grades easy

This class was a herd class but she was the least helpful French teacher I have ever had. She wasn't interested in helping students and she would let us know that (she didn't even give any study guides). I really didn't enjoy this class, or her as a instructor.

She is extremely vague. She's not helpful at all and will tell you to "be a scholar" if you need any help. She is a very intelligent person she assumes her students have all the knowledge about the time period we mention so lectures are important. I would advise against taking this class if you think it will "be interesting" or "fun"
a class on fairy tales that talked about history, literature, language; amazingly informative.  The class seems much harder than it actually is.  Dresses fashionably, obviously does a lot of work.

She is a good teacher but her class can be hard to follow as she can be all over the board. She is very knowledgeable and will help you but I feel that she is somewhat vague and unclear as to excpectations and subject matter.

Again, if you do the homework (readings and some short papers), you shouldn't have a problem getting a decent grade.  I was very excited about this class before I took it, but now have decided to drop the French major.  She tries to make the class as interactive and interesting as she can, but somehow fell short for me.

It's so much easier talking to her in English than French.  French class was downright intimidating sometimes.  Overall, though, if you do the work, a good grade is very realistic.  She loves when people volunteer and always can think of something good to say.

Professor Heller is a very good lecturer.  She tries to incorporate personal stories and experiences to spice up class.  If you go to class and take notes you will do well.  On the exams, simply taking good notes will allow you to answer questions correctly.

If you're looking for a good GEC, or interested in the subject, take this class.  Tests are easy.  There's a bunch of reading; you don't necessarily have to do it, but I really enjoy the subject so it wasn't tedious.  A lot of energy.  Sit near the front; she has a lot of humor and sparkle.  Awesome class.

Wow, this was the easiest class.  It seems hard when you are listening to the lectures.  And she assigned a lot of readings, but you never really have to read any of it.  she talks about the important stuff in class.  Definitely recommend this class if you want something easy.  Passed with an A
Lectures were sometimes boring or interesting. I liked her stories about Trisan and Isuet. Not a class to take much notes on but just pay attention and you will pass the class with flying colors

This class is great for people who are genuinely interested in medieval society.  For everyone else, it is nearly impossible to sit through a two hour lecture.  Its kind of hard to take notes because she just keeps talking and telling stories and showing pictures.

I had prof. Heller for a medieval lit class and she was amazing.  Very smart, very well-spoken.  She made a seemingly archaic subject very topical through interesting class discussions.  I highly recommend this prof!

She does not teach well, circles around important points without ever explaining anything. Quizzes have material not covered on them. Memorizing Latin phrases is the most important concept of this course and her translations change constantly. Very poor!
Easy class, but you have to go to it.  Kind of hard to take notes, but just pay attention in class and the exams are easy.  It almost seems like story time.

SEI.Subject: FRENCH
SEI.Class Name: Gothic to Renaissance: Texts and Contexts

summary_comment: Professor Willging is described as kind and compassionate, with a passion for teaching that makes her easy to learn from, though her classes are challenging, particularly for non-fluent students. Students appreciate her fairness and willingness to help, but some find the workload heavy and the class material not always engaging, with a focus on textbook content and participation. Overall, while many students value her kindness and efforts, there is mixed feedback on the effectiveness of her teaching methods.
summary_comment_short: Professor Willging is highly regarded for her kindness and passion, creating a supportive learning environment. However, her classes are noted for being challenging, particularly for those with less proficiency in French, and often come with a heavy workload and expectations for in-class participation.

Ratings.comment: excellent, kind and compassionate

Professor Willging was very kind and passionate about what she does. She is easy to understand and learn from in class and creates an environment conducive to learning, however, for being a 2101 class it was HARD. There were many people in my class who were fluent in French and still found that their papers and quizzes were graded too harshly.

Heavy work load out of class. Especially for a three credit hour class that most people are taking for a GE credit. Extremely long readings that are never discussed. Do NOT recommend taking this class. She is a nice person overall, but a terrible professor.

Professor Willging is  very nice and clearly cares about what she does. That being said, she relies heavily on the textbook which seemed to have no real information other than short stories and poems in french. I did not feel I really learned all that much, and I found her class to be kind of boring. She also cold calls on people, which sucks.

Prof Willging challenges her students, but she is extremely fair. You will learn a lot from her class if you put in the time and effort, but it's not unreasonable. Yes, this is upper division French, you have to speak in class, but if you speak 1 or 2 x per class and have good attendance, you will get an A. She is kind and funny. Loved her!

Professor Willging clearly cares about her students and does her best to improve their learning experience and performance in class! Participation is important in this class, but she's very kind and helps you feel comfortable answering questions and speaking. She also gives a good mixture of grammar, reading, and discussions for assignments.

Prof. Willging is the kindest professor I've had at OSU. She's always willing to explain difficult topics and she presents the material in a way that makes it fun. Exams are pretty straightforward and essays are graded fairly. Participation matters, but I have no complaints.

Dr. Willging is amazing and her lectures were really helpful and funny. She's a joy to be around. There's vocab and reading quizzes every now and then, but if you pay attention in class and do the review sheet, you'll do well. She doesn't grade too hard on the essays.

I love Mme Willging. I had a one on one with her and she let me vent to her. She is relatable and understands her students. She really loves her job as well. She is challenging but you CAN do well if you study. You MUST participate in class and take notes, she sees all. Very down to earth and knowledgable. You will learn a lot.

If you want an A in this class you have to put in the effort; read the book, write the papers, study for the quizzes. Graded on papers, quizzes and participation along with two group projects. Not a terribly hard class, but stay up to date and you'll be fine. She really does care about her students and makes the class interesting with discussion.

Dr. Willging was the best French professor I've had at OSU. The readings assigned in her course were difficult, and took quite a while to get through, but everything you needed to know for the tests was discussed in class. Exams were extremely fair and she always respected your opinion, as long as you could support it.
Professor Willging is the best.  She teaches excellently.  She is chair of the department, and does a great job.

She is a very professional woman and its clear she is good at her job. She is good-natured and very kind to students, but definitely challenges you. She is very helpful in all her feedback and really cares to make you better. she is direct and even when she is talking about abstract things, she does her best to make things clear.

She's not an easy A. I ended up barely ever doing the readings and getting by. There's a class discussion on them every class. The tests are kind of hard even with the review. I always got a B or C on them and I studied. If you're talkative this will get you far. You have to write 2 papers. She's a good prof and she's patient with everyone.

You have to talk in this class or else you'll get a horrible participation grade. It doesn't matter if you understand what everyone else is saying, you take notes, etc. You'll get no participation grade. YOU HAVE TO TALK! It's stupid. Plus her exams are hard. You really have to study for them. She thinks she's an amazing lecturer, but she's not.

I do not like this professor's methods. She is more interested in style than substance, in terms of writing. Discussions are very superficial and she expects people to know stuff that is never explained clearly. Expectations are not well outlined. Not particularly tough grader, but picky about little insignificant things. Didn't learn from her.

Prof. Willging is great. She does a good job of trying to break down complex ideas for beginners. She's also quite patient considering that she has to repeat herself a lot. I don't want to linger too much on comments about her appearance but she dresses very well, her style is nice.
I've had several grad classes with her. She's the best thing since sliced bread. And hot.
Dr. Willging was an extremely enthusiastic teacher and very patient with this intermediate-level French class.

Loved her and her class. She is genuinely interested in helping students. If you attend class and listen, her tests require little studying. She makes material relevant and interesting. Favorite professor I've had at OSU.
Great teacher, I feel like I've learned a lot from her.  Can be tough but is still fair and understanding.
Prof Willging is a great teacher, and shes super chic!
Tough, but if you give a damn or try at all, she's there for you.

Loved her class.  She was easy to understand and made lectures fun.  A lot of reading was required, but the subject matter was generally really interesting.  Tests and quizzes weren't too hard. Overall, she's a great professor, and I'd really recommend taking a class with her!

Such a great teacher. Even if you go in to the class hating French, you'll come out with at least a better appreciation for the language. She makes learning about a language interesting, and she has an amazing ability of keeping the students engaged. I definitely reccomend her!
Excellent class with hard but very rewarding books.  Definately worth taking classes from her no matter whether you are a beginner or a grad student.
she really knows her stuff
I love her!  She is one of the best professors I have had at OSU.  She's tough but fair and if you work in class you'll do fine.  I completely loved her class.

I thought this class was hard, but am I ever glad I took it! She's a very cool(& SMART) lady who helps kids who want to help themselves. She covered topics that were really interesting. Whether you want to or not, you will learn something from this prof.
She is so sweet and loves to teach.  By the end of this class I could read French soo much better!
Prof Willging is smart, funny, and can analyze literature like there's no tomorrow.  Plus she's a babe.  Learn French just so you can take her classes!

summary_comment: Professor Carrizo is known for his passion and expertise in multimedia, which keeps lectures engaging. However, his strict grading and the heavy workload, particularly with eight multi-media assignments and a final project, can be challenging. Students emphasize the importance of consistent attendance and timely completion of assignments to succeed in the course.
summary_comment_short: Professor Carrizo is passionate about the subject matter and encourages active participation, but his class layout and grading criteria can be confusing, leading to lower grades on tests unless students stay consistently engaged and seek clarification. His lectures are detailed and thorough, but the workload is heavy, particularly with multiple assignments that require significant time and effort, which can be overwhelming.

Ratings.comment: Passionate about the class and material but the layout is a little annoying. The assignments are pretty easy as long as you put in effort and pay attention during class. The tests are what brought down my grade because he did not clearly layout what would be on exams. Overall this class is not terrible you just can't skip.

Lectures could be interesting so I did not mind going to class. However, the grading criteria for projects was not properly laid out and he did not provide sufficient examples to help you understand what he was looking for. Study guides did not help much for exams. This class was only my second B in college.

If you do not attend class, you will fail this course. I missed one day and it dropped my grade almost 2 letter grades. He is big on participation, if you do not participate, he will start assigning pop quizzes. He expects you to read the materials before the lecture. He has 3 exams for us, but the study guides did not really help with them. STUDY.

Leonardo grew on me throughout the semester; he has a passion for multimedia and what he does, and cares about his students. However, though there are eight assignments, you must work on them as each takes time and effort. It can cause burnout, and the turnaround time on projects is a lot; Leonardo grades strictly as if students are professionals.

Leo is definitly a tough grader, and he love to grade everything in his own view.  So, if you have to choose his class, remember to ask him about your work and you may improve a little on your grade. 
His lecture is interesting, but you have to write down every words on the powerpoint all by your own. 
Also, in-person final exam!! Close book also.

Never met a professor less willing to work with students. Carrizo painfully takes up the entire 2-hours he has to lecture. One day he spent over an hour explaining how a tripod works. Given the 8 multi-media assignments required it is fairly incomprehensible as to how out of 11 total things graded, 2 combine for 40% of your grade.

DO NOT PROCRASTINATE! The worst thing I will say is the class is very busy, especially with a midterm project and exam along with a final project and exam. He does want his students to pass and if you go to him for help, he will try to help you. I could not have been more of a beginner in Adobe Premiere and I feel extremely comfortable with it now.

This class is straightforward. Everything is written out for you on Carmen. There are a lot of homework assignments, but he gives you everything you need to work ahead. He walks you through all the steps for photoshop projects as well. If you go to class and do the assignments, you'll get a good grade. He is incredibly knowledgeable and helpful.

Consistently has typos/grammatical errors on his quizzes/exams. Disorganized Carmen page. Have to turn into Dora the Explorer to find assignment/readings. This should be an easy class to pass but somehow he makes everything difficult and 10x harder than what it should be. His lectures are enjoyable, but that's your only saving grace.

Carrizo is undoubtedly one of the worst professors I've had, which is funny because he teaches what should be an incredibly easy and straightforward subject. Instead, he constantly lies, critiques, and stonewalls any and all assignments because he is so incredibly inflexible.

I respect his art, but he is NOT a good professor. Most of what we actually need to know for assignments is learned outside of it, on our own. The use of adobe and other applications is extremely tedious if you're a beginner. This class made me cry at least 8 times. He needs a TA, or maybe he shouldn't teach the class at all.
most boring four hours of my week, not an intelligently organized class, professor is not interesting or thoughtful

Disappointed. In such a print heavy program, I was looking forward to learning the foundations of multimedia. However, I'm leaving with only a frustration with the professor. Leo dishes out failing grades with minimal feedback. His lectures don't correspond with what he grades projects on and his exams do not test learning, but seem aimed to trick.

Among the worst profs Ive had in 4 yrs at OSU. His tests are filled w typos & grammar errorsbeyond what a language barrier couldve caused. He picks poor material to cover, doesnt explain it well, then gives 5 quizzes & a cumulative final on it. Design & written tests do not mix; the actual Design Dept. forgoes them altogether. This class had 7.

I was hesitant to take his class after reading looking at the reviews, but it was easily my favorite class I've taken in college. He is hilarious, and the projects are fun. I guess don't expect a super easy A, but his grading seemed very fair to me. Gives plenty of fair warning about the pop quizzes. Definitely disagree with most reviews on here.

I think that Leo is getting a bad rap on this site. The truth is, the man obviously cares about what he does, and he has a lot of experience to match. There are around 5 assignments that you will do for the majority of your grade. There are assigned readings, which aren't necessary if you attend class and pay attention. Don't procrastinate.

What's important to understand about Leonardo's class is foremost that it is Photojournalism based. Photojournalism, as opposed to photography is very subjective, there isn't much room for artistic expression in it. Leonardo's class is structured around this and he dose a great job of emphasizing the work required to make it the field.

He's Argentinian, and he's hilarious. Very confident guy. The toughest part about this class is that each grade is subjective, and that you can't skip. He takes attendance, but if you love this kind of subject the class really shouldn't be a problem.

Arrogant and unhelpful. We were forced to listen to a condescending turd who is more interested in hearing himself talk than teaching anything beneficial. Gives vague and unhelpful critisms/ grades harshly on every project. He clearly grades based off of his personal preferences and wants next to no individual expression in the projects. Bad class!

Rubrics are vague, grading is subjective and unjustified, and attendance is required - 10 points per class with pop quizzes. Extremely arrogant and unwilling to show specific examples of what he's looking for in a design or project, so it's impossible to know if you'll get an A. Do yourself a favor and take this course with any other professor.

Instructions on assignments are unclear; he has no grading rubric. If he doesn't happen to like your designtough luck.  Has an arrogant air about him. Easily frustrated when questions are asked, as if his tutorials are the golden standard. He is absolutely emblematic of all that is contemptible about higher education.

if you are signed up for this class, drop it and take it with a different professor.  It is impossible to satisfy this man no matter how good your completed work is.  The work you put in ends up being pointless because you will not be able to achieve the grades you deserve, especially based on the minimal things he actually teaches the class.

Leonardo says he grades his course tough because he understands that OSU's journalism program doesn't have the best reputation. Trouble is he's a big part of the problem. Lectures are jumbled and insufficient training for the quality he expects. Course only exists so the school of comm can feel better about the lack of multimedia training they give

He is not a knowledgeable lecturer. You will learn from this class by just working on the homework. Since he's a tough grader, it's not a good class to boost your GPA. He won't let you makeup for what you missed. Doesn't care much.

If you have the option to take the class with another instructor, do that. Gives pop quizzes, 2 homeworks every week, big projects, and mandatory attendance (only except if you're sick). He doesn't have standards for grading, you can meet all the requirements but if he doesn't like your design you'll get a bad grade. Doesn't explain the concept

Leonardo is very unrealistic with how much time he expects you to have outside of class to take photos.  There are many assignments and If you do not have a lot of free time outside of class, work, etc, I wouldn't recommend taking this class.  Don't expect to get an A for taking average photos, you'll have to work for it.

Leo loves what hew does, which unfortunately means that all students are expected to drop everything else they're doing and take pictures all over the city. The assignments can be hard and you shouldn't take this class unless photographing people is what your passion in life is. If that is not the case then get out while you can.
Exams weren't bad if you reviewed the lecture slides he provided. Attendance was mandatory & class was sometimes extremely boring to sit through.

Leonardo loves what he does.  He is so absorbed in his area that he thinks his students should make his class their one and only priority.  But, a little studying before exams got me easy A's.  His threats for extremely hard tests and grading turned out not to be anywhere near as hard as i was expecting from his self evaluation.

Taking this class is the best thing you can do for a journalism career. You will learn so many useful things. As for Leonardo, he knows his stuff, and is actually passionate about what he does - refreshing. He is demanding, and the class was hard, but you should take it w/ him. He is intimidating at first, but he will help you as much as you need.
Thought this teacher was very helpful and fairly clear in lectures.
If you can get past the lectures, the computer work is really interesting.  I would recommend taking this class with the other teacher though, because he designed the course.
Was not helpful one bit.  Very egotistical and did not care about the students whatsoever.  I would not recommend taking him.
Grades very fairly and presents the material in a very easy to understand manner. Cares about his students and also is very helpful in preparing you for tests. Much recommended!
Great teacher. Really wants to help the students. Highly recommend!

summary_comment: No comments available
summary_comment_short: No comments available

summary_comment: Professor Papke is known for her passion and accessibility, particularly in her linguistics courses, where she encourages student engagement and provides extra help outside of class. However, her teaching style can vary widely among students; some find her classes challenging and her responses to questions unclear, while others appreciate her dedication and humor, finding the material both interesting and fun.
summary_comment_short: Professor Papke is known for her passionate and accessible teaching style, particularly valued by students who appreciate her availability and enthusiasm for linguistics. However, some students find her approach to be dry and unhelpful, with concerns about unclear explanations and lack of immediate feedback on assignments.

Ratings.comment: At first I thought the course content was interesting. But not only was the instructor unwilling to be helpful but was actually really mean to students who need help with the course. Least kind professor ever met in osu.

Really really loved this class. The language project is making your own language, and it is as hard as you make it to be. Dr. Papke was super accessible outside of class and her passion for linguistics really shown through. Super personable.

I took her Conlangs class for the GE credit, and it was really easy and fun. Lectures were interesting and I learned a lot. Be warned--this specific class is one final project based, however, as long as you keep up with the weekly assignments, you should be fine. She was also always available to help.

Julia is really organized and conveys all the assignments clearly, and in the off chance she doesn't or you misunderstand, she gives you a chance to correct your work. She is overall really cool and really good and conveying her knowledge about linguistics, especially constructed linguistics and it is clear that she is passionate about teaching!

Dr. Papke can be dry at times, but her humor and love of the material really shows. She's always willing to help on any questions you have (and I had quite a few), and can usually be found in her office waiting for students to drop by. She won't always directly answer questions, so it's better to ask her outside of class

The class isn't easy, it is fun though. I spent the first week thinking what I'd gotten myself into by taking a GE where I didn't even understand the vocab being thrown around by all the try-hard kids. But Papke really took the time out and sat with me outside of class to help me understand. She isn't easy but if you listen to her lectures, you gud

She is absolutely awful. When you ask her a question, she never gives you a clear answer. She just keep thinking about it. She wont grade your papers til the end of the semester, and when she grades, she wont explain why something is wrong. She talks like a kid, unprofessional . You have 6 tests, 6 quizzes, participation is 10%, 4 projects

The class is such a breeze. The material is interesting enough, although the lectures can be a little long and the projects are annoying. Online take home tests are kind of a joke. Papke is kind of an odd ball, but honestly, if you have a pulse you should get an A.

Literally the worst class of my first semester! Tests are redundantly difficult and take little tiny pieces of information from the reading material to try to stump students. Lectures are terribly boring since she just teaches from a PowerPoint. She is always sidetracking and does not make cohesive understandable points. Not a good educator!
She freaks out if you even have your cellphone out and will call you out in the middle of class.

I am sorry, but Julia was not a great teacher. For a GE course, this was taught way too fast and with too little structure.. She bores you with lectures via Powerpoint and makes sure you are thoroughly confused when it comes to the tests. Her tests are generally impossible even if you give a good effort studying. NOT a fun class.

DON'T TAKE HER. I can honestly say I walked away from this class having learned absolutely nothing. I didn't like her lectures at all. If people weren't participating that day, lectures would hit a wall. She had a quirky personality that didn't fit well with teaching disinterested students. Overall, the class was a joke.

EXAMS ARE HARD! Don't take it if you want an A cause the exams are hard to get better than a C and it's worth half your grade. I liked her a lot I just thought she graded too hard, but she made the class interesting and I never dreaded going to class.

TAKE HER! She does have harder tests, but SHE WILL HELP YOU. I am not a Ling major, not even close, but if she could help me, she could help anyone.  I loved her, and all the patience and help she gave me, I will miss her! You just have to speak up in her class, let her know when you do not understand, she hates it when you dont! =)

She is annoying and was pregnant not a good combo. She is a tough grader on papers but gives no feedback. DONT TAKE HER EVER IT WILL BE THE WORST DECISION IN YOUR LIFE! plus she wears curtains to class...

Julia's a pretty tough grader on papers. She doesn't give a lot of feedback, so it's a little hard to tell what she wants. Definitely revise papers and read for class. It's an interesting class with a LOT of discussion, so be prepared for class.
Appeared (and probably was) completely disinterested in teaching the course and was unprepared most of the time.

Super easy class.  She is very eccentric, but after you get used to her, she's pretty funny and quirky.  Easy class, easy A or B if you don't feel like trying.  Super easy grader, loves when you tell stories or anecdotes, take for a good grade.

She always seemed flustered and disorganized, occasionally apologetic and typically five to ten minutes late for class. Subject matter is interesting, discussions can leave something to be desired. Her heart seems in it, but she seems constantly overwhelmed. Hang in there.
Julia's lecture notes were very clear and concise. She knew all of the material very well. Homeworks were easy and all the quizzes were online. The midterm and final were both take home.
