summary_comment: Professor Sanabria is highly regarded for her teaching abilities and genuine care for her students, though she is known for her unresponsive communication via email and limited availability for in-person meetings. Her lectures are praised for clarity and engagement, and she is particularly noted for going above and beyond to assist students, especially those seeking guidance outside their official advisors.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sanabria is highly regarded for her teaching quality and genuine care for her students, though she is known for her unresponsive communication methods and limited availability for meetings. Students consistently praise her as an excellent lecturer who goes above and beyond to help them understand course material and offers significant support outside of formal advising.

Ratings.comment: Never responds to emails. Doesn't have meetings available. Can only reach her by email, but it takes her forever to respond.

I loved Rachel! OSU is a huge school but she always remembered my name! It was about 5 years ago I had her as a counselor. I always left with hope and happiness after talking with her. I sucked as a student but never felt judged by her. Amazing energy and wonderful person.

I've never had her for a class, but I always go to her instead of my actual advisor (Schwenter) when I have a question, because she is a ton more helpful than him or any of the Spanish advisors (she's technically study abroad). She really goes out of her way to help.
No Comments
great teacher
Extremely helpful, great lecturer, but does expect serious effort on the part of the student (which is understandable).  AMAZING TEACHER OVERALL
I had her for Spanish 104.  She was amazing and truly interested in making sure her students understood the concepts very well!
She made the class very easy.  She genuinely cares about her students.  She's a human being.  One of the best professors I've had all around.
By far one of the best teachers i have ever had.  She was well organized and animated.  Her class was so fun, i didn't want to skip, even on nice days.
She is really interested in her students, she will do anything to help them. She is one of the best teachers I have ever had!! She makes the class interesting too!!
Awesome teacher! Made the class bearable. Very friendly and genuinely interested in her students. Would definitely recommend!

I had her for 103.66 and 104 and she is a great personality.  Very flamboyant and fun in class.  Makes up for some of the boredom and tedium that is getting through this stupid language requirement.  Great teacher in all ways.

She is very talented when it comes to explaining difficult concepts until her students can grasp them. I would gladly reccomend her to anybody looking for a 104 or 103.66 instructor.  It's not all easy, however, but only due to department mandates.
It's a hard class if you aren't a spanish genius...she expects an awful lot of her students.

summary_comment: Professor Bracamonte is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods in Spanish, particularly appreciated by native speakers due to her deep understanding of language learning challenges. She emphasizes practical, self-directed homework to enhance personal practice, and students strongly recommend her for Spanish courses, especially for those advancing to more advanced levels.
summary_comment_short: Professor Bracamonte is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods in Spanish, particularly appreciated by native speakers due to her deep understanding of language learning challenges. Students strongly recommend her for anyone looking to excel in Spanish courses.

Ratings.comment: When taking professor Bracamonte I really enjoyed the way that she taught spanish. As a native Spanish speaker, she understood the difficulty of speaking another language. Homework was for your own practice. When going into Spanish 1102, I looked for her as a teacher. I recommend her to anyone wanting to take Spanish.

summary_comment: Professor Aski is highly regarded for her engaging and participatory teaching style, which she uses to foster a welcoming environment. Students find her approachable and dedicated to their success, though some note that her classes require significant effort and organization. Overall, she is praised for her passion and commitment to her students' learning.
summary_comment_short: Professor Aski is highly regarded for her engaging and participatory teaching style, clear passion for her subject, and willingness to help students. However, some students found her classes demanding and occasionally disorganized, with mixed feelings about the homework and occasional condescension from her.

Ratings.comment: Take her!! I took Global Citizenship with her. she does alot of in class participation/discussions, so if you dont like that vibe the class is not for you. But other than that she is very caring about her students and makes sure everyone feels welcome.

I had Janice for Italian 1102 and she was great. She made sure that all of her students were engaged in the class and learning the language. She understood that everyone had different levels of speaking, writing, and comprehension and took that into consideration throughout the semester. She is very funny and an all around great person.

Professor Aski is incredible. It is clear she truly enjoys what she does and it shows in the class lectures. Participation is a big thing in her classes along with homework. She is very approachable and willing to help if you are willing to put in the effort to learn. The best professor I had at Ohio State!

Janice was very nice but a little condescending. Willing to help, but sometimes made you feel stupid for messing up and asking questions. The homework was usually more annoying than good practice and she was constantly messing things up on Carmen like locking assignments before they were due or not allowing any submission types, but she tried hard
Does not care for her students whatsoever. HORRIBLY organized course, would not recommend.

Professor Aski is amazing. She is so easy to talk to and clearly wants the best for her students. As long as you put in the effort for the class, she will do the same. If you are struggling with any topic she will make the time to meet with you outside of class.
Great Professor! I am excited to have her again this semester. Everything is straight forward. She doesn't trick you, and is all about you constantly using italian, for your own good.
She's awesome.

Janice is incredible. She has high expectations, but will go above and beyond to help you succeed. She is kind, brilliant, and passionate about what she does. I always laughed in class and left with a smile. Take her classes!!!

Janice is a phenomenal language instructor. I teach Spanish for OSU and took two Italian classes with her to satisfy a language requirement. I learned a lot of Italian, but I also learned to be a better teacher from her example. Also, a wonderful, extremely personable lady. Highly recommended.
I will say she is my best experience at Ohio State :)
Easily one of my favorite professors. Take one of her classes, you won't regret it.
She is one of the most helpful professors ive ever had. I was dreading taking a foreign language course but she makes me actually want to go to class! Consider yourself lucky if you get in her class.
Dr. Aski is the best. Helps to have a background in linguistics before this class, but she made sure that everyone, even those with no prior knowledge, came to understand the concepts. Great class!

By far one of the best Italian professors I have had.  Her class was always interesting and entertaining as well as challenging.  She kept you awake and alert the entire time. Incredibly helpful and is flexible in schedules so you understand everything. Take one of her classes- you won't be disappointed.
She is sometimes confused, and not friendly at all.
She expects a lot, but she will bend over backward to make sure you understand.

You better know what you're doing because she is expecting it.  Aside from that she is the most helpful and one of the nicest professors I've ever had.  Just try and make an effort and you won't have a problem.  Take her class.
I had her for a really intro romance linguistics class - great class.  Very fun, and she made it accessible to non-linguists, too.
She's one of the best professors on campus.  Do yourself a favor and take her class.  She's always willing to help if you don't understand something.
She'll terrorize your papers.  EX: on a grade sheet I got a breakdown of  A, B, B, C, C  which averaged to a 70%...ouch.  She makes class very enjoyable.
Very enthusiatic.
No Comments
She is an awesome professor.  Probably one of the best you will find at the university.  Take her class, you'll be glad you did.

She was a really good teacher. I always get kind of frustrated with language classes. It's a lot of work. But I went to her office hours a few times  and she was really nice and enthusiastic. She even invited people over to her house on more than one occasion.
No Comments

this professor is so upbeat that she is overbearing. her class was never fun, and it was overstructured and boring. do not schedule a class with her in the beginning of your day- she will ruin your day.
No Comments

SEI.Subject: FRIT
SEI.Class Name: The 21st-Century Skill: Intercultural Competence for Global Citizenship

SEI.Subject: FRIT
SEI.Class Name: The 21st-Century Skill: Intercultural Competence for Global Citizenship

SEI.Subject: FRIT
SEI.Class Name: The 21st-Century Skill: Intercultural Competence for Global Citizenship

summary_comment: Professor Corona is highly regarded for her engaging and supportive teaching style, focusing on interactive activities and small group work to foster a collaborative learning environment. She emphasizes participation and is known for her kindness and genuine care for her students' success, making her classes accessible even for those who may feel judged in other settings. Attendance is mandatory but her lectures are generally laid back and include helpful tips and feedback sessions.
summary_comment_short: Professor Corona is highly regarded for her engaging and supportive teaching style, with a strong emphasis on participation and interaction. Students appreciate her kindness, care for their success, and efforts to ensure everyone understands the material, making the class both enjoyable and effective for learning Spanish.

Ratings.comment: Maribel was an amazing lecturer and I truly enjoyed her class. Participation in small activities and as a whole in class is very important for her to give you a good grade on participation. The content was not difficult and she loves when students are trying to learn the language, it is a no judgement zone!

Maribel is such an amazing and caring professor.  Easily one of my favorite professors.  Although this class is only taught in Spanish, she does a great job at ensuring everyone is on the same page and nobody is left behind.  Participation is key for this class, but she makes it easy to participate in fun and engaging ways.

Amazing professor, she focuses a lot on speaking with your classmates in spanish which is really helpful. The exams were pretty straight forward, especially if you took lots of Spanish in high school. You get 4 unexcused absences but some people missed a lot more and I don't think she cared that much. My favorite class I took last semester.

Professor Corona was very sweet! She really cares about her students and wants them to succeed in her class. Weekly class is mandatory, but it is really helpful in learning the language. I highly recommend taking Professor Corona!

I loved her! She has a variety of engaging activities I felt really helped me learn the language. She regularly checks in with the class to make sure we understand, and is more than happy to advocate for students. It was a small class, and she regularly tried to engage with every student. I felt like she genuinely cared about students doing well.

Very kind and good teacher. Online textbook homework is annoying but not difficult. She listens to student feedback on what to cover before tests/quizzes etc. Gives lots of helpful advice and tips before assessments - attendance is mandatory.
Although attendance is mandatory, lectures were laid back and included a lot of small group activities. She is very understanding and advocates for students when necessary.

Prof. Corona is great. She's super kind and does her best to relate to students. Asks for feedback a lot and tries to advocate for you to the SPPO department. Classes can be boring but she makes it a point to get you to work with classmates which is helpful for when you're confused or miss a day.

With the transition from In-person classes to online classes during Covid, she has tried to carry over outdated in-person teaching strategies to the online class format. For exmaple: she only offers lectures that work with HER schedule and does not post lectures online to accomodate YOUR schedule. She STILLtakes attendance points for virtual lectur

Really great Spanish teacher. Spanish is her native language, so she can be hard to understand at times. She makes jokes and laughs at them, and honestly she's just so sweet and really wants her students to succeed.

Honestly the best Spanish professor. She did tons of practice during class and not only taught us Spanish, but also culture. She WANTS you to participate and collaborate with your peers to learn instead of just handing out a packet to complete. Her rubrics were down to business and were CLEAR about what was required.

BEST. She really cares about you trying more than actually doing things correctly. Daily homework that is based on completion only. myspanishlab has the online copy of the textbook so don't bother buying it from the bookstore and just use the link she gives you to get access much cheaper through myspanishlab

Maribel Corona was a pleasure to have. Her class was clearly defined on day 1. Every exam had a study guide that said exactly what was on each exam. There was a lot of in class participation required and daily homework. If you put in a little bit of effort, you will be fine in class. She is a very kind lady and wants the class to be enjoyable.

Maribel is an easy grader but is harsh when it comes to the attendance policy. Be sure to always have a doctor's note. She expects a lot of participation and there is more group/partner work than lecture.
She's adorable, and it makes you want to go to class. Overall easy if you like spanish. "Daily homework" and participation are easy to bulls*it your way through.

Maribel has been my least helpful and least prepared Spanish teacher. Her grading is unclear when it came to the compositions and oral exam. It seemed that she would randomly dock points. She barely taught the material and I learned most of it from the book.
Class was easy but you have to study. She was funny and she didn't speak that much Spanish during class which was nice. And she's super funny!
I'm horrible with Spanish but she'll go out of her way to help
Maribel Corona has been my favorite professor yet! She is one of the nicest women I have ever met. I actually decided to minor in Spanish for Business because I enjoyed her class so much!

She is better than some of the others but isn't great. She substitutes sweetness for clarity and only "teaches" for about 5 minutes of a 50 minute class. It is funny to hear her pronounce words differently from one sentence to the next.

Maribel was a great teacher! She was very helpful and fair in grading assignments. Just make sure you do all the homeworks and prepare for the compositions  and do a decent amount of studying and you'll do just fine. Overall class was much easier than 1102.

Maribel is awesome! Her syllabus is clear and she follows it almost exactly. She speaks only in Spanish, but she makes sure everyone is on the same page. She does an excellent job of preparing you for the SLRPE (I got 100% on both sections). Take her class! She is an excellent instructor.

The first Spanish class I took at OSU was with Maribel, and it was great! She was very helpful and knowledgeable about material. She doesn't speak English very well, and speaks in all Spanish though, just a warning! But her pronunciation is flawless as she actually does record for the textbooks. She was always willing to help and explain.

3 2-page papers, one 6-page paper. 3 vocab quizzes. Mandatory attendance. Weekly h/w. Overall, a good class. The homework helps with vocab and grammar. Papers are easy to do. Just make sure to participate! It's a big portion of your grade and she doesn't just give these points away. She's unorganized, but very nice and overall good overall

She was very nice, but never followed the syllabus. I didn't find the class as interesting as my previous classes; there were lots of deep topics discussed so I felt at loss for words a lot. She's a native Spanish-speaker so has excellent pronunciation. Assignments can be confusing, but do them and get easy points. Tests were ok, just study.

She was an awesome professor! She was extremely nice and understanding. Her assignments are sometimes confusing to understand what she wants exactly but if you do the wrong one and explain to her, she let's you redo it. I definitely recommend taking her! She's very easy!

Great professor, extremely helpful in writing papers. There are several drafts so by the final one you know exactly what's she's looking for and can get a good grade. Uses the book alot for quizzes and homework but is actually very helpful with vocabulary. Four papers, one oral presentation and a few quizzes.

Be prepared for the whole class to be in Spanish. Great teacher, very nice and helpful, but kind of hard to understand at times. Homework every night but it didn't seem like a lot. Tests can be tough; no matter how hard you study you can never be fully prepared.
Excellent. Sounds like the lady who speaks on the audio tapes for Spanish textbooks.
Awesome teacher! Very easy grading. Gives out A's to almost everyone!!  I advise taking her!!!

Maribel must have gotten less likeable since the last few ratings. While she is nice and helpful, greatest ever is a stretch. I was sometimes confused on assignments, as she would say one thing one day and another the next. She is from Mexico, so the native speaker aspect is a plus.
Funniest professor I had... She was very helpful, and her talks about short skirts in Mexico made class entertaining...
Greatest teacher ever
she is so sweet and she is the best teacher here.. the class is so easy and she is so willing to help you if you are confused with something
Such a nice lady.  She wants you to do good and loves you if you participate and go to her for help.  Best Spanish teacher ever.
She's awsome. I wish I could have had her for Spanish 104. She is very understanding and if you make the effort she notices.
She has been my favorite spanish teacher at OSU (and I have taken 6 spanish classes). She is very pleasant and just overall a great lady.
She is very pleasant and helpful, lectures and prepares students for tests (created by the department) well, and encourages creativity.
A very nice lady.  If you do your work you will do well.  She is always willing to help.
very good teacher. she is soo sweet. she'll help you with anything. she dresses so nice, it just makes her better to be around. so classy.

She is so sweet and helpful! She really wants to make sure you're learning not only the language but also the culture.  the tests were straightforward; as long as you studied, you will have done well.

summary_comment: Professor Haidt is highly regarded for her deep care for both her students and the subject matter, and she is known for her flexibility with deadlines and easy grading system. Despite some organizational challenges, particularly noted in a pilot course setting, she is described as passionate, supportive, and engaging, making the class both enjoyable and informative.
summary_comment_short: Professor Haidt is highly regarded for her deep care for both her students and the subject matter, showing flexibility with deadlines and grading primarily on completion and effort. Her classes are characterized by a passionate and engaging approach, though they can be somewhat unstructured and occasionally impacted by external factors such as health issues or the pandemic.

Ratings.comment: Cares very deeply about her students and the subject matter. Very flexible with deadlines. Grades pretty easily. A bit disorganized, but this was a pilot course so understandable

Dr. Haidt is easily the kindest professor I've ever had! She genuinely supports her students academically and personally. The material she chose for us to read was engaging and prompted class participation. The class was a little unstructured at times due to changing deadlines/assignments, but I appreciated the flexibility. Only 4 grades total.

Haidt is out there, but she cares a lot about the course and her students. She's a bit sporadic, I took this class SP22 and there were a lot of issues between COVID/her getting surgery and we ended up not having class for almost half of the semester. That being said, everything is for completion and if you pay attention you'll have no problem

Professor Haidt was understanding when it came to assignments bc of covid and online classes. She's passionate about Spanish and tried to make class fun, even when the material was dry. Easy grader, based on completion and effort more than anything else. There was little homework, but that might have been bc of the pandemic and not her usual style.

Professor Haidt was one of my favorite Spanish professors I have had. We only had a handful of assignments but as long as you answer the questions fully and use vocab from the textbook you'll get a good grade on them. She is very passionate about spanish literature and she really wants you to learn and appreciate the material we cover.

Professor Haidt is probably my favorite upper level Spanish professor I've had so far. She truly cared for us and was very flexible during the pandemic. However, if you're someone who gets anxiety from being called on, she may not be the professor for you. She makes it a point to call on everyone in the class at least once, every class.

Prof. Haidt is one of the best instructors I've had at OSU. She gave me a new appreciation for literature through her hilarious/super informative lectures. She doesn't input grades on Carmen throughout the semester. You'll need to get the textbook she assigns. She takes attendance every class. Only grades were 2 papers, 2 exams, and participation.

Great class, if you like to read and enjoy Spanish culture. There's lot's of reading and pop quizzes that are worth 25% of your overall grade. Don't be scared by the first day. Professor Haidt has a fun personality and keeps the class interesting.

Our class was  Don Quixote so tons of reading. She gives really specific pop quizzes so you HAVE to keep up to do well. Quizzes are all short answer & she only gives 15 mins per quiz. Not enough time. The tests are completely short answer and essay so get ready to write. I did not find her approachable or helpful but thankfully our TA was.

She loves Spain. She's very enthusiastic about it. I never knew what my grade was until the end of the semester but I wasn't too concerned. You really don't have to read all that much. You're supposed to but if you just go to class and pay any kind of attention you'll be fine.

Second time I've had her. Tons of reading, but easy to get away with not doing all of it. Class is all discussion about the literature. As mentioned, requires a lot of time out of class, but she is a veryyy easy grader. Grade was made up of attendance/participation, 8 1-page reflections, 1 8-page paper, and the final.

The class content was very interesting and engaging, and Professor Haidt tells you everything you need to know for the tests. If you're willing to put time and effort into a challenging class, it will pay off. She wants you to learn and think!

Wow. A tonnnnn of reading. Not a ton of writing. HORRIBLY DISORGANIZED. No real class structure. However, she is super nice, interesting in class, and a super easy grader. With that being said, I would suggest taking another professor for this course. 3 papers (two 4 page, one 5 page research), 2 tests.
Easy Class, but teacher was very disorganized and didn't give back any of our graded papers so you had no idea what your grade was until the class was finished
Awesome teacher.  Very funny and enthusiastic about material.  Class wasn't hard and you don't feel like watching the clock the whole time.  Would take again.
Very clear, easy grader, interesting course material.  Excellent overall professor, I highly recommend her.

Eh, I hate literature, but this class wasn't bad at all.  The choices of literature for the class were actually interesting, and she also seemed very enthusiastic about them.  Also an easy grader.  Go to class, and you'll do well

Passionate about her work, engaging in class.  Haidt loves to help students and wants them to enjoy what they're learning. Readings are interesting and varied. In class discussions are thought-provoking. Very encouraging, helpful, and available. If you have 2 sections to choose from, take hers.

Awesome teacher.  Readings were not that exciting, but she explained everything in class and there are no surprises on exams.  Extremely open to students ideas and huge on class discussion, but don't worry about being put on the spot.  If you go to class its hard not to get a good grade.

Agree with the comment that she wants you to memorize the book.  In a nutshell, the exam was "Tell me everything you know about everything we talked about throughout the quarter."  That being said, her grades are pretty fair.
She was very kind grading our papers plus I am not good at writing (in either language), but I can say she is better than JK Welch (Welch can be very picky at times).

Nice lady.  As long as you at least read online cliffnotes/sparknotes - she'll explain it all in class.  So really, all you need to do is be sure to make it to class and recitation, and you'll get a good grade.
No Comments

This class is very easy as long as you pay attention in class. She explains the answer for all the pop-quizzes in that days lecture. The TA's provide you with a page by page summary of the entire book of DQ so its easy to follow esp if you fall behind.
Take Cantarino's section, trust me!  Her exams don't test your knowledge - she wants you to memorize the book.

summary_comment: Professor Pina is widely regarded as highly disorganized, with many students reporting confusion and frustration with the course structure and communication. Students frequently mention that she becomes extremely rude and aggressive when questioned, and often fails to address problems effectively. The class is described as stressful and difficult to navigate, with inconsistent deadlines and unclear instructions, leading many to advise against taking her class.
summary_comment_short: Professor Pina is widely regarded as highly disorganized, with numerous students reporting confusion and frustration throughout the course. Many have noted her tendency to become extremely rude and aggressive when questioned, leading to a generally negative classroom environment.

Ratings.comment: I'm so glad to read the many poor reviews about this professor after I had a similar experience. She was extremely disorganized and if questioned would become EXTREMELY rude and aggressive towards you. Confusing and cluttered layout of course. When asking a simple question she will BLOW UP at you! I dropped the class almost immediately. RUDE RUDE

the whole curriculum was very disorganized and lacked a proper system to be able to properly be informed of things. Problems occurred and she would not address them unless being bombarded with multiple students facing the sam problem but ultimately not even solving it.

I have NEVER had a teacher within WEEKS ruin a language for me. Her class is unorganized with her work. Her favorite line is "everything is on the calendar" but not everything was on her calendar regarding the homework which resulted me in missing a whole bunch. She got upset when things weren't understood. We're not native. Needs to be understood

i have never seen a more confusing layout for a class on blackboard. do not recommend at all. the entire class was confused on what to do and where to submit assignments. avoid if you can i mean seriously theres no way a spanish class should be that complicated and unorganized

She is the single worst professor I have ever had in my entire college experience. I had to drop the class because my mental health was suffering so much. She holds her power as a teacher over her students' heads as a threat and constantly accuses them of doing things they did not do.
DO. NOT. TAKE. HER. CLASS. Please spare yourself the suffering.

I only took this lady's class for about a week before I realized she was not a good teacher for me. The class was VERY disorganized, with you having to click about several things to view your homework. COUNTLESS students complained they were confused, and she did NOTHING. I even emailed her about my grade and got a VERY RUDE response. AVOID PLEASE!

As nice as she seems, she's not the most organized and it makes this class much more stressful than it needs to be. For example, a paper was originally due 10 days from a certain class day, but then that same day she changed the due date to that class day and although she provided an extension, I wished she had the details smoothed out beforehand.

Honestly I was expecting professor. Pina to be a lot worse based on the reviews but her class really wasnt bad. As long as you put effort in studying the materials, completing the homeworks , and participate in class youll pass. The plus side is that she is a really easy grader. However, there were times she was unorganised.

The most stressful class I've ever taken, and not because the subject was hard. Pina thinks that students should automatically know what she wants with little instruction from her, and grades woefully slow. She expects students to put in a lot of effort towards her class and respect her, but doesn't realize that she never does the same for them.

I had the worst experience Ive ever had at Columbus state with her class. During the class she would use rude and snappy feedback and be ridiculous when grading. A few comments in which she posted on Facebook regarding how dumb her students are for not understanding her minimal teaching and difficult criteria is what drew the line. HORRIBLEEEEEEEE

she is very unorganized teacher, makes us do homework 12 hours before its due. Takes forever for her to grade things. She never lets us out on time, class would end at 2pm and it'll be 2:01pm and she says "I still have 10 seconds" and then she would ramble on for 5 more minutes and if you try to walk out she says "you're not dismissed yet"
Dr. Pina is very personable and caring.  It is important to her that you do well and learn.  I enjoyed her class very much!
She was very unorganized, and when I addressed her about an issue with my grades, she was so rude. But, overall I did learn a lot, but she can be mean.

Very unorganized and unclear in everything she does. Nothing makes sense, and it's never known as to when things are due. You have to ask a million times, and she just says 'look at the syllabus' even though it's not there. She's willing to help when you ask, but you have to ask a lot. And she said  "I don't trust men" a lot and was very rude.

If you are decent at Spanish, you will pass this class easily. I took it over the summer and I did half the homework and didn't do too well on the quizzes but was fine. I go to OSU so I only needed a C or above to transfer the credit from CSCC, and because it doesn't effect your GPA it doesn't matter what you get. Just get above a C! TAKE IT!

I had her at CSCC. She is nice, but doesnt understand english well. Her class turned into an ethics class essentially. We used the book every day and missing class = you do bad on the exams. She graded only a few homeworks(1 page reaction papers). Her tests are HARD. ALL ESSAY. So you HAVE to read the long stories from class/the book.

She is rude and picks fights with students. I stopped taking spanish because of her. She is unorganized and assigns homework hours before it's due. Her instruction is unclear and she refuses to answer emails and meet during office hours. I don't know how she still has a job, this woman has no business teaching anything to anyone. AVOID!!!

I took her class at CSCC.  This was the worst class of all my undergrad classes at CSCC and OSU.  She is very disorganized.  The flow of the class is terrible.  She doesn't really teach, but tells.  Consistently told us she was teaching too many classes to keep track of all due dates.  rarely followed syllabus so I never knew what to expect. AVOID!

Admire that she's from another country but she is all over the place when teaching. Very forgetful and the tests are really hard.To top it all off, she made fun of my nose and other things in front of the class and when I approached her about it she said it's because she likes me. I can't figure this woman out but if you can avoid her. DO IT.

Homework and exams were impossible. Never given enough time - I never finished a single exam. Homework was e-mailed to us with hours before it was due with a min of 12 hrs of work. Belittled students in front of class for questioning the work-load and time period she assigned work in. Completely unreasonable. Avoid this professor at all costs!!

Gave us mere hours to complete assignments by next class, she picked fights with students simply asking her to clarify something, doubled up assignments to cover the fact that she forgot something, unwilling to accommodate students' inability to come to office hours, Refused to answer a simple question about what a grade counted towards. Run away.

Took her class at columbus state, she grades nothing besides exams, her entire structure is in crumbles, she threw chalk at students , cussed them out , had a mental breakdown in class , started crying, chased after people and yelled at them when they left the class. she's F***ing psycho .. avoid avoid avoid also she doesnt understand english well

Like others have said, nice lady. Her class is extremely stressful, though, with her slow grading and lack of clarity when it comes to assignments. She doesn't seem to mesh well with the "American" culture, frequently making fun of us for stressing over deadlines. She causes this stress, though, moving dates and changing grades as she pleases.

Nice Lady, but very tough and she can be a little disorganized. In addition, she can make you feel dumb if you don't understand gramatical concepts. She wants you to be more expressive with word usage when writing essays but flags you if the word you choose doesn't fit the context of the sentence the way she wants it. It's her way or the highway.
A nice lady, and actually good teacher if you respond in class and are interactive. Is understanding of circumstances

This teacher is a decently nice lady, but her class is very hard. Self admitted, "the hardest teacher who teaches Spanish 104," this is an understatement. The way she makes her class feel if they don't do well is unprofessional, as she makes them feel negatively as opposed to keeping a positive attitude. If another class is open, take it.
Somewhat difficult. Doesn't get along with all of the students. Get's mad a lot.
the worst teacher ive had so far. very confusing, gets mad easily, makes you feel bad if you do poorly at something
Not helpful, and hard to understand.

She was a great teacher. Most of the people in my class hated her, only because most were seniors and would always talk back to her, and she would get frustrated. She does assign alot of hw, but hardly ever remembers to check it. Most of the homework is just if you want extra stuff that can improve your spanish. Read the lecturas & youll get an A.

She made a deal with us on the first day of class - "You guys help me learn English, I'll help you learn Spanish." Her English is a lot better than she thinks it is, though. She's from Argentina, so her accent can be a little difficult to understand at first, but you get the hang of it. She is very willing to help, and a really nice person.

Bad teacher.  Does not keep accurate homework grades.  She is a very biased teacher, if your a girl your ok.  Tell's people to make sure their phone is off, but her's rings constantly.  Does a poor job of grading particapation.

I thought that Raquel was a great teacher.  She was very friendly and helpful.  English is her second language but she knows English better than most of the other teachers I have had here.  I She knows alot about other cultures which I found to be very interesting
Knows spanish very well, has a little trouble with english but is still easy to understand.  Great teacher to have especially knowing some of the people they let teach spanish at Ohio State.
very helpful...sometimes assignments were not clear
She's a lot of fun, but since it was her first time teaching she learned a lot and I belive she will do even better next quarter :)

summary_comment: Professor Mutidjo is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, effectively supporting her students as learners and providing thorough guidance. She ensures that grading is fair and based on meeting required criteria while also valuing the effort put into the class.
summary_comment_short: Professor Mutidjo is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, effectively supporting students as learners and providing comprehensive guidance. She ensures that grading is fair and based on meeting required criteria while also valuing the effort students put into the class.

Ratings.comment: I have had many language professors, and she is the best! She understands we are learners and really takes the time to help us learn. She grades by making sure you hit the required points, but considers the effort you put into the class.

SEI.Subject: FRENCH

summary_comment: Professor Kuwai is highly regarded for her engaging and effective teaching methods, making Japanese class a rewarding experience despite its difficulty. Her passion for teaching is evident, and she encourages active participation, with daily performance significantly impacting grades. Students consistently praise her and the TAs for their support and dedication.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kuwai is highly regarded for her engaging teaching methods and passionate approach, making the challenging language class enjoyable and effective. Her dedication to student success, along with the support from her TAs, ensures a positive learning experience despite the difficulty of the subject matter.

Ratings.comment: Kuwai-sensei is the best teacher I've had, hands down. She makes it difficult to not care about class, and it was well worth taking at 8am five days a week. All the TA's are great. Daily performance is 60% of the grade. Would 100% recommend for learning Japanese
We love Kuwai-Sensei :)

Kuwai-Sensei and all the other TA's are amazing! I had her for JPN 1 and it was a small but awesome and energetic group. Mon,Tu, Thu, Fri class will be in Japanese, and Wed class will be in English. If you show up, prepare for all the activities beforehand, and don't give up, you'll have a lot of fun! Can't wait to take JPN 2!

Class is taught in Japanese 4 days a week for a grade, and Wednesday is always taught in English. Instructions on what parts of the textbook to study are posted clearly; practice the scripts and the activity book diligently. The TAs are very helpful when they teach, and Kuwai-sensei is a very welcoming professor. Watch out for the FACT quizzes.

Kuwai-sensei and the entire Japanese language department truly cares about their students. They make learning the difficult language a much better experience. The class itself is difficult for sure. Japanese is one of the hardest for English speakers to learn so be weary.
Very easy and interesting class. The grade is based on a lot of things, and the daily grade is 60% or something. So preview the script and vocab and show up.
Easy grader, very kind. Teach with passion and very kind. I enjoy her class and have the power to learn more about Japanese.

Kuwai-sensei is such a sweetheart. She truly wants her students to succeed and takes notice of effort regardless of results. The class is difficult and composed mostly of acting out scripts with your peers, but sensei helps a lot if you get lost or confused about the material. She typically teaches once/week, but the other teachers are amazing too.
Kuwai is absolutely wonderful, for the like, 40% of the semester she actually teaches, since they rotate grad students and such. I wish she taught the upper levels as well.

Kuwai-sensei is such a caring teacher, it's hard not to love her. You'll have a host of TA's in the lower-level classes, and they can all be pretty variable, but Kuwai-sensei is a real gem. She's very understanding and patient with her students. However, it can be a bit difficult to understand her. Her English is not quite fluent.

Kuwai sensee is great! She is very funny and easy to get along with. Class isn't too hard, as long as you properly prepare for each class. She is easy to schedule a meeting with or go to office hours for extra pronunciation practice.

I love Kuwai-sensee! She was so funny and personable and made class fun. Although we only had her part of the time, her classes always went fastest which is good cause attendance is most of your grade. You need to read the textbook section for the day and have the conversation ready for class. She's a pretty easy grader though and helps you a lot.

Kuwai-sensei's lectures are the best. She's funny and although participation is mandatory, it's done in a way that's both fun and helps you memorize the material. Grading criteria is very clear, but you do need to prepare at least 30 minutes a day to do well in class.

Such a sweet and kind lady. She's your typically quirky Japanese and she loves to speak with her students. Given, you won't have her every class, but when you do, you know it will be fun, interactive, and actually really helpful in learning the language. Just memorize what you are supposed to (takes like 10 minutes a night) and you'll be fine.

First of all, if you take a class with Kuwai listed as professor, if it's a lower level Japanese class at least, you'll only have her about 20-40% of the time.  When you do have her, class is awesome.  When you have one of the other teachers/grad-students, it can really go either way.  But overall, you'll have a great time.

Kuwai-sensee was fantastic! She was a sweet lady who always brought her enthusiasm with her to class. The material itself is not easy and requires studying, but she is always willing to help if you ask for it. As long as you put effort into this class, you'll end up with at least a B+, if not an A.

She is actually really sweet, adorable and enthusiastic. Although it is a bit nerve racking at first because 45 classes per week are conducted completely in Japanese, class actually turns out to be fun or even funny if you study every night before class. She tells you exactly what to study and if you study it, then you will do great.

Kuwai-sensei is helpful and is not afraid to correct you so in turn don't be afraid to make mistakes. She speaks quickly and has an accent so she might be difficult to understand in English, so when she is teaching grammar make sure you read the concepts before hand. Listen to all audio and drills and do all activities mentioned in the ACT box.

Overall, I really liked having Kuwai Sensei. She sometimes got a bit confusing, and she does talk very fast. However, you could always tell she loves teaching Japanese. If you put the effort into her class she will tell, and help you out when you need help. Her quizzes are pretty easy, and are for the most part exactly what is covered in class.
She's always very enthusiastic. Her English isn't the best, but somehow she managed to get the point across, anyway. All lessons pretty much come from the book, though.

Really great class, recomend it to all those studying Japanese, really helps you learn better ways to study. Only complaint was how many times she mentioned the "how to use this textbook" section of the JSL books. These books are really different from other Japanese books and this class helps you understand them a bit more.

Had Kuwai-sensei for SPEAC J-2 (1103.02/2102.02). Frankly, I'm thankful that she taught level 2, because I'd have been so discouraged if level 3 had been my first encounter with her as a teacher. Definitely stick with it, and her teaching style will sink in. I'd say she grades as fairly as all the other teachers (Kiyosue, Terada, & Nozaki). ???????

Kuwai-sensei is dedicated to teaching students and very helpful if you're struggling to understand the material.  She has a great sense of Japanese humor which makes class lively and interesting.  The class is by no means easy, but very enjoyable.  She's definitely one of the best teachers I've ever had.

Kuwai Sensee is great--animated and makes an effort to keep students interested.  She's very willing to help students outside of class, and as many others have said, she cares about students' progress.  Fair in her grading, she constantly encourages students to improve.  She even has a Facebook fan page, Lol!
Kuwai-sensei is a wonderful teacher. She knows her stuff and knows how to teach very well. Keep in mind that the class requires a great deal of improv, so know the vocabulary that you're supposed to.

My favorite Japanese Sensee but also the one who grades the hardest. She's often very amusing and I always enjoy her lectures. She has always been very willing to meet students one-on-one outside of class too. The course is difficult but she genuinely seems to care about the students in 1st year Japanese and wants them to succeed.
Kuwai-sensei was awesome. She was so funny and helpful, and geniunely concerned for my understanding of the language.
one of my favorite teachers ever!  she is hilarious, thorough, animated, and genuinely cares about her students as people.  the best!
Very nice teacher... hilarious too.  The only thing is that her accent is hard to understand (but we have Kern-sensee so it's OK).  She helped me a lot when I was having trouble.
She is a great professor. Her accent is difficult to understand at times, but in terms of lessons she explains herself well.

She knows her stuff!  She has all the books memorized !!  She has no problem with explaining things but she gets frustrated easily.  The worst thing, she will interrupt you, constantly!  She already has a sentence in her head and you have to be a mind reader to get it right.  People either tolerate/like her or hate her, there's no inbetween.

Kuwai-sensee is probably the best teacher I've ever had. Once you've gotten used to her teaching style you always know what to expect, she is very focused and if you pay close enough attention to her exercises they are extremely beneficial. She can grade pretty hard but she'll give you the benefit of the doubt from time to time.

Yeah - she may be good one-on-one, and she may be interested in teaching.  But she cannot communicate clearly, and rather than explain she just repeats the same nonsensical BS over and over until you guess.  Guessing until you are right is not learning, it is exhausting all other options.
Excellent Instructor. She really wants to help you understand and is extremely nice. Funny too.
She's rough, but a good instructor. You know your material when she's done with you. Funny, too.
She's so nice!  The class might seem overwhelming at first, but if you stick at it, it becomes a lot easier and more fun.
Funny, intelligent, and intent on helping anyone who asks for it. Best instructor since coming to OSU.

Very Difficult!  FACT classes all in Japanese, no English (like ACT).  Fast talker, faster than Japanese fluent speakers.  Often times singles people out and 'picks' on them.  If you want to take all Japanese series, you'll eventually get her without a choice; Good luck!
Great teacher and hilarious most of the time!
hilarious, yet can make you feel pretty dumb, excellent teacher overall as after a few weeks you feel like youve learned so much
dedicated and has genuine interest in students
Extremely nice and helpful. A tad difficult to understand but she is a great teacher. Funny too.

Hard class for students who just want to get an easy A, tho her English is not that good, she's willing to help. For ppl who really wanna get to use Japanese very quick, take her class.  Her Japanese style of learning might make u feel anxious, however it's the best way to learn different system of language. It's worthful.
Took a little getting used to but has a great sense of humor and loves anyone who takes an interest in the language.
Great teacher, very funny and animated. The other instructorss are great also!
She is an awesome teacher. She's funny, explains everything well, and is willing to help anyone that wants it.

summary_comment: Professor Botoman is highly regarded as one of the best professors at OSU, particularly for her unique and inspiring Romanian language courses. Students describe her as enthusiastic, passionate, and deeply impactful, often expressing regret at the end of the semester. Her classes are praised for being both enjoyable and educational, offering a distinctive alternative to more commonly taught languages like Spanish, French, or German.
summary_comment_short: Professor Botoman is highly regarded as one of the best professors at OSU, particularly for her unique and inspiring approach to teaching languages like Romanian. Students consistently praise her enthusiastic teaching style and the profound impact she has had on their academic journeys.

Ratings.comment: It was almost 40 years ago but she made an impact on my life from the very first day of class. My favorite professor on my academic journey
Best prof at OSU

I took Romanian in the mid 1980s and absolutely loved every minute of it.  Prof. Botoman is a fantastic teacher who has a very different and inspirational story.  If you want something new and exciting and she is still teaching, sign up quick.  She has so much more to offer than the usual Spanish, French, German. etc.

Is she still teaching?  She was one of the best I ever had. Her classes were a pleasure.  She taught with great enthusiasm and pride.  By the end of the year, I truly regretted that our time together had ended.  Anyone who needs to satisfy the foreign language requirement and wants to try something different from Spanish or French should try this.
No Comments
had romanian studies with her last year.  don't know if she's still around but this woman is like everyone's little Romanian grandmother.  I learned a lot from her and the coursework was a breeze.
Buna Ziua

summary_comment: Professor Martinez-Gil is known for his expertise in the subject matter, which makes the class interesting yet challenging. However, many students find the class dry and complicated, and some describe his teaching style as aggressive, often leading to public criticism and embarrassment. While some appreciate his care and effort, others recommend seeking a different professor due to the negative classroom dynamics and difficulty level.
summary_comment_short: Professor Martinez-Gil is perceived as knowledgeable and caring, but his classes are generally considered challenging and dry, often described as unengaging and out-of-date. Many students find his teaching style aggressive and intimidating, particularly towards shy or unsure students, which can be demotivating.

Ratings.comment: i think hes a nice caring guy, but the class was ridiculously challenging - and not in fun, intellectually stimulating way. Id advise taking this class with another professor if you can help it

Fernando was a great instructor. He was so sweet and cared about his students very much. The class was difficult, but he made the class so that your bad test grades did not ruin your overall grade. Loved this guy, definitely take him if you can. He's such a cutie.

Professor Martinez-Gil is an expert in his field and it shows during his lectures. I found class to be interesting, but there are times when the material can be dry or complicated to understand. He did give us study guides for our quizzes and exams. Overall, his class is a good choice for an elective if you are to minor or major in Spanish.
His class is really boring and out of date (he should read more about current research). Besides, he is aggressive and doesn't consider the opinion of the student (it is all about him)

Very grateful that I'm graduating so I don't have to experience him again. He thinks that he is the master of Spanish linguistics, and if you ever have a question about class material, he takes it as a blow to his pride and will publicly ridicule you. He called me into his office to talk after I got 85% on a quiz and told me I can't speak Spanish.

He would ask us to read the words out loud and then would give us criticism in front of the class. Didn't know any of our names. Homework was for completion and not correctness and he taught in a way that made it seem like everyone already knew the information in English and that this was a review. Didn't use textbook.

Honestly, I enjoy the content of the class, but have next to nothing positive to say about Prof. M-G. He is funny sometimes, but has no idea what our names are, never gives us enough time to answer a question before interrupting, and has no interest in slowing down for our sake. I love the class, but I would suggest a different professor.

In general,Dr M-G was a good professor, but the structure of his class was very dry; also, his teaching style was aggressive, and he often called out and corrected the shy or unsure students, making them repeat after him multiple times in front of the class. As one of those he frequently picked on, the embarrassment quickly got old and frustrating

I thought Dr. Martinez-Gil was a pretty good prof.  If you're interested in linguistics/pronunciation you'll learn a lot.  Lectures could be a bit boring but if you go consistently, you'll learn some fun things and be well prepped for the exams.  He seemed pretty nice and helpful, it's definitely a low-key class.

Nice guy, but was dissapointed in his class.  Content was useful and well organized, but powerpoint lectures were endless and very boring.  Little real participation occurred besides the class chanting pronunciation sentences together.  Class is an easy A if you can bring yourself to study.  Don't buy the textbook, only the course packet.
Honestly one of the best professors I've ever had! I would take another class (any class, this guy's an expert in his field) with him in a heartbeat

Professor Martinez-Gil is one of the best professors at Ohio State! His class is so interesting and fun, and he genuinely wants to see his students succeed! If you get the chance, definately take a class with him!

Gives you so much information, but if you study all the things he goes over in the study guide you'll be fine (he will NOT ask tricky questions, but some of the homework questions will be tough.  He does not grade on correctness of the homework, but be sure u understand it for the exams)

summary_comment: Professor Schwenter is known for being demanding and fair, though some find him intimidating. While he is available outside of class and can be helpful, his teaching style often involves confusing handouts and high expectations, which can lead to mixed reviews. Some students appreciate his thorough coverage of material, while others find his classes difficult and prefer more structured instruction.
summary_comment_short: Professor Schwenter is known for being demanding and fair but also challenging, often pushing students to excel. While some find his teaching style confusing and his expectations high, others appreciate his availability and ability to help, making him a valuable resource for those who persevere.

Ratings.comment: Arrogant without much to back it up.

Schwenter is arrogant and completely unable to explain what is needed to succeed in this class. Rather than teach, he just throws handouts at the class and tells you to work in groups and figure it out yourselves. Take another teacher if you can - I feel like I wasted a lot of money and lost interest in Spanish, as well.
Dr. Schwenter was a challenging teacher yet extremely helpful and great at conveying the material well. If you are looking for a class to learn a lot, take him.
demanding but fair

He can be intimidating but if you get over that he is very available outside of class and can be really helpful.  He wants his students to do well and to really know the material.  He is not easy though.
easy to meet with outside of class. he's not always clear and has high expectations but this turns out good when it pushes you to do better.
Confusing handouts. He is somewhat unclear and boring. Avoid him, there are better options.
Awesome teacher, very personable! Loved the class!!!!!
helpful handouts, loves teaching, easy to meet w/outside class

summary_comment: Professor Goh is highly regarded for her caring and understanding approach, particularly in accommodating students' needs related to deadlines, burnout, and mental health. Her classes are described as enjoyable and well-organized, with clear lectures and a supportive environment that fosters friendships. Students appreciate her efforts to create engaging lessons, even for challenging subjects like classical Chinese.
summary_comment_short: Professor Goh is highly regarded for her caring and understanding approach, making her classes enjoyable and supportive. Her lectures are well-organized and clear, with a focus on student engagement and mental well-being.

Ratings.comment: The teacher is very caring, very understanding about deadlines, burnout, and mental health. Their classes are all fun to be in. So long as you do the readings or at least skim them and participate in class, you'll have no problem at all

Professor Goh was an amazing teacher. I personally wasn't super interested in the subject material (classical chinese), but I appreciated the effort she put into creating a positive classroom environment. Really fun person to listen to; you can tell she cares a whole lot about her students and her specializations.
A very nice and easygoing lecturer, although reading is required, you dont need to read too much. Also its easy to make friends in her courses.
Quiz before every class, easy to pass if you finish reading material
It is a good class for literature fans. No curve, need to put effort on.
Class was extremely well organized.  Lectures were very clear.  Teacher is willing to help if you don't understand.  If you are interested in Classical Chinese take Chinese 601.

Great professor. Made the class very interesting even though the subject was sometimes hard to grasp. She cares about students too! Would love to take another class from her sometime in the near future!
Extremely easy class, and there is no midterm.  The final is just a paper, but its easy.
Easy class, GPA booster! Don't have many work to do. Quizzes were easy and the short writing assignments were easy too!!! Awesome!

Prof. Goh really made learning Classical Chinese painless and even interesting. She is really willing to help students and she even adjusted the syllabus several times throughout the quarter to fit the class. Go to her office hours-- she loves to talk to students  Highly recommended!
Made an extraordinary amount of effort to explain the various pieces of literature. Her attitude towards teaching can be described as "zealous," and it certainly wears off on her students.

summary_comment: Professor Marx-Scouras is generally well-regarded for her engaging and humorous teaching style, though her classes can be disorganized and sometimes lack clear structure. Students appreciate her helpfulness and willingness to engage with them, but also note issues with communication and organization that can be frustrating. Overall, while her teaching methods and personality are often praised, some students find her classes challenging due to their disorganization and the need for active participation.
summary_comment_short: Professor Marx-Scouras is highly regarded for her engaging and humorous teaching style, though her classes can be disorganized and sometimes lack clear structure. Despite this, students find her supportive and helpful, praising her directness and encouraging learning environment, even if the material can be challenging.

Ratings.comment: Danielle was very unhelpful when I took her class. I was unable to attend at the start with valid documentation excusing my absence, but she didn't help me at all unlike my other profs. Her communication was poor and left it up to students who didn't know how to help me, to help me. Her second and last email to me was that I should drop the class.

This class was on Camus. She is super nice and hilarious, and she is very happy to answer any questions. However, this class was lowkey a hot mess in terms of organization. I couldn't tell you when things were due at all. Despite this, I learned a lot from this class and had fun, even though the readings were quite daunting.

I have many things to say about Danielle. Her class could be extremely disorganized, yet it was one of the most helpful classes I've taken. She really pushes you out of your comfort zone and half the time you have no clue what is going on, but I met many amazing people in this class due to the learning environment she encourages.

As a professor, she is very helpful. Her French is very clean and she wants you to participate and learn. However, I personally believe that the material itself was not very useful. The problem with analyzing old poems and readings is that it has old French, which obviously isn't spoken today. you learn more about analyzing than you do about French

My favorite prof at OSU. Her classes can be disorganized at times, but the material and her personality make up for it. She's straightforward and doesn't hold back with critiques, so you can learn a lot if you try. Get ready for the unexpected as she loves putting students on the spot. Grades are from papers, participation, and presentations.

She likes if you if you agree with her and shout and joke a lot. If you like doing close reading and don't make everything about you, this class will be bad for you. Just say "yes professor" and don't have an opinion.
I didn't really like most of the class material, but she's really nice and helpful.

She is nice but I don't think that she is very good as a teacher. She should learn that participation for the sake of it only produces boring, shallow discussions. should give people time to think before demanding an answer. needs to have a more structured approach to the material, just throwing random readings at us doesn't work.

After taking this class I had a firmer grasp on not only fracophone litterature, but also the history of oppression, and exploitation that is rampant throughout the history of french colonies. She brought the subject matter to life, and did a great job of presenting, and making you feel empowered!

My favorite teacher at OSU so far! If you are nervous about speaking french in front of people it will definitely help you get over that. Class is mostly skits and presentations, which you aren't able to completely blow off, but as long as you try you will do well. Highly recommended!

She is absolutely wonderful. She loves teaching, is passionate about the subject matter and unlike a lot of classes at OSU you can't just BS your way through and get an A. She is never mean and her classes are AWESOME but you're not going to like her if you don't want to work.

She's a really nice lady :) and very helpful in class. She also is very encouraging and motivating inside and outside of class. The class is focused on writing, and some of the topics were less than interesting. Still, the class was fun and the prof helped everyone improve on their French. Ultimately, it was a great class weith a great prof.

Class was very uneven, some students were above the level of comprehension, some were obviously below it. Some of the material is difficult for those without a strong background in French. She's a nice lady, and really tries to help you improve your language skills, but isn't very good at responding to emails, concerns, etc.
Fun class.  Lots of writing and analysis.  She asks questions until she gets it out of you...she is very patient and encouraging.  Grading wasn't too tough.

She is the BEST teacher I have ever had in languages and non-language classes. SHE IS SO HELPFUL AND TRULY CARES ABOUT HER STUDENTS! She really wants everyone to learn and will answer Q's.  If you are struggling at the beginning she will make sure you understand by the end of the course. And a great, fun class. not easy but work hard and u do fine
She's a great professor and person...the most compassionate and dedicated prof I've encountered at OSU.
No Comments

SEI.Class Name: Topics in French-Speaking Cultures and Literatures

summary_comment: Professor Omer is highly regarded for his dedication to his students, taking the time to understand their backgrounds and integrating Somali culture into his language teachings. He ensures that students thoroughly grasp the material and offers personalized support. Students find his courses easy to succeed in, aiming for an "A" grade with minimal effort.
summary_comment_short: Professor Omer excels in providing personalized instruction and a deep understanding of both Somali culture and language, ensuring students grasp the material. His approachable nature and tailored teaching methods make him an excellent choice for those aiming to improve their grades easily.

Ratings.comment: Professor Omer really cares about his students and takes the time to learn about you and your background. He teaches you about the Somali culture along with language. He'll cater to your needs and makes sure you understand the material. Definitely seek out to take a course with him.
Easy A if you want to get better GPA

summary_comment: Professor Grinstead is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and genuine care for his students. He encourages student interest through tailored assignments and interactive check-ins, providing detailed and insightful feedback. While some find his classes slightly easier and less challenging, most students appreciate his approachable nature, helpfulness, and ability to make the subject engaging.
summary_comment_short: Professor Grinstead is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and genuine care for his students, often praised for making the class engaging and ensuring students understand key concepts without excessive homework. However, some students found the course to be relatively easy and not as challenging as they hoped, which impacted their learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Professor Grinstead is great! I appreciated the fact that this course allows students the freedom to tailor the papers to their interests. He clearly conveys his passion for linguistics; his feedback is detailed and usually includes suggestions for further research.

I've taken 2 courses with Professor Grinstead now, and he is one of my favorite professors at OSU. He genuinely cares about his students (we do a check in a the beginning of each class where we say a "joy" and a "concern") and gives good, thoughtful feedback on essays. Knows his stuff as well!

Dr. Grinstead is great.  I learned a ton in this class.  The class made you think a lot but I enjoyed it.  I don't think it's "too easy."  Grinstead is just a good teacher and knows how to teach concepts without it being necessary to do piles and piles of work to be able to understand it.

Hate to say it, but just too easy.  Never felt the need to learn any of the material because all work was takehome/group stuff.  Really nice guy with a good sense of humor, but class was generally dull.  I love Spanish but that couldn't save the class.  Take it if you need an A on your way to the major.

Great prof.  Take him if you can. He's very helpful and cares about his students and truly enjoys teaching. Take-home midterms and finals, minimal HW. He adds his own parts to the class that are interesting too!

GREAT INSTRUCTOR!! He is one of the nicest professors I've had in my 3 yrs at OSU. Grades very easy and is always willing to help. Makes class interesting and really wants students to do well.  I would recommend him to anyone!!
He was very friendly and interested in helping his students.  I think the class was a bit too easy to the point where we didn't learn as much, but other than that, no complaints.

John is a really really nice guy.  He'll do whatever he can to help you as long as you ask.  Everything, even the midterm and final, are take-home, but there's a lot of emphasis on the homework.  Just do the work and you'll be fine.

Friendly, helpful, and pretty good at explaining the material.  Willing to work with the students and a pretty lenient grader.  All work (homework, exams, final) were take-home and related directly to the material covered in class, so it was pretty easy to get an A if you put in a little bit of effort.
No Comments

SEI.Subject: SPANISH
SEI.Class Name: Studies in Synchronic Spanish Syntax, Semantics and Pragmatics

summary_comment: Professor Liang is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, characterized by his passionate approach and dedication to helping students explore Chinese language and culture. He is known for his availability and willingness to provide additional support both inside and outside the classroom, as well as for his proactive role in informing students about relevant opportunities and events.
summary_comment_short: Professor Liang is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, characterized by his passionate approach and dedication to fostering a deep understanding of Chinese language and culture. He is known for his availability, providing extensive support through additional meetings and sharing relevant opportunities and events.

Ratings.comment: He is one of the best professors I met! Really enjoyed his passion and teaching style! He always encouraged us to explore more through learning Chinese and Chinese culture.

He's great at giving feedback and answering questions and he has a lot of availability to meet up outside of class to answer questions or do make-ups for missed classes. He also lets you know about outside of class scholarship opportunities, cultural events, etc that are relevant to class.

Liang Kai was one of my favorite teachers that I had at OSU. He really cares about his students and is very dedicated to what he does. From his participation in the intensive Chinese language study abroad program in Suzhou to his daily efforts in-class, he is an excellent teacher and mentor!

summary_comment: Professor Brew is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, which makes the class enjoyable and encourages attendance. Students appreciate his willingness to provide extra help and find the initial part of the course particularly interesting. However, some note that the latter part of the quarter can become less engaging, and the final project can be unclear and disorganized.
summary_comment_short: Professor Brew is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, which makes the class enjoyable and encourages attendance. Students appreciate his willingness to help outside of class, though some find his lectures dry and note that the class can become less exciting after the midterm.

Ratings.comment: I loved this class! We played capture the flag for a whole week. It's fun and really interesting and Brew is pretty funny. This was literally the first class that I actually wanted to attend at OSU and I'm a sophomore! Definitely take it!
Chris is very willing to help you if you need extra help outside of class. Class will seem very random at times, but all he is looking for is your effort. Put forth effort and you'll do fine!

Chris is a nice guy, and the beginning of the quarter was really interesting and fun.  We were actually learning about making and breaking codes.  After the midterm, it just got boring.  Just a heads up for the final project, hes not clear and organized about it, so be flexible with him!
Professor Brew is very helpful and funny. He knows his stuff, but his lectures are very dry. The projects we did in class were pretty fun, though, and outside of class, Chris is laid back and cool.

SEI.Subject: CSE
SEI.Class Name: Foundations of Speech and Language Processing

SEI.Subject: CSE
SEI.Class Name: Foundations of Speech and Language Processing

SEI.Subject: CSE
SEI.Class Name: Foundations of Speech and Language Processing

SEI.Subject: CSE
SEI.Class Name: Foundations of Speech and Language Processing

summary_comment: Professor Bender is known for providing an extremely easy course with minimal required attendance and reading. Lectures largely consist of PowerPoint slides from an online textbook, making the course accessible without purchasing a textbook. While some find the class boring and unengaging, many students still manage to earn high grades through minimal effort and utilizing provided study materials.
summary_comment_short: Professor Bender's courses are widely regarded as extremely easy, with many students able to achieve high grades with minimal effort, such as attending only a few classes and studying selectively. Lectures are largely redundant with online textbooks, focusing on PowerPoint slides and offering straightforward quizzes and exams with provided study guides.

Ratings.comment: Extremely easy course. Didn't show up for one of the "required" presentations, skipped maybe 3/4 of the classes. None of the reading was mandatory except when he made us go through the Butterfly Mother book in class (but you could just use your partner's...). He can be a little boring, the class was not as interesting as I'd hoped but it was EASY A

The class lectures are almost verbatim to online textbook, which is nice because you don't need to buy a textbook, but only the Butterfly Mother book. He just reads off the PowerPoint slides. Quiz/midterm/final are multiple choice. Gives list of topics to study for midterm/final. Offers extra credit opportunities. Didn't read textbook; got an A!

Mark is a great professor, I enjoyed taking the class with him plus with both of his TA's (Matt and Yunxin) who were very helpful, and they were excited about giving the lectures. Guest speakers were also brought to the class which made if fun. Just study before the midterms and you should be fine.
Bender is a BAMF.  whoever said Bender is a tool must have been talking about someone else.  Best class of my life; try to get Matty Chudnow as a TA - coolest kid you will ever meet.

if you don't get an A in this class, maybe college is not you best path in life.   i studied at total of four hours in the class.   i woke up at 9:30 am to study for the first time and took the final @ 11:30 and got a 100%.  easy A.
Sooooooo boring... not as easy as some people say.
Never went to class, EASIEST A in my life! The review questions they give you are ON the quiz, midterm, and final. Take this class for a GPA booster!

Like everyone else says, EASY GEC. You can slack and get an A pretty easily (I sure did). A couple of things: Don't be stupid, do the extra credit. Also, the 2nd midterm is the hardest test, so be prepared.
Easy GEC /  lots of extra credit
No Comments
easiest class ever, great GEC you never have to go to class especially if you have someones course packet from a previous year.

the class has been restructured so I think some of the material came off a little unclear in the notes, but its really easy...make sure to go to the class before a midterm because they review, overall easy GEC
went to classes only for midterm. don't know what the prof look like. don't know how he teaches. got A. if you can't get an A easily, maybe college is not for you.

I took this class 3 years ago and still laugh about it today.  Bender's stories are so boring and stupid that they are funny.  The TA's in this class were usually heckled loudly during lecture, because they didn't speak a bit of English.  Automatic A.
Boring but very easy class. Very hard to understand TA's.
Easy as hell, the guy is a tool though
Easy teacher...our midterms were graded with check-marks. If you need a GEC, go for this East Asian folklore class.
Showed up 6 times all quarter and the class was m-f...what a joke, boring but easy
A monkey could teach this class...take it for an A
Bender rules take this class its interesting and fun and easy
easiest class at osu
EALL 131 is a very interesting class that is an easy 5 credit A.

SEI.Subject: CHINESE
SEI.Class Name: Ethnic Literature and Culture in China

summary_comment: Professor Grotans is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, engaging and interactive classes, and strong commitment to her students' success. She is known for her enthusiasm, fairness in grading, and dedication to addressing student questions and concerns. Students consistently praise her as one of the best and most inspiring professors they have encountered.
summary_comment_short: Professor Grotans is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, characterized by her genuine interest in both teaching and learning from her students. Her classes are described as interactive, engaging, and enjoyable, with students praising her reasonable grading policies and her proactive approach to addressing questions and issues.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Grotans is a great professor. She is genuinely interested in teaching and learning from her students. Her classes are interactive, interesting, and enjoyable. She is very reasonable with grading and homework, and she always addresses questions and problems to the upmost of her ability. Seriously, she's one of the best professors I've ever had.

Anna is a great teacher, like all of the other comments have said. I have no complaints about her. I took her this past spring quarter after being abroad for 7 months in Germany. While I thrived in Germany, I very much dislike most of the German teachers at OSU. Luckily, Anna reminded me why I took German in the first place.
Maybe my favorite professor ever.  Very enthusiastic, her students come first.  If you get a chance to take her for a class, DO IT!

I graduated from OSU almost eight years ago and am working on my second masters since then--so, I've had a lot of professors here and in Europe.  That said, Anna ranks as the most inspiring professor I have ever had.  In class, she was excellent! As an advisor, she encouraged me to venture beyond my comfort zone. I miss being around her enthusiasm!
excellent teacher, very dedicated. extremely helpful. great class
entertaining, not too hard
Is very excited about what she studies and researches; a wonderful professor and advisor.
