Anna is great, take this class. The material is really interesting and Anna is very concerned with students. Very understanding and has a great sense of humor.
Great as an advisor!!!  awesome, well-informed, unlike many at osu.  haven't had her for a class
The most fun professor in the department, she's so enthusiastic about everything and encouraged you to get involved in the class.

SEI.Subject: GERMAN
SEI.Class Name: Texts and Contexts III: Historical Perspectives

SEI.Subject: GERMAN
SEI.Class Name: Seminar in Linguistics and Applied Linguistics

SEI.Subject: GERMAN
SEI.Class Name: Texts and Contexts III: Historical Perspectives

SEI.Subject: GERMAN
SEI.Class Name: Texts and Contexts III: Historical Perspectives

summary_comment: Professor Skorniakova is known for her challenging and sometimes unapproachable teaching style, with students noting her tendency to respond to questions with dismissive remarks and strict policies, such as mandatory pop quizzes that cannot be made up. Despite this, some students appreciate her thorough course content and find success through diligent homework completion and active participation.
summary_comment_short: Professor Skorniakova is known for her challenging and sometimes confrontational teaching style, which includes a tendency to dismiss questions and make sarcastic remarks. Students find her classes demanding, particularly due to pop quizzes and the expectation to self-explain course content.

Ratings.comment: She is incredibly difficult, and rude. I had had an emergency surgery, and she would not let me make accommodations for the final. Awful woman.
Not easy to ask questions, she always puts a jab in the answer, like 'I just told you that'.  She get's annoyed with the students lack of interest and then she becomes condescending.

One of the worst instructor's I have ever had.  Every question is answered with a jab.  Like, 'I just told you that'.  Luckily, the class content is self explanatory because she sure couldn't explain anything.

go to class she has pop quizzes that you won't be able to make up if you miss. Otherwise, almost everyone gets 100 on homework because you get to correct it and if you attempt the quizzes you get an A. Lots of info on midterm and final though so study!

Oxana is a great professor! I definitely was not looking forward to taking this class, but having Oxana as a professor made it extremely bearing. Do the homework and participate in class and you're golden!
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Laeufer is highly regarded as an excellent teacher and mentor, consistently praised for her clarity and ability to push students to excel. Her demanding yet supportive approach ensures that students are well-prepared and deeply engaged with the material, though some find her classes challenging and potentially intimidating.
summary_comment_short: Professor Laeufer is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching and deep knowledge of linguistics, consistently praised as one of the best professors at OSU. Her classes are challenging but rewarding, with students noting her clarity, willingness to help, and high expectations that push them to excel.

Ratings.comment: Not only was she a great teacher but a wonderful person. One of the best at OSU. Stephen ��

Took several of Professor Laeufer's 600-level linguistics-focused courses in early 2000s.  Of all French courses I took, these pushed me to another level. Classes are not the easiest (due to subject matter), but she is clear, gives appropriate assignments, willing to help, and coaxes the best out of  you. One of the best profs at OSU in my exp.

She's a good professor but can be intimidating and harsh. DO THE HOMEWORK or she WILL embarrass you in front of the class. Overall she is nice, but doesn't sugar coat anything so try and you'll be fine.
Awesome. Knows what's up.
No Comments

I love Christiane, she is one of the best French teachers I have ever had! She explains things incredibly well, and has thusfar never not been able to answer a question concerning French grammar in a way in which all can understand. Take her class and you will learn a lot. You have a lot of work but it is well worthwhile.
She is the hardest french professor i've ever had and she made a girl cry in our class after telling her she couldn't speak french and shouldn't have been in 601.

summary_comment: Professor Pyun is highly regarded for her excellent teaching and engaging approach, making her classes enjoyable and informative. She provides valuable cultural insights and encourages student participation, though her lectures can sometimes be lengthy and challenging for those with accent difficulties. Students appreciate her kindness, clarity, and supportive attitude, finding her tests manageable if they keep up with the readings.
summary_comment_short: Professor Pyun is highly regarded for her engaging and culturally rich teaching style, making her classes both enjoyable and informative. Students appreciate her approachability, clarity, and supportive attitude, though some find her lectures can be lengthy and occasionally challenging to follow due to her quick pace.

Ratings.comment: Professor Pyun is all-around amazing. I had her for both 1101 and 1102 so far. She provides a lot of cultural insight into her language classes. Beyond that, she's a great lecturer and she does her best to make sure her students understand what's going on. Speaks quickly, so occasionally hard to understand for those with accent problems.

Pyun is a great teacher but the lectures are sometimes long and boring. There are readings and group projects that you need to do which aren't so bad. The quizzes and tests are a bit tough since she's kind of vague on what she'll be testing you on so feel free to ask. Make sure to do the readings and you should be fine.

She's really great and always very excited to teach. Very approachable and answers any of the questions you have. If you have a knack for Korean then this will definitely be an easy A but even if you don't it's still a fun course and something you will enjoy. They really want you to pass and aren't very tough graders.
Pyun is the greatest. So nice, helpful and fun. She really made the class enjoyable. Love her.
Such a nice teacher. She'll go out of her way to make sure that you succeed in her class. She's been one of my favourite teachers at this school.
I love her! She is extremely nice and always wants class participation. She's fun and always goes over things you need to remember for the quizzes. Take this teacher, if you can!
She's humorous...says "you know" a lot. Very very nice and helpful. Good class, but get's a bit boring when in it for 2 hours just like any other class. Easy tests as long as you read.

I find that Pyun teaches with clarity, kindness, and a non-intimidating attitude. I would highley suggest ANY class taught by her. She merely wants you to leave her classroom with a better outlook on things. She also shows interest in other students' ideas, stories. She taught me Korean Culture 231/Lang 101.01. She's great!!!
One of my favorite teachers.  Very fun and helpful.  Easy class if you participate adn do the work.

summary_comment: Professor McGory is an engaging and knowledgeable lecturer who makes complex topics accessible and enjoyable. Students appreciate her humor and effective teaching methods, though her classes can be fast-paced and require significant time commitment, particularly with the extensive homework and tests. Overall, she is highly regarded for her ability to clarify difficult concepts and foster a positive learning environment.
summary_comment_short: Professor McGory is an engaging and knowledgeable lecturer who makes complex topics accessible and enjoyable, though her classes can be fast-paced and require significant time for homework, particularly if you need to purchase the textbook. Students generally find her approachable and supportive outside of class as well.

Ratings.comment: She made lectures interesting, but was often fast-paced. Luckily posts slides online. Homework from the textbook is time-consuming and you definitely need to buy the book or find someone to share with.

Julie is awesome! She's super-knowledgeable, engaging, and pretty funny, too. I enjoyed her class very much. The workload isn't bad, either, and the readings she assigns are usually interesting in their own right.

Julie is a fantastic lecturer! I dreaded taking phonetics but she made it applicable and easy to understand. Her focus on applying what you learned practically in the labs was great and she's just so fun and warm of a person. Expect oodles of homework to properly train you in IPAphonetic theories but doing well in the class is surprisingly easy.

Julie is awesome. She's super helpful, not just with her class, but since she's the undergraduate advisor for Linguistics she knows everything that's going on. She's so nice and absolutely wonderful. Try to take anything with her if you get the chance.

Very charismatic and interesting to listen to. Makes class seem like it will be easy (and it is easy in class), but she is a very tough grader (unfairly so).  Her office hours did not work for me and she did not make any effort to meet at other times. Seemed disinterested when I spoke to her after class. Nice lady, though.

She explains complicated topics in a way that makes everything suddenly fall into place. She's very funny and a talented teacher. She knows what she's talking about, and it shows. Definitely take 4000 if you can!
Awesome professor! Gave us a lot of practice. She was both nice and funny.

This class is interesting, fun and useful. All you have in this class 6 tests, 5 quizzes and 1 project. Attendance is not taking, but Julie does some attendance quizzes, which are very easy once a week or two weeks.

Julie is a very fun prof who will always keep your attention.  You only need the "Language Myth" book and MAKE SURE you take good notes because a lot on the test comes from them. I definitely recommend this class, I wasn't interested in it at all at first but overall enjoyed it!
Doctor McGory is an absolute angel of linguistics. She is interested, interesting, and always willing to help.

Super nice, really easy class. You only really need the book "Language Myths" not the other one. The only downside is the class was really redundant and pretty boring. She puts all the slides on Carmen and everything's open book. I recommend her if you don't mind redundancy.
She was an amazing professor. I learned so much in her class, and not just linguistics. I always had fun and she's pretty funny to. She really knows whats she's talking about and willing to help.

Enthusiastic about what she teaches. Knows what she's talking about. Weekly online quizzes/tests that are open-book, however you mainly use lecture notes to guide you. I found that sometimes the information in lectures was over-stressed and extremely redundant. Overall, recommended!
I had her for honors london, LOVED her! Julie is thoughtful and always willing to help you if you need it. If you can take a class with her, please do!
Perfection.

Julie is SUCH a nice woman, and her class was really interesting! She's so enthusiastic that you can't help but pay attention to her lectures, which are interesting, anyway. She's also really helpful and understanding. If you can take a class with her, definitely do it!

Wow this class was so much fun.  Julie is an amazing professor, and if you're lucky enough to have a class with her and DJ Hovermale, then I am beyond envious.  Their teaching was incredible; I learned so much in this class.  All the tests and quizzes are online (aka open book!) Highly, highly recommended.

Julie is an extremely nice lady. If you participate in class she becomes very fond of you. Loves to talk and make jokes. Class is relatively interesting, she does the best she can! Homework, projects, and quizzes are a breeze! Love her!
I've never had a teacher with such an amazing fashion sense.  Hands down most attractive professor in the department--now that Detmar's gone.

She was great! She said she was going to take attendance at the beginning of the quarter, but she never really did. Most of the quiz stuff came right out of the book, with only a little coming from class. The projects were REALLY easy to do.
Julie is absolutely hilarious!  I enjoyed every minute of her class.  Her labs can be difficult, but she grades fairly.  Be prepared for the more scientific/physics side of linguistics. :D
Julie was an awesome linguistics prof. She was funny and loves to joke around. Made class interesting; wasnt strict on homework and grades fairly on quizzes and tests.

really relaxed, jokes around a lot. easy quizzes, very willing to re-explain concepts we didn't understand. personally, subject matter was a little boring, but she was the best possible kind of professor to have for a GEC--she made an uninteresting subject interesting for me.

Julie is the most amazing teacher in the linguistics department.  A lot of the professors have a hard time bringing the info "down" to an undergrad level, but Julie teaches it well.  The class learned a lot of difficult information in a short period of time, but it wasn't bad.  If you want to take this class, make sure Julie is the teacher!

She was very excited about the course, and tried to make it as fun as possible.  I really enjoyed her class.  A handful of easy (I think) quizzes, a 7 page paper, no midterm or final, and weekly homework assignments.

She's an awesome teacher. I have trouble grasping some of the concepts in the class, but she was very understanding and always made the extra effort to help me understand. Plus, she's absolutely hilarious, so the class was always something to look forward to, even if I wasn't into what we were covering at the moment.
nice lady, unorganized teaching style
awesome teacher

Julie is an amazing teacher. She makes the class so enjoyable that you actually want to go and take part in the discussion. The tests aren't easy but Julie always makes herself available to help.  Very understanding teacher! One of OSU's best

summary_comment: Professor McLaughlin is highly regarded for his straightforward teaching style and genuine care for his students' success, though he is noted for being disorganized and sometimes slow in returning assignments and grades. Despite these organizational challenges, students appreciate his willingness to help and his efforts to accommodate their needs, finding his lectures occasionally dry but occasionally enlivened by humor.
summary_comment_short: Professor McLaughlin is highly regarded for his straightforward teaching style and strong commitment to student success, despite occasional organizational challenges. Students appreciate his kindness, willingness to help, and efforts to accommodate their needs, though some find his classes and assessments demanding and note issues with timely feedback.

Ratings.comment: Profe McLaughlin was very straightforward during class which really helped me learn a lot. I struggled with Spanish before this class so I was nervous but I'm grateful I had him as a professor because he helped develop my skills a lot. He's a super nice guy and always wants his students to succeed.

He cares SO MUCH about his students and is ready to make accommodations so that they succeed. He is very disorganized though, and won't put in grades until the end of the semester. He is also always willing to help you outside of class.

Professor McLaughlin is just an overall nice guy that you can't help but like! Lectures were pretty boring, but he was always telling jokes to make it alittle more bearable. Tests aren't easy, but also aren't hard. The only downfall is he gets tests and assignments back super late.

Class was difficult. He was quite unorganized, often didn't get to what he said he would (which meant getting tests back way late). On the other hand he was very nice, tried very hard, and was helpful when approached. Very good at the teaching, the approach could use some work. Pay attention, participate, and ask when you need help.
No Comments
He might be the greatest teacher that I've ever had.

summary_comment: Professor Isurin offers a mix of engaging and challenging content, with some students finding her class both fascinating and easy if they follow her instructions closely. However, others note that the class can be demanding, particularly with writing assignments, and that grading can be strict, especially for non-native English speakers. Overall, her unique perspective and interesting insights into Russian history and culture are widely appreciated.
summary_comment_short: Professor Isurin offers a mix of engaging and challenging content, with some students finding her class easy and enjoyable, while others struggled with the writing assignments and found the material dense. Her unique perspective and insightful lectures on immigration and Russian history are widely appreciated, though the class structure, including extensive movie viewings and complex writing tasks, varies in difficulty among students.

Ratings.comment: Top 5 worst classes I've taken at OSU. I was looking for an online GE to take and the class ruined the experience to learn some cool Russian history. She gives 2.5 hour long movies (in Russian) to watch, boring 20+ page short stories, and random pdfs to read to then answer crazy ambiguous questions on the quizzes. Turns easy A class to max B+.

Professor Isurin was great! Took this class online and there were 3 weekly assignments that were straight from the lecture pdfs, or you had to read sections from supplied book. The second half of the semester you had one movie a week to watch an extra credit was just showing up to 3hosted movie showings. VERY easy A no midterm and no final.

Although some of her lectures were a tad long, this is one of my favorite classes I've had despite the fact it was more of an "extra" class for fun. She provides such an interesting insight on immigration and its influence in America and really makes the lecture and stories enjoyable. Show up and follow her specific instructions and you'll get an A

Although it wasn't a TOTAL blow off class, it was interesting and honestly not hard at all. You don't have to take notes during class and multiple classes consist of total "work time" or movie watching. I would take it again in a heartbeat. Interesting and generally like-able.

Very fascinating woman with an extremely unique perspective on her field. Class was easy as long as you stuck to her powerpoints which detail exactly what you need to do in order to get a good grade. Definitely recommend taking the class.

The last 2 papers is where I lost a great of points. The literary analysis & empirical study paper were difficult. Some things she did not make clear & alot of the class lost points too.  For a non native American she is extremely tough when grading writing papers.Overall it was a very interesting and eye opening class.

Class was interesting and she had a lot to teach, especially from her experiences. The writing assignments were not bad at all compared to other writing classes. The discussions were fun and the reading assignments weren't too bad

She is one of the most fascinating people I have ever met and will not fail to surprise you with her eccentric style every class. This was the first time she has taught this class and it was very easy if you know how to write and add any bit of commentary to discussions. She is a really sweet woman full of life experience we will never comprehend.

She didn't want to teach this course and it showed. This course was a nightmare. I would have rather sat in bumper to bumper traffic on Tues. and Thurs. She is not an encouraging teacher. She liked to remind me how bad my Russian was. She also didn't not actually teach grammar even though we were tested on it. I won't take another class with her.

Set in her ways but very knowledgeable of the nuances of the Russian language. Her tests and workload are easy, but beware: if you love Russia/ Russians, she is fairly condescending and it will show in her interactions with you. She'd rather hear criticisms of Russia, whether it be fact or fancy.
Blahh, a boriiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiing class, totally uninteresting "discussions".  Very easy though.

summary_comment: Professor Potvin is highly regarded for her friendly demeanor and effective teaching methods, though her classes can be quite reading-intensive and occasionally monotonous. Students appreciate her clear expectations and take-home tests, which they find manageable. While some find the material and lectures somewhat dull, many recommend taking her class for its relative ease and potential for learning.
summary_comment_short: Professor Potvin is highly regarded for her friendly demeanor and effective teaching, though her classes can be lengthy and somewhat dull. Students find the course manageable with consistent participation and reading, and appreciate the take-home tests which contribute to the ease of the class.

Ratings.comment: She was very friendly and enjoyed teaching. A lot of powerpoint lectures, but does not post them on Carmen. One midterm, one final, some papers and homework. Class is kind of boring and long to be honest. Expect to read a ton! It's hard to keep track of Russian names in the literature. I didn't study at all and managed to pass the class with a B.

She's great. One test, one paper, but lots of reading. The readings are actually enjoyable though. As long as you do the readings (or some of them), participate every now and then, and show up to class, it is an easy A. Take her if you can.

A lot of reading, but not always necessary.  Discussions got a little boring sometimes, but she will definitely make it clear if she is saying something that she will quiz over. No final, just a couple of papers.  Some subtle humor here and there.  Class is a breeze.
Participate once in awhile and you'll be fine! definitely take it if you're looking for an easier writing class... i say easier because all writing classes are hard for me.

Ali is wonderful.  Her class will be boring if you don't participate in discussions and read at least some of the assigned material, but if you try at ALL, you'll get a lot out of the class.  Plus, the exams are take-home (and easy!!!).  It's an easy A, but still fun and interesting.
Ali is the best. Take her if you can!
Boring ZZZZZ
TESTS ARE TAKE HOME, TAKE THE CLASS!...kinda boring though

summary_comment: Professor Miller is known for his easy grading standards and minimal note-taking required, as he provides exact answers in review sessions. He is described as a charming and talented educator who frequently cancels classes but offers clear guidance for exams. Students consistently praise his engaging storytelling and willingness to help students, making his classes enjoyable and straightforward for those looking to fulfill requirements with minimal effort.
summary_comment_short: Professor Miller offers an easily passable class with minimal effort required, featuring straightforward grading criteria and review sessions that provide exact answers to test questions. He is described as a charming and talented educator who frequently cancels classes but ensures students achieve high grades with little studying needed.

Ratings.comment: TAKE THIS CLASS IF YOU WANT AN EASY A!! 2 20% midterms, 1 20% final, 20% attendance, 20% easy graded small paper. Gave EXACT answers to tests in the review class, do not have to take any notes at all until the review session because he literally gives you all the answers. Hes so nice and funny. Cancels class ALL THE TIME. Just show up for an A

I took Professor Miller's classes from 1985-1988.  Sometimes it is only in retrospect that we recognize true talent.  David was indeed an amazing teacher - talented as a educator and charming as a human being.  He should only have success and receive from his students the warmth he has given.
Easiest class ever
Nice guy, easy class. The stories were interesting and easy to read. He tells you exactly what will be on the test in the review. Cancels class ALOT.

Excellent professor.  If you are at OSU, why not take a class with one of the nation's best experts in Yiddish?  He is also very willing to explain things to students and explore students' interests during classtime.

My favorite professor at Ohio State. Go to class and really listen to him and you won't even need to study. Fantastic man, great professor, loves teaching and will work with students. If any Yiddish class with him can fulfill your requirements, absolutely take his courses!

If you can appreciate storytelling, definitely take this course. I had a blast. The stories we read (off of his website) were interesting and his rambling and analysis about them were great too. Go to class and pay attention and you will do great.
Interesting class. GREAT stories. Does ramble, but that's part of the experience.
Absolutely amazing guy.
Loved him. He has great stories. He's very clear about what he expects for each test. If you come to class and read, you'll get a good grade.

He was such an interesting prof! We didn't have a textbook but had to read the stories off the Internet. Many didn't read the stories, but they were all so interesting and enjoyable I didn't mind reading them. Also watched a movie I thought was so interesting I bought the book and read it. Tests were easy if you went to reviews before the exam.
awesome
Great professor. He really helped me understand the material.
amazing man

Just wanted to leave a note about one of the teachers who made one of my tougher quarters manageable and helped achieve the grades I needed for law school. Great man and great family man. Adorable kids. He brings them to class.
sooooo easy
This guy/class are the best.

Great prof. Great stories. Easy class. -- but sometimes I feel like I don't learn much in that class.  It is nice because it is a class that I can feel relaxed going into....but I am paying a lot of money for credits and not getting much out of it!
Extremely intelligent and kind teacher, the class is interesting and not very hard.
very easy class, extremely nice man
Very funny and very interesting. He has a tendancy to ramble, but he knows this.

summary_comment: Professor Caron is described as a genuinely kind and passionate educator who cares deeply about her students and the subject matter. While some students found her classes engaging and enjoyable, particularly those focused on Polish culture, others felt the class was uninteresting or overly focused on her personal appearance rather than the content. Overall, opinions vary, but many acknowledge her dedication to helping students understand the material.
summary_comment_short: Professor Caron is described as a genuinely kind person who cares about her students and loves the literature, making class discussions interesting and engaging. However, some students found her more focused on appearance than on teaching and learning, and a few expressed that the classes were boring or unengaging.

Ratings.comment: More interested in her appearance than learning.   Sad.
I've definately had better.

genuinely kind person who cares about her students; loves the literature; helped in class discussions which were extremely interesting; a bit of an Ayn Rand scholar; I would definitely recommend anything with her-you will not be bored; even gave extra credit!

I didn't know what the class would be like before I took, I only did so because a friend begged me to take it with them.  I definitely ended up enjoying the class, it was on Polish Culture, one of the best I took, while in school, that is outside of my major.  Inna was very into her material and willing to do anything to help the class understand.
yawwwwn........
Just read and go to class...take decent notes and you will get an A. She knows it's a GEC but tries to get everyone interested.  Good teacher.
No Comments

Really nice.  I think all the guys took the class cause she's pretty.  She comes in wearing big sunglasses drinking coffee like she's been out too late.  She uses practical applications of the language, not games.
wow!
Real fair, easy grader, if you participate you get an A.
She was SOOO awesome! My favorite teacher of my entire college experience!!!!
No Comments
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Hirt is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods, particularly in making French accessible to beginners. Students praise his clarity, enthusiasm, and willingness to help, noting that he is one of the best French professors at Wright State University. His engaging teaching style and reasonable workload contribute to a positive learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hirt is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and ability to make French accessible, especially for beginners. Students consistently praise his helpfulness, energy, and engaging teaching style, though some find his workload balanced and manageable.

Ratings.comment: Took Prof Hirt for Beginning French II and he was a good teacher. He was super helpful for me.
I wanted to like Benjamin, but he's average at best. He's not very clear or informative, and he likes to assign homework both online and offline simultaneously.

He teaches french at wright state university and I must say I think he is the best french professor at wright state. He makes it easy to understand and french isn't easy to understand especially for those taking it for the first time. His teaching is spectacular. If you're a french beginner id recommend you take Benjamin, he's really good.

Great class. Great professor. As long as you don't skip class, you'll pass. Easy to understand and loves to involve the whole class. Quite a few group projects, but he grades those easier than other assignments. One of my best professors and is super helpful. He's really understanding. I can't wait to take his classes again.
Very helpful and extremely knowledgeable on French literature, the subject of the class.  Try to get him as your professor.
very helpful and friendly
Pretty cool guy, rather young, so he knows how to keep your interest. Helpful in office hours.

I learned more french in his one class than in all my years of high school french put together.  The amount of work he gives is pretty reasonable and there's never anything unreasonably difficult.  He's very energetic and fun, and a bit zany too.  Don't be boring though, it seems to get him angry.

Ben was great!  He was adorable, very funny, and extremely helpful.  He made the material as clear as possible.  I put off taking French because I was terrified of it.  But, he made the class easy without taking away the value of the content you learn he was one of the best French teachers I've ever had.

Ben was the best French teacher I've ever had. I never learned more than what I learned for the 10 weeks I had him as a teacher. He always keeps class interesting and is always extremely helpful. Teaches the new material very clearly. VERY FUNNY in class.

Ben was such a good teacher. It was a pretty easy class as long as you went and did the work. He didn't take off major points for little mistakes and he always made sure we understood everything. He was very helpful and I would recommend him to anyone taking the class.

summary_comment: Professor Bell is highly regarded for her excellent teaching quality, known for being clear, energetic, and passionate about her subject matter. She effectively balances professionalism with a personal touch, consistently preparing well-organized lessons and actively engaging students. Students appreciate her fairness, willingness to help, and genuine care for their understanding and success.
summary_comment_short: Professor Bell is highly regarded for her clear explanations and energetic teaching style, making her classes engaging and well-organized. Students consistently praise her fairness, willingness to help, and genuine care for their learning experience.

Ratings.comment: I really enjoyed Professor Bell's class. Also subbed for my Spanish lit class. Very clear with the subject matter, has a lot of energy which makes it hard not to pay attention.  A lot of reading but nothing tedious. Reading quizzes done online before class.  Tests  mult choice, shortlong response. Had a group choice project, easy presentation.
She's great! Goes out of her way to help students and really understands that we're all learning. Plus, she dresses adorable.
She's fair, listens to feedback, always comes prepared, genuinely cares. The perfect balance of professional and personable.
Excellent professor!

ABSOLUTELY LOVED Profesor Bell! She was a wonderful professor. She really knew what she was talking about and had a passion for it. The class in general was kinda difficult but she did SUCH A GOOD JOB in explain it. would take any class she was instructing.

Dr. Liz is an excellent instructor, I highly recommend her course. Her methods of instruction are clear and well organized. She is always prepared for class by having powerpoints and activities. Her willingness to help her students shows she genuinely cares about them. Her enthusiasm and knowledge proves that she is truly interested in Spanish.
Very helpful. She's super nice. The class is easy because you can prepare for all of the in class essays beforehand.
Great Spanish teacher. She makes sure everyone understands the material and prepares you well for exams. I passed my SLRPE on the first try without any problem.
very helpful and material was presented in a very helpful way that helped us prepare for exams

Very nice and more than willing to help out. Ask for help if your confused during tests, she often reveals more than you would guess. Take advantage of late hw policy, makes a difference! Grades very fairly. Very attractive felt like a third grader with a crush on his teacher.

Liz did a great job teaching 101.  She made everything very clear and went over the vocab enough to really help us to get a hang of it.  Let alone the fact that she is beautiful, she also knows her stuff.
the best spanish teacher I've had thus far
No Comments
she is not terrible but not great either.  pretty boring.  i didn't learn too much from the class..kinda just went to class half awake and left in the same state.  don't expect anything life changing
Excellent TA.  Very nice and helpful.  Class was always enjoyable.  Fairly easy.
She has to be the worst teacher at OSU. Totally, doesn't care about anyone but herself.
Very helpful. Definitely one of the best teachers i have had
she could careless how her students do in her class. she is very arrogant and not a good teacher.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Fourny is highly regarded for his passion and dedication to teaching, making his classes engaging and enjoyable. Students appreciate his fairness, enthusiasm for French language and culture, and his willingness to help them learn. However, some find his lack of structured classes and fair grading can lead to lower motivation and learning outcomes. Overall, he is seen as one of the best and easiest professors in the department.
summary_comment_short: Professor Fourny is highly regarded for his passion and dedication to teaching, making his classes engaging and enjoyable, though some find his lack of structure and tendency to ramble less effective for learning. Overall, he is praised for his fairness, enthusiasm for French language and culture, and his ability to connect with students, though a few students found his classes less structured and not as beneficial for learning.

Ratings.comment: Prof. Fourny is one of a kind. He is passionate, intelligent, and loves teaching. His love for teaching makes it so that you really enjoy the class. It feels more of a discussion with a friend, than a lecture. He engages students and is very fair. I absolutely loved his class.

A fantastic Professor who cares about students and truly wants to teach.  It's almost as though he would like to pass on all of his knowledge to the students.  He is very passionate about the job, loves the French language and culture, and his lectures were also great.  By far, the best French Professor I have had.

He does not seem to read papers and provide adquate feedback. There is absolutely no structure to his classes and he rambles on endlessly. I did not feel I learned much and I was disappointed in the course. He gives the same grade to average and excellent papers, making me not want to put in much effort. Just not very inspiring.

I have had Fourny multiple quarters and I would rate him as the best teacher in the department. He is genuinely concerned for his students and is willing to answer any question. You get out what you put in, so if you want to learn then he is a great source of knowledge. If you just show up and do not participate, you are missing out.

Fourny is one of the easiest teachers in the department. He is easy to understand and an easy grader. He never took attendance, but I enjoyed going anyway. He clearly enjoys rambling about French culture and history, and shows interesting videos. I almost never read the textbook, and you honestly only need to study a little for the midterm and fina

This teacher was really great! I am looking forward to taking another class of his. He was very interested in helping the class learn and evolve in their understanding of French. He really cares about the topic and is very fair in his grading. I would recommend him to anyone taking French. He is a really great professor.
Awesome teacher. Really nice guy.  Easy grader, would definitely recommend him.
Awesome teacher who brings a fresh perspective compared to normal french classes.  Fair grader and nice guy who knows what he's talking about. Take his classes.
A very nice man interested in the welfare of his students.  Certainly a very easy grade.  That being said, you can still learn a lot from his class if you put forth the effort.

Professor Fourny is great. He basically never assigns homework, and any assignments (Essays, exams too) are ridiculously easy and easily graded too. Strongly opinionated Frenchman who just likes to talk about random aspects of Frenchness all class long.I found it very interesting.

Class overall was very easy. He is very laid back really nice. This is a good class to take if you still want to learn, but don't want to be stressed out. As long as you look over your notes you will be fine for tests. We had one paper, and he graded them easily. Highly recommended!
He's very laid back and the tests are over class discussions, not text book readings. This is my second class with him because he's easy to get along with.

He an excellent prof. You never know what he'll talk about in a given day or if he'll change the syllabus, but he's very understanding and lenient. He creates a relaxed atmosphere where its actually easy to learn.  Class is interesting.

really nice guy and class is interesting-ish when he shows up.644 is a required course for majors and it supposedy covers WWII until present day  however it seems more like he just comes into class and talks about random things that have very little, if anything to do with history. class is 60% waste of time but he's nice so it's not that bad

summary_comment: Professor Ahern is highly regarded by many students as an exceptionally knowledgeable and passionate instructor who expects a great deal from her students, fostering a strong sense of academic achievement. However, some students find her teaching style demanding, particularly with extensive reading assignments, and warn of potential biases and a challenging classroom environment.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ahern is highly regarded for her extensive knowledge and passion for the subject matter, which she effectively communicates in a well-organized manner. However, some students found her demanding and her teaching style challenging, particularly due to the extensive reading assignments and perceived favoritism.

Ratings.comment: This was the best professor I had in college. Very knowledgeable and helpful. Well organized and passionate about the material she was teaching. She was expecting a lot from you because she wanted you to do well. I took many grad classes with her, she is greatly missed.
She makes you read way more than necessary. Sometimes over 100 pages each class. Its as if she doesn't realize she is not our only class.
not a very good teacher, would not recomend taking
run for the hills!
No Comments

Avoid her if you can. Shows favoritism and hostility and makes inappropriate and biased comments in class. Appears to be helpful but appearances are deceiving. If you work outside of her field, you are at a disadvantage. It is her way or no way.

Prof. Ahern is very kind, as with any class you just have to do the work.  Do the readings, and be prepared for pop quizzes.  Try your hardest and you shall do good in the class, plus she was very nice in grading papers (cos sometimes I had lots of errors and she didn't lower the grade of the paper)

summary_comment: Professor Walsh is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods, especially in making a challenging subject like Russian accessible. Students appreciate her dedication to ensuring comprehension despite the language's difficulty, and they note the importance of attendance and participation. The course structure, with daily grades and straightforward exams, contributes to a manageable yet rigorous learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Walsh is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and ability to make complex material accessible. Students find her classes challenging yet enjoyable, with a strong emphasis on attendance and daily participation that significantly impacts grades.

Ratings.comment: She's amazing.

Really enjoyable professor. The language itself is very difficult, but she makes it her priority to ensure that students comprehend the materials. More than 7 absences and you fail the course. Overall: hard language, great professor, definitely would take her class.  Most will end up with either and A or B, given the difficulty of Russian.

Yuliya is a great professor.  You have to read a lot, but it actually wasn't as much reading as I expected to do in a lit class.  You get a participation and attendance grade every day, so you definitely have to come to class.  All you have is midterm and a final which are super easy if you come to class and take notes. Overall, great, fun class.

summary_comment: Professor Unger is widely regarded as a poor instructor, known for his ineffective teaching methods and tendency to go off on tangents. Students find his lectures unengaging and difficult to follow, and his grading is perceived as unfair and inconsistent. Despite his knowledge of the subject matter, his ability to communicate and stay on topic is severely lacking.
summary_comment_short: Professor Unger is widely regarded as a poor instructor, known for his ineffective teaching methods and tendency to go off on tangents, making classes枯燥且难以理解。学生普遍反映他的讲课内容晦涩难懂，互动性差，并且考试和作业设计不合理，导致许多学生在该课程中表现不佳。

Ratings.comment: Horrible and Awful!!!

The most AWFUL CLASS I have ever taken at OSU! We were all duped! Unger-sensee knows his facts, but his teaching sucked! Suffered through this class, only to FAIL! Took it over next quarter with JJ Nakayama- Got an A!

I would not recommend this class to anyone.  It is the worst class I had ever had at OSU.  He goes off on tangents. We had a ridiculous midterm which he had failed half of the class. He does not specifies what he wants.  He asks questions that is completely not related to the class and expects you to know the answer.

The class seemed very interesting on paper. But while the professor does know his facts, he doesn't know how to effectively teach it to students, especially those of undergraduate level. He tends to talk at you, making class very boring at times. He went on tangents most of the time, and his grading is slightly flawed, there is only one grade.

Terrible professor/class(JAP231). The man definitely knows his facts/history, but he is so bad at teaching it to people-- mainly, he's just regurgitating facts for his own benefit. Goes off on tangents, asks open-ended questions when he expects a specific answer, and the tests are so random/short, that if you miss three, you pretty much fail.

One of the worst professors I have had here. Two pop quizzes make attendance a must. Quizzes and midterms are a seemingly randomly compiled facts spanning hundreds of years of Japanese history (which is not the focus of this class). He himself is a knowledgeable, but impossible at communicating or staying on track with **** overtones.

Awful professor! You can barely understand his mumbling in lectures, as well as his scribbles on the board. He acts like ur a complete moron if u don't understand something. Lots of reading in this class, but you get to watch movies on fridays.

Had him for Japanese 231 (culture) lots of lecturing, and he often went on tangents leading to nowhere or the next day's lecture. lots of reading involving from some decent material and some not so great material.

The class looked interesting on paper but in reality is just horrible.  Unger talks on and on, there is a 15 page paper and the second half of the course consists of student presentations...I did not learn much at all.

summary_comment: Professor Harlow is highly regarded by some students for her expertise and effectiveness in teaching French, though her teaching style and approach have been criticized by others for a lack of respect and invasion of privacy. While one student found her to be an exceptional instructor who significantly improved their language skills, another experienced a hostile environment marked by a lack of professional boundaries and perceived conflicts of interest.
summary_comment_short: Professor Harlow is highly regarded by some students for her expertise and teaching ability, particularly in French, where she is considered one of the best. However, other students have criticized her for a lack of respect and invasion of privacy, citing instances where she accessed their academic records and conducted unsolicited counseling sessions.

Ratings.comment: I was shocked at the lack of respect and violation of privacy. She had read through my academic record,  and  embarrassed me by initiating an unsolicited "counseling" session after class.  The recommended book for the course was of course co-authored by her, so she has a vested and dishonest interest assigning this overpriced book to the syllabus
She's a great professor, and rarely teaches, so if you get the chance, take a class with her! She helped improve my French, and is by far the best French professor I've come across.

summary_comment: Professor Tobin is highly regarded by students for his exceptional teaching skills, wit, and ability to engage and manage the class effectively. Students consistently praise his clear organization, interactive teaching methods, and genuine interest in his students' learning.
summary_comment_short: Professor Tobin is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching skills, wit, and ability to effectively present and evaluate course material, making him one of the best instructors at Ohio State according to student feedback. His engaging teaching methods, flexible approach, and genuine care for his students contribute to a positive learning environment, despite some noting occasional challenges in teaching experience.

Ratings.comment: As far as teachers go, in the two semesters I have had at Ohio State Kip is one of the best I have had. He is very witty and very sharp. He is perfect for teaching this class, as his skills for evaluating, comprehending, and presenting course material are very high.

I think that this class was very well organized and was very manageable throughout maymester. Kip was a great teacher and I thoroughly enjoyed the class and learned a lot more that I expected to  from taking a Gen. Ed. class. There is nothing I would change about this class, it was really great and I would recommend it to anyone.

I thought Mr. Tobin did a great job with this class. I am not a person who enjoys literature but this class was enjoyable. I learned more in this Literature class than most other literature classes  in my life. I think it was a great job and I really enjoyed the class as a whole.

Prof Tobin is an outstanding instructor!This teacher did a great job making an 8 am class on Friday involved and active so we did not all fall asleep. Our class continually had engaged conversation about the reading with small groups in the class and then shared them as a whole. This really help to fully grasp the meaning of what we were learning.
Flexible and receptive to student input. Great professor, definitely allows everyone to voice their opinion. Enjoyed the class structure. Presentations were fun, as were extra-credit opportunities.

The class would be better only if more people read the assigned work and could participate on a deeper level of dialogue. Kip is a great professor though-- he genuinely cares about his students and he's relaxed and approachable. I would take a class from him again and am sure he will succeed as a professor. Friendly and interested in what he does!

I learned a great deal from this class. At first, I knew all of the grammar points but I couldn't speak even basic sentences. I feel like my conversational skills improved a lot. The class was definitely interesting, and looking back on the lectures, I honestly wouldn't change a thing.

Prof. Tobin was one of the most boring teachers, however he was straight to the book. He went over numerous activities to ensure the students were ready for tests, however he seemed to need help teaching and explaining things sometimes. Clearly he was a newer teacher and was not quite sure how to run the class. Recommended if you know spanish.

summary_comment: Professor Bergelson (referred to as Valia) is highly respected and effective, according to students. She emphasizes consistent attendance and provides thorough review sessions for tests. Her approach is caring yet demanding, with a focus on helping students succeed, though some find her initial style challenging.
summary_comment_short: Professor Bergelson, known as Valia, is highly respected and effective in her teaching, consistently praised for her dedication and willingness to help students. She emphasizes regular attendance and thorough preparation, ensuring students are well-prepared for tests and making herself available for additional support.

Ratings.comment: If you come in knowing some Hebrew, it's an easy class. If you respect her, she'll respect you. Come to lecture every day, don't skip! She reviews what will be on the test every week.

Valia is so cute and funny, but don't disappoint her. She is such a sweet lady and truly cares about her students doing well in her class. She also gives great feedback which is essential in the class.

Valia is fantastic. She has a strong Russian accent, but is still easily understood. She is always there to help, and she encourages her students to do their best and learn as much as they can. She uses songs to help learn difficult vocab, and has fairly simple tests.

Valia was abo****ely one of my favorite professors. The homeworks were just right for the class. She is there to help and wants to help those in need of it. Just attend the class, do your homework, and you will be fine with the tests. Even in 103 I miss Valia.

Valia is an awesome teacher.  She cares greatly about her students and is always willing to help you when you ask for it.  You MUST attend class everyday; she does not have a lot of patience for people who don't attend class a lot.  Even though she seems to be very harsh at the beginning, she truly a caring person and just wants people to learn.

First off, I need you to know that I knew NO hebrew coming in, and I am not Jewish. I loved this class. Not only is she very good at keeping your attention, but she also does a great job of supplementing the book exercises with a number of songs and worksheets. I had fun every single day and met some awesome friends. Try to get Valia if you can.

She is such a fun teacher, but she becomes more like your mother or aunt by the end of the class. You can learn a lot from her and she is always willing to provide extra help! Don't miss class or you will be behind!

Such an easy class, but I had some knowledge of Hebrew going in. She probably goes at too fast of a pace for people with absolutely no background. Also, she's kind of mean. I wasn't offended, but I can see someone else feeling insulted.
Valia is a very nice lady and is very helpful, but she basically expects remedial skills in Hebrew walking into the class. I am not jewish, so that did not go well.

Good professor. She's a tough but fair woman. She kind of reminds me of a traditional maternal figure. A worthwhile professor, to be sure. Only complaint is the ungodly amount of homework. Tests and quizzes were easy, though.
This class is ok but Valia makes it so fun.  She says something funny almost every day, plus lots of singing.  I was never bored and it was easy if you did your homework.  Great teacher
Aside from the tons of homework she gives, a very enjoyable class. She helps you with everything. Don't be afraid to ask her for her help.
Great teacher!
Valia brought homemade challah bread and cream cheese for us before the final.  She gave me candy a lot.  She's soooo sweet.  It's a fun class if you were bar or bat mitzvahed.
EXCELLENT!!!!!!!!!
Great teacher! Easy class if you keep up with the vocab and grammar.

Valia's class is a fun one to take if you already have a remedial (or better) Hebrew background. She is extremely charismatic and her class is at least worth the entertainment, and underneath her thick Russian accent and thusly muddled communication skills she is a very sweet lady.
Doesn't answer all questions, HW is very unclear and she doesn't help you with it.  Difficult to understand, lots of busy-work homework...lots of it.

summary_comment: Professor Trigo's teaching style varies widely according to student feedback. Some students find him challenging yet rewarding, praising his intelligence and experience while emphasizing the need for hard work and active participation. Others criticize him for being disorganized, unhelpful, and dismissive, citing issues with class organization, excessive workload, and a lack of respect for students' opinions.
summary_comment_short: Professor Trigo's teaching style varies widely according to student feedback; while some find him a rigorous and engaging instructor who encourages effort over frequent grading, others describe him as disorganized, unhelpful, and overly critical, with some even considering him the worst professor they have encountered at OSU.

Ratings.comment: Abril is definitely old school and has a traditional teaching style. He doesn't grade and give back every assignment, but he rather grades you overall and takes into account your work and also how much you tried. He is a really nice guy.

He is very rude to students. When students give their opinion in class, Professor Trigo tells students that they are wrong without an explanation.  Professor Trigo did not teach information from our books, but instead gave his personal opinions about all subjects. He did not show any documentation to the class about statements he made.  Throughout
Terrible professor. Unorganized. Hard to understand. Rude to students. Worst class i've ever had at OSU

We had a good book, but he barely used it. And he on several occasions taught based on his opinion, even if it went directly against our readings. The other IS240 teacher (I can't remember his name, my friend had him) is much much better.

Terrible professor. Assigned readings from very poorly scanned PDFs which were usually sideways or upside-down, then in lecture he would only spend a 5-10 minutes discussing the readings and instead talk about other topics, then refused on multiple occasions to put the powerpoints online.  I would not recommend him as a teacher for this class.

Trigo is a great professor. He makes you work hard but if you do, it will pay off and class will seem a lot more interesting. He's a very intelligent man with lots of experience -- take what he has and go with it. Do the readings, participate and you'll enjoy the class material.
His class is disorganized and he acts as if we are morons. The amount of work that he requires is way too much. This has not been a good experience so far.
No good

He is more interested in listening to himself speak than actually teaching anything.  He is pompous and treasts students like crap. He stays in the classroom when students are doing his evaluations, which is illegal.  Not recommended at all.
He is a complete jerk who thinks that he is better than everyone else.  He talks down to people and makes you feel stupid.  DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASSES!!!  YOU WILL REGRET IT!!!
No Comments
Among the very best at OSU, challenging, inquisitive.
be prepared to speak Spanish in class every day

summary_comment: Professor Anderson is highly regarded for her engaging and humorous teaching style, which requires students to be attentive and appreciative of her sense of humor. She is known for her patience and effectiveness in teaching, though her grading can be somewhat strict, particularly on minor details. Students consistently praise her as one of the best teachers, emphasizing the importance of hard work for achieving good grades.
summary_comment_short: Professor Anderson is known for her engaging and humorous teaching style, which requires students to be attentive and appreciative of her wit. She is highly regarded for her patience and effectiveness in teaching, though her grading can be somewhat strict, particularly on minor points.

Ratings.comment: You have to have a good sense of humor to understand Hillary and her jokes but shes hilarious. There are a lot of tests but they're never too difficult, she just grades a little too strict, so you may miss like 1 or 2 points.
Hillary is great and so patient with teaching
Best teacher, you'll learn a lot as long as you work hard. Work hard, good grade

summary_comment: Professor Hammermeister is highly regarded for his engaging and entertaining teaching style, making the class both enjoyable and intellectually stimulating. Students praise his humor, genuine passion for the subject matter, and ability to keep discussions relevant and interesting, even when veering off-topic. The class emphasizes active participation, with assessments including participation, a midterm, and a final project, and requires consistent engagement with the material, particularly the extensive reading of works like Thomas Mann's Doktor Faustus.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hammermeister is highly regarded for his engaging and entertaining teaching style, making complex topics accessible and enjoyable. Students consistently praise his intellect, humor, and genuine passion for the subject matter, particularly Faust and German culture.

Ratings.comment: This was an interesting class and a great GE lit option. Get ready to participate, though: it's a huge percentage of the class grade.
Best. Class. Ever.

This class was awesome and crazily interesting. Kai is hilarious to talk to, and he makes class very entertaining. Lots of the conversations in class will seem to be off-topic, but he manages to make them all tie into the subject he introduces. As long as you come to class, you'll be fine.

Incredibly interesting class. Consisted of 3 grades: participation, a very straightforward midterm, and a final project. These tend to vary slightly every semester but generally it comes down to these three things. Just read the literature, come to class, and listen to him and participate in discussion. Very intellectual discussion based class.
Simply put, the best class and the best professor I've had!  TAKE THIS COURSE

He's a wonderful instructor. Most definitely one of the most interestingly humorous people I have ever encountered. He genuinely cares about the topic (Faust), but you can tell he really cares about how the students engage in the class. I would recommend the class to anyone.
BEST teacher I've ever had. Very engaging and made me interested in the lectures. His class is very laid back. I loved it.

He's very smart, funny and witty. I learned a lot about not only the Faust theme, but about German culture. Great teacher, fun class. He made us think and kept things interesting. We got off topic a lot, but even then, I was still learning. There's a lot of reading though, and Thomas Mann's Doktor Faustus is a tome.... start it early.

This guy is an AWESOME teacher. I have a feeling this class would be IMMENSELY boring if it were not for the fact that he taught it. I got an A- in the course and I really didn't do that much work, so I would definitely recommend him!

Hammermeister is hysterical, incredibly smart and open to new topics of discussion. The first 30 min of class have nothing to do with the material - but he makes you think. He is by far, without a doubt, my favorite professor of all time. Plus, he's incredibly sexy.

Please disregard anyone who says that is class is EASY or that you do not have to do the reading. The class is definitely a lot of work. If you do not a good background on German history, as well as on Art and Music, don't take the class. He is a nice person, but not someone you want for an easy A

Dr. Hammermeister is a pretty good teacher. His lectures are ussually pretty interesting and he tries to keep the class interested and involved. There is a lot of reading assigned, but I didn't really do any of it. Overall, I would recommend taking this class, its not too much work and he grades very easy.
No Comments

First half of class, we mostly just told stories. Then, if we got into the material at all, we discussed poetry mostly, not much emphasis on history.  Not very challenging--he's more interested in ideas and opinions than teaching.

Class was fun, for the first hour nothing regarding the books were discussed.  Listening to him make fun of people coming in late was halarious.  He shoots from the hip and doesn't mess around.  Good teacher for German lit, not too tough
Definitely my favorite professor of all time.
Extremely arrogant, and unhelpful. He likes to hear himself ramble on, but most of it is drivel. One of the most boring classes I have taken at OSU, avoid him.
Seems a bit stuffed and overreactive to simple issues.
I took the faust theme class with him. Fair grading, great teacher, only attendance is a big issue, but great teacher.
Very intelligent and articulate; excellent teacher
very competent....learned a lot from the class. I'm no longer a German major, but not because of him.
this professor really knows his stuff. he's one of the smartest guys out there, but he makes you understand the material. terrific teacher. very nice body to look at too :)
Nice guy. Very very funny. Likes to make students think for themselves, always answers a question with a question or a sly smirk. Brings his dog to class. Sooo funny.
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Chen is highly regarded for her energetic and caring approach, consistently earning positive feedback from students who plan to take multiple courses with her. She excels in providing individualized instruction and additional support, particularly in grammar and pronunciation, making her a standout instructor. While some note that her English can be broken, her passion for teaching and commitment to helping students improve are widely appreciated.
summary_comment_short: Professor Chen is highly energetic and deeply committed to her students' learning, earning consistent praise for her passion and dedication. She excels in providing individualized instruction and additional support, particularly in grammar and pronunciation, making her a standout instructor.

Ratings.comment: She has so much energy! Really cares about her students. Will take again.

I had her for 101-211 and will have her through 511. She is an amazing teacher with a big heart and love of teaching. Her English is broken but she is just as eager to learn as her students. She gives many great examples and is really helpful with grammar explanation and idiomatic expressions. She is an especially good I.I. prof and classroom prof.
Sweet and cute, but her requirements for a day's 4 sometimes vacillate.

Individualized instruction...good at providing additional help on improving.  Much better than some of the other II instructors.  She gives good guidance on how to improve, both with grammar and pronunciation.

summary_comment: Professor Farina is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, which often includes sidetracks and off-topic discussions. While students appreciate his approachable and supportive demeanor, many find his lack of organization and clear structure detrimental to their learning experience. Despite these challenges, some students still find his courses relatively easy and enjoyable.
summary_comment_short: Professor Farina is highly regarded for his engaging teaching style and ability to connect with students, though he often gets sidetracked and lacks organizational structure. Despite these challenges, many students find his class enjoyable and relatively easy if they put in minimal effort.

Ratings.comment: Luciano is the very best professor I have had at Ohio State.  He puts forth expectations to his students on work that needs to be completed, but also is able to teach in a way that allows everyone to connect.  Luciano has been able to engage and connect his students for years.

What a fantastic professor. Yes, he does get sidetracked easily but he gets back on track most of the time. He's like the grandfather figure you actually like to listen to. His class is easy if you put in the time and he really wants to help you. Funny guy, interesting class and back stories, take him if you can.

Tells funny stories and explains grammar issues really well, but got off topic sometimes. The whole class was spent reviewing grammar and on the culture of the regions, which was interesting since he's from milan. Used part of the department's exam and made part of it up (short answer/essay), but he told us exactly what would be on it.
If you do not want to learn one useful thing, take him. If you actually want to know Italian pick someone else.

He is sidetracked and disorganized to a detriment.  There is no plan for classes and this ends up hurting everyone becuase he just rambles on.  Great guy, not so great professor.  If you want an easy B take his course.  If you want to learn a ton from a great professor check out Heather Webb.
No Comments

Prof Farina is hilarious.  He gets so sidetracked that entire class periods will go by without anything educational taking place.  He is interesting to listen to, but difficult to follow as there is no syallabus or scheduled hw or exams, he goes by his own rules.  He is easy if you make a small effort and have some improvement.  He tries hard to make students feel comfortable and never embarasses students who struggle.  I enjoyed him as a person, but didn't learn a lot from him as a student.
No Comments

Professor Farina is one of my favorite professors.  He is fair and really appreciates when students put in effort.  He is passionate about teaching, and goes the extra mile to provide interesting reading material.

summary_comment: Professor Gura is highly regarded for his comprehensive knowledge and expertise in his field, earning him a reputation as one of the best instructors. However, his material does not engage students who lack interest in the subject matter.
summary_comment_short: Professor Gura is highly regarded for his expertise and knowledge in his field, consistently providing valuable insights during lectures. Despite this, his material does not engage students who lack interest in the subject matter.

Ratings.comment: Helpful guy, seems to know what he is talking about.
this guys knows his stuff, and i believe that he is one of the best at what he does, my only problem is, i am not even slightly interested in what he does

summary_comment: Professor Badang is highly regarded as one of the best teachers at Ohio State, known for his dedication and care towards his students' success. While some students find his classes demanding with extensive homework, most agree that he is passionate, funny, and extremely knowledgeable, making learning enjoyable and effective.
summary_comment_short: Professor Badang is highly regarded as one of the best teachers at Ohio State, known for his dedication to student success and engaging teaching style. Students appreciate his passion for teaching and his efforts to ensure they are well-prepared for exams, though some note the workload can be substantial.

Ratings.comment: Literally the best teacher that I have ever had at Ohio State. He cares so much about his students and how well they do. He is the best teacher and I would suggest for everyone to have him. I can't say enough great things about Germain.
Very easy and great teacher. Really cares about students and brings 110% every day to class. Wish he would have spoke more Spanish though.
Harsh grader, lots and lots of homework, I find myself doing more work on Spanish than my major classes, he loves to teach  and you'll learn a lot, but its a lot of work

Germain was a great instructor for 104. His instruction is well-focused, and he will prepare you well for the exams and the common exam at the end of the course. There was a lot of work involved, but I learned a lot. He is really funny and enjoys working and being around students. Take him!
Easy, clear instruction.
Germain is super nice and LOVES teaching. Go to class and do the homework and you will get an A.
Great Spanish teacher....brings 110% to class every day to try and convey the material.  Makes sure that you are well prepared for tests.

Germain was pretty much the best teacher that I've had at OSU so far. He is very nice and understanding and he also wants all of his students to do well. He is  EXTREMELY intelligent and really enjoys teaching. Also he is quite the charmer :-) I would recommend him to anyone!!!!

No joke, he was WITHOUT question the BEST teacher i've ever had in my entire life.  K-12, and all of college.  Most genuine, caring, fair teacher i've ever come across.  He really wants his students to learn and he is a truly great teacher and person!
LOVE HIM

Hard grader.  Lots of homework.  I am busting my ass and bearly passing the class.  And I do fine in other classes without putting hardly as much work into it. Durring the 4 years Ive been at OSU, I put more work into this class then any other class I have ever taken class.
AWESOME spanish teacher. I loved him. Made students extremely prepared for tests and kept the material interesting. Highly recommended.
Awesome teacher. Hands down.
I hate taking Spanish but this was a very easy class. He is helpful and keeps the classes interesting, and above all it's an easy A.
Funny Guy. I loved his random life lessons said in broken English throughout the course. Indirectly told you what was on the exams and went over stories thorougly
great professor & interesting man. easy-going in class. wish he taught upper-level spanish!
AMAZING teacher, and so much fun!  He made boring spanish stories interesting with his hilarious pictures and demonstrations.  Is eager to help, and incredibly friendly.

This was a really great class. Badang is very nice and helpful, although his Spanish is probably better then his English!  He can choose his favorites, but if you speak up a lot he will definitly like you.  The tests aren't bad and he's an easy grader.

Haha this class was hillarious we went outside for fiestas and since 99% of the class didn't understand him, he was an easy grader. He's hard to understand with his accent and I was mad that I didn't learn anything, but I had a blast and made a lot of friends instead!
AWESOME teacher. You can tell that he truly loves teaching, and he does very well in preparing his classes for upcoming tests and compositions. A++
Germain is awesome! He is very flexible and understanding. He is also very willing to help. Do your work and the exams will be fine.  Great class!

Germain is VERY nice and helpful. He is very flexible; he let me reschedule my oral exam twice. He gives GREAT review packets. He brings humor into the classroom. He goes to great lengths to help you to understand the material by drawing pictures and such

Germain has a really great attitude. Definately funin class. There is A LOT of homework though. Tests and compositions are easy as long as you pay attention in class. He's a good guy and will help you if you ask. Kind of silly and fun, which is a plus.

Assigns a lot of homework, but teaches well so  the tests aren't so bad. He's helpful if you ask for it. And he's overall a really nice guy. Sometimes he's a little difficult to understand, but I really enjoy him.

Was overly aggressive in pointing out errors.  Assigned a load of homework, to the point that I gave up trying to complete all of it (and I'm a 4.0 student).  Could not speak english very well (could be good or bad?).
Germain is very friendly and helpful, one of my favorite teachers in the Spanish Dept!
No Comments
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Ribaj is highly regarded for her excellent teaching and engaging approach. Students appreciate her selection of materials and dynamic classroom environment, which encourages interaction and real-world application of knowledge. Her passion for the subject matter is evident, making the class both enjoyable and intellectually stimulating.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ribaj is highly regarded for her excellent teaching and engaging approach, with students praising her knowledge, humor, and ability to make complex subjects accessible. Her classes are known for their dynamic and interactive nature, fostering a rich learning environment where students actively participate and apply theoretical concepts to real-life situations.

Ratings.comment: Excellent professor. She picked an outstanding collection of films to watch for the course and several good books. As long as you keep up with reading and pay attention in class, it's easy to pass. She makes attendance a large portion of the grade, so skipping is not something I would recommend. She was also very helpful.
She is an excellent professor. very fair if you do your part. great class atmosphere and discussion. HIGHLY recommended.

Really nice lady who's really into teaching her subject. Not attractive like the last post said (obviously from a girl). Makes you buy 5 paperbacks for class. I didn't read a page, just used sparknotes and got a B. Pretty boring class if you're not into old school lit. Got a lot done for other classes in this class.

I LOVE THIS PROFESSOR! She is amazing on so many levels and uber HOT! She explains things so well and is really hilarious. She is very knowledgeable about her subject, a true genius actually, and she is truly the best professor I have ever had. I like that she gets very excited about her subject and it is rare for her to stand in one spot.

Loved the materials selected by Prof. Ribaj for the class. Always applies what you learn in the classroom to real life.Always dynamic, Dr. Ribaj maintains an interactive classroom in which students are encouraged to share and learn from each other and to contribute in any way they can. She rocks!
Amazing experience having Professor Ribaj as a professor. 401 is one of the classes where I have most learned in my entire college career

Definitely one of the best Professors I have had. Really focused on helping students not simply understand the material but also to apply it as well. Very well organized. Excellent explanations in class. The way she makes you see the whole picture and how everything is interconnected... Definitely a  very enjoyable experience taking her class
Really cool prof. and really helpfull.  I thoroughly enjoyed writing "James Joyce auf Deutsch"
An excellent teacher.
Very knowledgable. Goes out of the way to help.
Absolute badass.
Explains everything very clearly. She always lets you know what is going to be on the tests. She is also very fun and its not uncommon for the class to be laughing

summary_comment: Professor Wood's teaching quality is highly variable according to student feedback. Some students found his class extremely disappointing, citing excessive and unhelpful work with no discernible improvement in skills, while others appreciated his TA's assistance and enjoyed the class, though they were split on the professor's effectiveness.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wood is widely regarded as a poor instructor, with many students finding his class overwhelming and unhelpful, leaving them feeling no improvement in their writing skills and describing the experience as overwhelmingly negative. In contrast, some students appreciate his teaching approach, particularly his Teaching Assistant, who is praised for being very helpful and making the class enjoyable.

Ratings.comment: Worst class i've taken here at Ohio State. There was a ton of useless work, and I still feel like I'm not better or worse at writing than when I started. I didn't learn anything except that i HATED being there. Jesse was unhelpful, unorganized and gave terrible essay props. if you have him- get out now.
What a nice teacher. I definitely liked this class...  Then again, I'm a language nerd, so, take this for what it's worth.  But I've taken many intro language courses, and his was better than most.
A great TA. Very helpful and makes class fun

summary_comment: Professor Garcia is highly regarded for his extensive knowledge and passion for Spanish history, literature, and culture, making him a valuable resource for students interested in these subjects. His lectures, while sometimes challenging due to his extensive content, are also described as entertaining and engaging. However, some students find his classes demanding, particularly regarding exam grading and the amount of reading required.
summary_comment_short: Professor Garcia is highly regarded for his extensive knowledge and engaging teaching style, making him a valuable resource for students interested in Spanish history, literature, and culture. Despite some criticisms regarding clarity and strict grading, his passion and expertise are widely acknowledged, earning him a strong reputation as an excellent educator.

Ratings.comment: If you want to know anything about Spain, you must take Prof.García. Besides being an awesome, hilarious person, he knows everything you could possibly want to know about Spanish history, literature, and culture, not to mention other fields.García is very important, very published, is a walking encyclopedia on Spain, and is just a very cool guy.
I really liked this class. He does have an accent but it's nt difficult to understand, andhe really loves what he's teaching. He knew so much about the topic that I fell in love with it too.
Hard to understand.  Lectures entire time, gives nothing for you to follow along with, no notes, no overheads, etc.  AVOID.
COME ON BUDDIES...HE´S THE BEST IN THE WORLD...SPANISH TOTAL...TAKING HIS CLASS IS MANDATORY IF YOU WANNA KNOW HOW SPAIN WORKS...
