this guy is hilarious, although lectures are boring at times.  you little room to mess up on the exam cuz every wrong answer lowers your grade by half a letter.  he wasnt very helpful when it came to the paper.  i got an A in class, but I studied hard.
Awesome professor, very learned

He is a brilliant and well-published man. In class he is entertaining, laid-back, easy to understand and a super nice guy.  However, be careful about asking him to be on your graduate examination committee!!!  He can be very difficult and often adds many things to your reading list.
García is HOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTT

Difficult class, but that's to be expected from an honors class. Garcia is an amazing professor. He really cares about the students, is very understanding, and does everything possible so that you can succeed. He even gave me his home phone number so I could call him to dicuss the final paper. Incredibly smart and hillarious. If you can, take him.
Fantastic professor who really cares about his students. One of my favorites! Viva Galicia!

although i dropped this class, it was not because of the teacher.  Dr. Garcia was old, but absolutely fantastic.  I'd been warned that he was comparatively easy to other teachers, but he's a great guy and he really cares about his students' well-being.

summary_comment: Professor Moss is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, with students consistently praising his dedication and effectiveness. Described as one of the best professors at OSU, he is known for making classes both challenging and engaging, while also providing ample support to ensure student success.
summary_comment_short: Professor Moss is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, with students consistently praising his dedication, engaging teaching style, and commitment to student success. His classes are challenging yet enjoyable, and many students consider him one of the best professors at OSU.

Ratings.comment: I took a 5-week course with him during summer term. He was fantastic. I really miss him, and would have taken him throughout my entire spanish sequence if he were still around.
Best I've had at OSU. Actually cares about the students and will spend plenty of time to help you.  Take this professor.
amazing teacher
best prof ever

Fantastic teacher. One of the best,maybe the best I have had at OSU. Great class,is challenging, had to read plenty of stories in the book and were a bit hard to understand, but spend plenty of time in class preparing for those and the test. Ended up with an A- in the class. GREAT TEACHER.
Cool Guy
great teacher, keeps class interesting and fun.  very helpful with students who are struggling, and it shows that he cares about his students.
On top of being really fun to take, is a great teacher. You will learn a ton from him without even realizing it's happening.
A really good professor, very helpful.
One of the nicest teachers you could have. Very helpful. Helps prepare well for tests. Hardest part of the class is the oral exam. Tests are pretty easy.

summary_comment: Professor Ruggiero is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, consistently receiving praise for her dedication and engaging approach. Students appreciate her extensive support, including providing flash drives with readings and creating an enjoyable learning environment through activities like watching movies and salsa dancing. Her enthusiasm, down-to-earth personality, and genuine care for her students' success make her classes stand out.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ruggiero is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, consistently engaging students and fostering a dynamic learning environment. She goes above and beyond to support her students, ensuring they have all necessary resources and showing genuine care for their success.

Ratings.comment: She did everything she could to help us learn.  She gave us flash drives with all the readings on it so we would always be able to do the readings.  I learned so much about latino culture and so many authors like Juana Inez de la Cruz, Lorca, Don Juan Manuel, Marti and so many others.
Great great instructor. Loves to teach and class is always interesting.
LOVED LOVED LOVED diana!! she is awesome.  very down to earth...really cares about the students and reaches out to them.  Can not say how great she is! take her class!!
The Best Spanish Class Ever Taken. We watched movies, and even learned how to Salsa. Extremely awesome. Definitely recommend her!
i love diana. she was so funny and cool and down to earth! I'd love to have her as a teacher again!
She's very helpful and energetic. She enjoys when students participate. And wants everyone to succeed in her class.

This teacher was awesome. I have never had such an amazing Spanish teacher, you will not be sorry if you sign up for this class.  She truly cares about how are you doing in this class, and will help you every step of the way.

Awesome teacher, her class was fun and she was always laughing and having a good time.  I strongly recommend her as a teacher. As long as you do the homework and participate, you wont have any problems in her class. I would definately take another class with this teacher.  A+ teacher!!
oh my god.  i never knew i could do so well in a spanish class..  she rocks, i got thru the class and the next one too all based on her class,  she is smart, and  a great teacher.  take this class!

She's awesome.  She's very sweet, funny and smart.  It sounds corny, but she makes learning fun, even when it's a winter night class.  Be prepared to do your work though, she won't let you get away with not doing it!
I had her for 102N66 and purposely scheduled her for my 104n class....made class fun and interesting...never fell asleep in that class...taught us how to dance and everything else. Good teacher
She made spanish interesting and I didn't think that was possible. Best Spanish teacher I've ever had.
GREAT! BEST TEACHER I'VE EVER HAD
Great instructor, easy class, so much fun. Looked forward to this class every day.

summary_comment: Professor Quimjian is generally perceived as an effective and approachable instructor, particularly for entry-level classes. Students appreciate her clear teaching methods and her efforts to ensure all students understand the material before moving forward. However, opinions vary; some find her grading strict and her classroom environment intimidating, especially for those who feel she may not favor them.
summary_comment_short: Professor Quimjian is perceived as an effective and approachable instructor, particularly praised for her helpfulness and clear explanations, making the class accessible even for those who find the subject challenging. However, some students report a more divisive experience, noting that her teaching style can make students feel judged or favored, and that her methods may not suit everyone's learning style.

Ratings.comment: Easy class. Just do the work. Be sure to participate in class. Its not hard, so people with bad reviews probably just didn't study enough. She's very nice and you shouldn't stress out about this entry level class.

At first I was excited to have her since she has pretty good reviews. Wrong. If she doesn't like you, your screwed. She made you feel stupid if you answered a question wrong and favored the kids that got 100% on everything. She even told another teacher I didn't deserve to be there.

Loved her class, even though 104 is kind of hard, she does a great job of teaching.  She's the nicest instructor I've had in the language department.  She brings in food a lot of the time.  And she looks like Sally Field.  Overall a great woman... I give this review even though I might fail the class.

Absolutely LOVED this class with Lina! Taught things very well and made sure entire class understood things before moving on to new subject matter.  Went at a perfect pace and taught exactly what was needed to be known for the exams.  A great teacher if you are looking to have fun while learning the french that you need to know!

i absolutely LOVED madame lina. she's been the most helpful, interesting, energetic teacher i've had at osu. she grades fair and will explain things in english. her review sheets before exams helped so much with what to study. and she brought was cupcakes just about once a week. i loved everything about this class.

103.66 Very helpful, made it easy to learn.  She had realistic expectations and understood the class was required for most students.   Gave review sheets before midterms and went over key components.    I wish she tought 104.

She was incredibly helpful and graded easy. Even though the class was supposed to be taught completely in French, she spoke a lot of English which was good for explanations. She spent more time explaining difficult grammar than the department wanted, but it was helpful. She also told us specifically things to study for the exams.

summary_comment: Professor Mayne is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality and deep passion for her subject matter, particularly in film studies and French literature. Students consistently praise her ability to inspire critical thinking, make complex topics engaging, and create a dynamic learning environment that fosters both enjoyment and academic growth.
summary_comment_short: Professor Mayne is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, with students praising her profound insights, engaging lectures, and ability to inspire critical thinking. Her classes are noted for being both informative and enjoyable, encouraging active participation and deep understanding of the subject matter.

Ratings.comment: I love her. She is fantastic and has a true love for French cinema.

I took an intro film course as an undergrad, and have never forgotten Judith Mayne's brilliant insights and provocative insights. She made quite an impression on me. Next week, when I teach my first film course, I will be thinking of Prof Mayne.

Awesome class, awesome teacher. Wasn't interested in film before, but now I love it. She's easy to understand, and she's not too hard-core about grammar in the class, but participation is key. Spend time writing the papers and you will not only get a good grade, but you might learn something as well. I would take another class with her.

In order to do well in this class, it is crucial that you attend ALL lectures/film viewings, put effort into the papers, and participate in discussions in class and on Carmen.  Also, make sure to study your notes well for the exams!  Overall, very good teacher and class!
Excellent class.  Excellent teacher.  This combination made the French Women's Lit course one of the best I've ever taken.  Take this professor if you want to learn French.  Period.

I had the pleasure of taking her class back in 1988. She was so good that she is one of two professors whose names I can remember--and I was sleeping with the other one. (In the 80's that was still ok. ha.)  She challenged me to THINK critically. She is one of a dying breed--a "Born Teacher".
Great class!  I had a lot of fun and learned a lot of interesting things.  I hadn't seen any of the movies we watched/analyzed and I'm glad I saw them in this class.

Professor Mayne is an awesome teacher. She makes an already intersting class even more interesting. She is very clear in what she wants out of the class and exellently prepares you for  exams. She is also very interested in what others think about the subject, and is  open to other opinions.
She is a great professor, you just have to be as interested in the subject as she is!

Okay, I know her in and out of school, and let me tell you she is the best! If you ask for help-she's there for you. She is too funny, you just have to understand her humor. The best Professor at the whole University. Just come to class and be prepared!
No Comments
She's awesome. She's incredibly intellingent and has a lot to offer the students. She is most certainly not rude, she just has a dry sarcastic sense of humor.

she is a rude person, if you agree with her and make up bullshit about how great what she's teaching is, then you'll do fine. if you actually tell her your true opinion, however, then WATCH OUT. there goes your grade in the class.

summary_comment: Professor Gordon is generally considered helpful and approachable, with students noting her willingness to assist when needed. Her teaching style can be challenging, particularly for understanding cultural nuances, which some find beneficial for long-term learning. However, her communication can sometimes be confusing, especially regarding deadlines and cultural references.
summary_comment_short: Professor Gordon is generally considered helpful and approachable, with students noting her willingness to assist when needed. However, her teaching style and cultural explanations sometimes lead to confusion, particularly for those seeking a deeper understanding of German language and culture.

Ratings.comment: Not really that bad. Took time to help me if I needed it. Actually was tougher than my 104 teacher, which helped later on.

She's nice however she doesn't really have a grasp on American culture. All of my professors cancelled classes on Thanksgiving, except her. She tries to explain things in English but we ended up getting more confused. If you are just in the class for the GEC take her, but if you want to learn some German language or culture, then take someone else.

Am I the only person to have found it strange having a Russian who sometimes has a difficult time speaking English teaching me German? She's nice, but doesn't understand American culture very well. She e-mailed us on Thanksgiving and wanted something turned in the next day. All the group activities were nice, though.
She is terrible and mean spirited... they'll probably delete this like last time as you apparently aren't allowed to say someone isn't good...

Helpful and nice. Work is relatively easy.. if you mess up a homework assignment you can redo it and turn it in next class. Exams aren't too hard. For 104 she speaks mostly in German but will clarify in English.

summary_comment: Professor Levy is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, making complex material engaging and enjoyable. She is praised for her patience, effective communication, and ability to make language classes dynamic through active participation. Students consistently highlight her expertise and her ability to keep the material interesting.
summary_comment_short: Professor Levy is an exceptional teacher known for her engaging and effective methods, making complex material accessible and enjoyable. She excels in fostering an interactive learning environment that enhances understanding and retention of the subject matter.

Ratings.comment: An amazing teacher. Helped me learn Hebrew and corrected all the wrong things my previous instructor had taught me. Patient and very willing to help. Made it fun. One of the best teachers I've ever had.
Makes the class fun.  Does not just lecture, actually has us participate (which is great for language classes). Makes the class fun and interesting. I always looked forward to her class. Good pick!

Chen-Li (hebrew name, not chinese) is an all-around good teacher. Foreign languages are a bit of a crap shoot in the prof. department, but you're safe here. She knows her stuff, communicates it effectively, and changes gears before things get too dry. The cultural bits were great and class participation doesn't feel like pulling teeth.

summary_comment: Professor Gurari is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, consistently praised for her kindness and dedication to helping students succeed. Her classes are noted for their engaging nature and the instructor's genuine passion for the subject matter. Students appreciate her supportive approach and find the class both enjoyable and valuable.
summary_comment_short: Professor Gurari is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, consistently helping students and making the class engaging. Students praise her kindness and effectiveness in facilitating learning.

Ratings.comment: By far one of the best professors at Ohio State. Always strives to help students and make the class interesting.
Extremely nice lady. By far my favorite professor. She strives to help you pass the class.
It was like taking a class from a favorite Aunt.  She has a very kind heart.

Shaula was a great teacher.  She really loves to teach the subject and does a great job doing so.  There are no visual presentations of the notes, but she does reiterate previous information the next day.  Tests are all short answer and essay, so you must study!  But the class is definately worth it!
easiest class. very helpful. not too much work.  almost an easy a.

A wonderful class and a wonderful instructor. Prior to taking this class I had no knowledge or interest in the history of Israel..but afterwards I gained a better understanding of this country and an appreciation for it! Definitely take her as an instructor and this class if you can!

What a nice lady!  I loved this class, and she was a great teacher.You only have two tests, and everything you need to know you go over in class; she's great- she's nice,helpful,and interesting.Take this class with her!!!

summary_comment: Professor Costanzo is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, making the class enjoyable and often ending early. He is known for his helpfulness with essays and his laid-back approach to attendance, though he still covers material thoroughly in his lectures. Students appreciate his knowledge and find his classes both interesting and amusing.
summary_comment_short: Professor Costanzo is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, making classes enjoyable and often ending early. Students find him very helpful with essays, providing drafts and corrections, and he is known for being laid-back and easy to work with, though the class primarily relies on lectures rather than tests.

Ratings.comment: coolest, nicest prof. youll ever have. Very helpful when it comes to your essays. Accepts late work but their pretty easy for you to hand them in on time. Doesnt give tests but does do essays since its a English class. Does drafts and corrects them for you to do well. He told us he was from Ohio State but now teaches in College of Staten Island.

Angelo is pretty easy and laid-back as a professor.  If you have much of a linguistics background at all you probably don't need to go to class very often because a lot of it is common sense and he posts his notes on Carmen.  He's got a lot of good stories and a good sense of humor though and usually ends early, so class isn't too bad!

He uses the book and it is actually easy/interesting anyway, but mostly tests come from his lectures. His lectures are enjoyable and I found myself laughing quite a bit just at his awkward delivery. I love what the guy below wrote about being the most awkward man. He definately is and I hope he never loses it! He's very knowledgeable, too.
Pretty much the best class I had all quarter. Angelo is hilarious and awesome in a super awkward way. He has to be the most awkward man ever.
No Comments
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Houchens is known for her extensive resources and dedication to student success, though her teaching style can be challenging, particularly for early morning classes. Students appreciate her willingness to help during presentations and her fairness in grading, but many find her lectures heavy on some topics and light on others, leading to significant self-study outside of class. Overall, while the workload is demanding, especially at 7:30 AM, her support and the substantial learning opportunities make the class worthwhile for those willing to
summary_comment_short: Professor Houchens is generally regarded as knowledgeable but struggles with effective communication, leading to much of the learning occurring outside of class. Students find her classes demanding, particularly early morning sessions, with significant homework and project requirements, but many appreciate her support and the substantial amount they learn.

Ratings.comment: Kathleen seems to have good subject knowledge but does not communicate it well. Myself and other students believe most of our learning has occurred outside the classroom. She would often cover just a few topics of a chapter very extensively instead of teaching everything with less detail/ repetitiveness.

Helpful prof :) Class is a good way to get rid of 103 and 104 in one quarter. 730 is annoying. There is a lot of work associated w/this class but if you schedule well & study every night it's legit :) I recommend it!

PROS: Exceptional, well-rounded Spanish course. She provides SO MANY resources to help study. CONS: 7:30am 5 days a week! 2-3 hours of HW every night. Used 4 books. She spoke in Spanish so much that half the class did not pay attention most of the time. Extra projects are required unlike other courses. VERDICT: Its challenging but fun. RECOMENDED!

This class is a tough one; consistently 2-3 hours of homework per night, and a few major projects to do.  That being said, Kathie is a wonderful professor.  She will help you out, and truly wants you to do well.  Work hard and reap the benefits.  I highly recommend taking the class, even though it is at 7:30.  Suck it up, you can do it.

Kathie is a good teacher and grades fairly easy. When giving presentations she will even help you out if you forget words. A 730 class sucks, but its an easy way to get 2 classes down to 1. Definitely take her 111 class!
I thought Kathie did a great job of making a 730 class bearable. Its a lot of work but as long as you put forth a solid effort she is very nice with grading! I learned a lot!
She is NOT a "prof," check the credentials on her website. Worst Spanish teacher I've ever had. Do NOT take this class (and I got an A!).
Great prof! I definitely recommend her to anyone looking to work hard and learn alot. She is one of the good ones. Class plays heck with the social life though.
She is an amazing teacher. A lot of work, but thats expected from a 10 credit course. She is very fair, and always willing to help. I stronly recommend this course!!

Not the most exciting class but she will deffinately work with you if you have problems. There is alot of work, but thats to be expected from the course. Study hard and you will do fine. She is very fair.
Nice teacher who is well organized and wants the students to succeed.
Blah!! That is all I have to say about this prof.  At least try to act excited about what you are teaching.
she will start you off shaking, but once you can make her smile she is all yours

summary_comment: Professor Hens is a knowledgeable and experienced native German speaker and translator, which lends credibility to his teachings. However, his teaching style can be unpredictable and sometimes perceived as distant or even rude, though many find him helpful and accessible when willing to engage. Overall, his classes are participatory and open, focusing on student input and interest, but some students find him demanding and less approachable during office hours.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hens is a knowledgeable and qualified instructor, particularly respected for his deep understanding of German language and translation, yet his teaching style can be challenging and unpredictable, making it necessary for students to adapt and participate actively. Some find him distant and potentially arrogant, while others appreciate his laid-back approach and openness to diverse ideas, though many note that he expects significant prior knowledge and self-directed learning.

Ratings.comment: He's kind of a weird guy. Hard to gauge. But he's great once you get used to him. He lets the class flow fairly freely and doesn't force people to talk who aren't willing. That being said, class was participation based, so talk! He won't insult or even correct your German and he doesn't care if you slip in an English word. His grading was fair.
I learned a lot in this class. Professor was helpful and accessible, he knows what hes doing.
He definitely thinks his way is the right way and the best way.  It's nice to know he is a native German and a professional translator, so he's very qualified, but as far as teaching, he was just OK.
No Comments
The assignments were interesting. Comes to class and basically teaches whatever comes to mind. He's rude and somewhat arrogant.

Nice guy, a bit distant, but willing to help, makes classes pretty open, and laid back which makes them interesting. Outside knowledge and thoughts on what classes want to cover seems welcome. Expected research outside the class. Knowledge used from all realms of academia which is unique.
No Comments
demands extensive knowledge of material with little or no into to background info, not especially accessible in office hours or otherwise
the only german professor i've hated.  he treats students like they're all dumb.
Difficult, makes students leave class knowing material, seems strict but nice

summary_comment: Professor Rolf is highly regarded for her engaging and supportive teaching style, making Italian classes enjoyable and effective. Students appreciate her willingness to help and her ability to explain concepts clearly, often finding her approach both fun and enlightening. Her dedication to her students and the subject matter is evident in her thorough lesson delivery and availability to answer questions.
summary_comment_short: Professor Rolf is highly regarded for her engaging and fun teaching style, making Italian classes enjoyable and memorable for her students. She is known for her supportive approach, clear explanations, and genuine care for both her students' learning and their personal development.

Ratings.comment: She helped make the class fun. Although I can't speak a lick of it now, Italian classes were among the most fun I've had. It helped having a good looking instructor who was kind and seemed willing to help students.
No Comments
she pms'es.... so watch out.
Alison makes Italian fun to learn, and she is always very concerned with how she can help her students.
Definitely one of the better instructors at OSU. Does NOT talk down to students, is helpful and loves students with personality. Great teacher and an even better person

Introduced me to the language in a very enlightening and helpful way.  She made sure the class was always reviewing the material daily in class and she was always there to answer questions and help students.  Very interesting ways of getting information across to students and made it easy to understand and develop the language.  Stongly recommended
Mrs. Rolf really cares about students and about Italian. she makes if fun.
Alison is a really cool teacher, and she explains things well.  She also can be lenient with her grading.

Alison was a great teacher and her enthusiasm made me excited to come to italian class!!  I really hope that I can take another one of her classes! Whoever wrote that last review one must have had a different Alison! Alison rocks!

Alison was an awful teacher.  She talked down to the class and treated the students like they were children.  I disliked her personality, her teaching methods, and just about everything else.  I will not take another class that she teaches.

summary_comment: Professor Alley is highly respected for her professionalism and command of the subject matter, ensuring that grading and course content are appropriately challenging. She is widely regarded as an exceptional language instructor, particularly for Russian, due to her native fluency and deep passion for teaching, which significantly enhances the learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Alley is highly professional and commands great respect from students, ensuring that grading and course material are appropriately challenging. She is widely regarded as an exceptional language instructor, particularly for Russian, due to her native fluency and deep passion for teaching, making her a strong recommendation for anyone interested in learning the language.

Ratings.comment: Immensely professional teacher. Both commands and demands respect. Grading and course work is spot on considering difficulty levels.

She is the best language professor I've ever had. She's a native speaker and has a true passion for teaching Russian. As the language supervisor of the department, she knows what she's doing. You will learn like 10 words in each class. Amazing -- definitely recommend her to anyone.
I love Maria/Masha!!!!!!!  The best!

summary_comment: Professor Amell is highly regarded for his extensive knowledge of Spanish film and its societal context, often engaging students through discussions and film viewings. Students appreciate his laid-back teaching style and his ability to make the material enjoyable and accessible, though some noted that he could improve in terms of class engagement and assignment clarity.
summary_comment_short: Professor Amell is highly regarded for his extensive knowledge of Spanish film and its societal context, making class engaging through discussions and film viewings. Despite being described as very laid-back and helpful, some students found him vague on assignments and struggled with engagement during discussions.

Ratings.comment: Very laid back, definitely knows a great deal about Spanish film and its relation to society. Class was mostly discussion and film viewings. On a negative note, our class did not participate and he didn't really know how to get us engaged. Could be somewhat vague about assignments, and I never got anything back before my final grade.

Obviously very knowledgeable about Spanish Film and we watched some really good movies. One presentation, two short papers, a final long research paper and a final exam. Wasn't too difficult but days we had discussions were a bit boring. Attendance/participation important. Allows you to speak/write in either Spanish or English
Sam Amell is by far the best Spanish teacher I have ever had. He explains everything very clearly and is extremely laid back. He really made Spanish class awesome!

Sam Amell may be the best OSU professor I've ever had. I feared taking my Spanish classes. It had been four years since I had last taken one. I've never had so much fun in one class. Now let me make it very, very clear to you. This is not an easy class (thus making it 'fun'), and you will learn a great deal. 103.66 is fun because of Sam Amell.

Best Spanish teacher ever! He doesn't always speak in Spanish like all of the other teachers, so you actually get to understand him and learn from the class. Overall a great guy and fun class, I've learned a lot!
Easy basic level spanish class. Theres a fair amount of homework but the quizzes and tests arent too hard. He makes the class as fun as possible
Sam's a great guy and he made the material fun and interesting.  It was a great class.  I had a lot of fun playing games and remembering all the spanish I had forgotten.  Highly recommended.

Amell is an extremely helpful, nice guy. You can ask him anything and he's always willing to help. You can email him and he replies back within a day. He teached the material (103.66) & it made sense. It was mostly review from high school, for me, but overall it wasn't a bad class.

This class was very interesting. We studied the film director, Luis Bunuel. We watched movies every Tuesday and had discussions every Thursday. He leads most of the discussions and does a lot of the talking. Class participation is 30% of your final grade. He is very kind and helpful and gave us the option of writing in Spanish or English!
This class was excellent.  He chose great films and related them to Spanish society.  One presentation, a final, and a final research paper.

Professor Amell was an amazing teacher.  So full of knowledge and with a genuine interest in the students.  Easy to get along with and a fair grader.  Definitely would highly recommend him to any and every one.

I have taken four courses with this Professor and he is the best. Extremely intelligent, very open. You can learn tonnes.Very knowledgeable in his subject area and very willing to help. I'd recommend him hands down.

summary_comment: Professor Colarossi is highly regarded for her enthusiastic and engaging teaching style, which can initially seem intense but is ultimately very effective and motivating. Students consistently praise her humor, accessibility, and genuine interest in teaching, though some note her high expectations. Her energy and positive approach create a fun and challenging learning environment.
summary_comment_short: Professor Colarossi is highly regarded for her enthusiastic and engaging teaching style, which can be motivating and sometimes intense but ultimately rewarding. Students consistently praise her humor, helpfulness, and genuine interest in teaching, though some note her energetic and sometimes forceful approach.

Ratings.comment: She was wonderful and I am sad that othe OSU students are are going to miss learning from her... And she was sooooo hot.

Not going to lie, the first couple days of class you won't be sure what to make of her and she will probably scare you a little bit. But thats just her sense of humor. She is really funny and very helpful. One of my favorite teachers by far.

Very enthusiastic and a lot of fun!  She's also very understanding if you have a legit excuse for being absent.  Sometimes she can be a little in your face, but it's mainly to motivate you into participating in class and learning.
Alessia is very fun and cool.  Energetic doesn't even begin to describe her.  She is genuinely interested in teaching.
Alessia is CRAZY.  Loud, full of life, funny.  She expects a lot of her students, but she is probably the best foreign language teacher that I've had at Ohio State.
One of my all-time favorite instructors!  She's funny & nice, the class was fun & challenging at the same time.  I even named my daughter's middle name Alessia

she's one the most enthusiastic teachers i've ever had. she is very helpful and funny too. she makes you relaxed and not worry or feel stupid about making mistakes. easy on the eyes too, she's a very cute signorina!
Awesome teacher!
Alessia was a great instructor. The class was difficult only because it was at 8:30 in the morning and thats never a good idea, but she made it fun, interesting, and challenging at the same time.
lots of energy
very enthusiastic, eager to help, funny, doesn't make you feel pressured or stupid if you don't understand what's going on
One of the best instructors I've had!
Very informative on italian culture and very enthusiastic about teaching.  Helps students when needed, and adds humor to the class.  oh, and HOT!
No Comments
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Cantarino offers an easy class with no midterms or final exams, relying primarily on weekly online quizzes and participation points. While the lectures can be boring and the class structure repetitive, students who complete the required mini-essays and engage in class discussions tend to receive high grades.
summary_comment_short: Professor Cantarino offers an easy class with no midterms or final, relying primarily on weekly online quizzes and participation points. Lectures are described as boring and mandatory, but he is praised for his knowledge of Spanish culture and provides a straightforward path to an A through consistent effort and engagement.

Ratings.comment: Easy A. Do the quizzes and put some effort into them. Come to class and try to participate. Lectures can be boring, but he knows a lot about Spanish Culture (he wrote the textbook). No midterms and no final. Just the online quizzes.

At the start, no one in class really knew what was going on. He was very confusing in giving instructions but by week 3 we knew what to do. He has his own website and you are assigned mini-essays (about 5-10 sentences per question) for each chapter. You basically determine your grade. Do as many essays as possible. I got an A. Participation points.

Such an easy class. As mentioned, weekly h/w but no exams. Sounds like everyone got an A. But literally the most boring lectures youll ever sit through (and mandatory attendance!). But if you have a laptop or something to read, its fine. Take him if you're just looking for an A.
WHAT A GREAT CLASS. everyone was on their computers the entire time.  there are no exams or tests.  you just do random homeworks online and everyone got a's.  he is so cute and funny.

This is the worst class I have ever taken and I'm in my second year of grad school.  The professor seems nice enough, but his class is a waste of time. Every day, students go around the room reading papers one sentence at a time, while the class then has to offer suggestions/edits on the sentence they just heard without having it in front of them.

Really nice guy, but very boring class. Attendance is mandatory so it's def worth showing up. All he does is read from the eBook during lecture, so the class seems to take forever. But the class was easy- no exams, just online hw that you turn in once/week. I think most people got an A.

I can't understand why anyone would recommend this guy.  His class was by far my worst experience with the Spanish Department.  Class time was completely useless, we spent every second of the 2 1/2 hours doing pointless examples from the book or going around in a circle, correcting mistakes in our essays one by one.  Avoid, at least for 603.

Class was a waste of time. Only one paper for the whole class so there is no previous knowledge of how he grades.  He seems very knowledgeable in his area but listening to him lecture the whole time was boring.

A lot of work, but no real due dates. As long as you got it in before the end of the quarter, it was fine. I got my appendix out that quarter, and he was really understanding and told me to take all the time I needed. A little boring, but really helpful. I've signed up for a nother class with him.

SUPER boring. does nothing but talk, and if you can't listen for very long, it will be agonizing. but! he does drop funny little comments and shows you art and plays music. he's a nice guy. my only beef is that he didn't respond to my emails and the homeworks were time-consuming. otherwise, i think he gave everyone an A and he's real knowledgeable.

Yes, he is a great prof. He knows a lot but doesn't assume that the students know everything.  Lectures were interesting cuz we would talk about a diversity of topics, look at pictures, and listen to music.  I would definitely recommend him.

This professor was very helpfull and knowledgable.  He tries to be funny in class by making little comments here and there and succeeds most of the time.  I would sign up for any class taught by this professr.
He is a very intelligent and helpful professor.  He wants to see students succeed and helps them to do so.  You learn a lot of information in his classes.  Highly recommended.

summary_comment: Professor Wentzel is highly regarded for her engaging and knowledge-rich lectures, making subjects like Greek mythology interesting and accessible. She is described as very helpful, pleasant, and easy on the eyes, though her assessments can be challenging. Students appreciate her willingness to assist and make class interactive, though the tests and quizzes require diligent preparation.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wentzel is highly regarded for her engaging and knowledgeable approach to teaching, making complex subjects like Greek mythology accessible and interesting. Students appreciate her willingness to help and her efforts to make classes dynamic, though some find the material challenging with tough quizzes and tests.

Ratings.comment: Rocki is a super cool professor. She gives good feedback on papers and makes her class interesting. If you came to class and paid attention, quizzes and tests weren't very hard

I had Rocki for Classics 224 a few quarters ago. She is very helpful and extremely nice. The quizzes were challenging, but her exams were easier. She gave a nice curve at the end of the class as well. I would highly recommend this teacher for anyone thinking about taking Classics 224. She is an amazing teacher overall!!!
Very interesting and funny prof! she definately makes Greek Mythology interesting! A little crazy but its endearing after a while!

Rocki was one of my favorite teachers. She is very willing to help, and if you read what you're supposed to, the class is not hard at all. She has guest speakers, and trys to make class as interesting as possible. She is easy on the eyes as well, so that's a plus!! I recommend taking this teacher. She's very knowledgeable, and fun to work with!

She is very knowledgeable and nice, always willing to help. There is a lot of reading, 6 books worth, but she assigns specific sections to read. Each week there is a quiz for 10 points and it is TIMED (10 min)!! Sometimes she uses quotes on quizzes and test which can be challenging. If you read and go to lecture, you should get atleast a B if not A
Great teacher and really knowledgeable. Extremely pleasant and helpful, is good at reaching students at all skill levels. Grades hard though.
I've never had a better TA.  She's really very good and professional and makes me want to come to class!
Very hard tests and quizese, but willing to explain anything, really nice.  Challenges her students so they can learn, not to be mean at all.

summary_comment: Professor Baumgardner is highly regarded as an engaging and enthusiastic teacher who makes the class enjoyable and fun. Students appreciate her dedication to teaching and helping students, though some note that her teaching style can be unconventional. Overall, she is seen as a fair and effective instructor, despite occasional criticisms regarding attendance policies and group work.
summary_comment_short: Professor Baumgardner is highly regarded as an engaging and enthusiastic teacher who makes the class enjoyable and fun, despite the challenging workload. Students consistently praise her dedication to teaching and helping students, though some note that the lack of a strict syllabus and group work can be less beneficial.

Ratings.comment: Amazing and hot!
She is a very good teacher. I have learned so much for her class, i couldnt ask for a better teacher!!!
She is very interested in teaching and helping everyone.  Her upbeat style makes the class fun.  If you have to take Spanish, try to get into her class.

She was interested in teaching the class and helping the students. The group work was not all that helpful. The Spanish department has a strict attendance policy which needs to be changed. Overall she is a good and fair instructor.
Ingrid cares about the student.  She wants to make the class fun and enjoyable.  She is very fair, and helpful.
Hard, but she is so much fun! Eccentric seeming at first, but you will learn SO much from this lady!
shes really fun- it sucks to have spanish everyday but she makes it go by fast.  shes awesome.
extremely energetic. makes the class fun. doesn't follow a syllabus, which can be a good thing. collects homework weekly. semi-lenient on test grading. overall an enjoyable class.

Overall a good spanish teacher.  Very enthusiastic and interested in helping students in her class.  She grades fairly and actually does get work back in a reasonable amount of time for the most part. But the participation grade in spanish courses at OSU is **** and so is the attendance policy.
Too much useless group work.

she was terrible. it was hard to tell when we had homework and when we didn't, and i am actually fluent in spanish (others were not).  she told us that she hadn't given us our research papers back yet because her cat thought they made a nice bed.
She is a fine professor.
I was not looking forward to taking this class at all, but I couldn't have asked for a better teacher.  Easy to understand and very interested in helping students succeed.
Great instructor. Full of enthusiasm which makes the otherwise boring material interesting. Definitely a good choice for a Spanish 104 class requirement.
No Comments

very helpful and very knowledgeable in the language.  class is not difficult so long as you understand and keep up with homework.  she's a little out there sometimes, but nice and fun.  very good teacher.

Very fun tecaher to watch teach. Although I felt she did a good job the class was still really hard  cuz its a foreign language so I still hate Spanish.  Very understanding about missing class and making up assignments. Works hard to help her students.
Really nice and really helpful. She made me not hate Spanish. She's really enthusiastic and funny and makes the class worthwhile to go to everyday. And she prepares you well for the midterms.
Ingrid was my favorite instructor this year. She was really helpful and always had time for students. Her enthusiasm made the class a very enjoyable experience.

summary_comment: Professor Logue is highly regarded for her passion and dedication to teaching Spanish, making her classes both engaging and challenging. Students appreciate her supportive approach and willingness to help, though they note that success requires significant effort. Her dynamic teaching style and commitment to student success make her a standout instructor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Logue is highly regarded for her passion and dedication to teaching Spanish, making her classes engaging and enjoyable despite their demanding nature. Students consistently praise her energy, willingness to help, and ability to create a fun learning environment while pushing them to excel.

Ratings.comment: Fantastic instructor! She demands hard work but you will be rewarded. Avid listener, passionate about the subject, and truly wants you to learn and succeed at Spanish. Demanding course work at times, but she gives you ample tools, tricks, and notes to be successful at this course. I would suggest her for class if you struggle with Spanish.
She's such an amazing professor!  I consider myself a lucky student to have her as a professor.  She tries her best to make the class enjoyable and reach out to all of her students.
I had her fall quarter 2004 for spanish 103.66.  She is the best spanish teacher ever!

My favorite teacher at OSU thus far. Professor Logue sings, dances, and generally just makes herself look silly for the enjoyment of her class. I think her favorite saying is "WOO HOO!" I've heard horror stories about other Spanish professors, so I consider myself quite lucky to have had her.
Unless you have a good foundation in spanish, don't take this class.  However, if you are willing to put this class first, then she will enable you to test out of the the next one.

Melissa is the best teacher I've had at OSU so far.  She always goes out of her way to help her students and is very understanding.  She makes class funny so that you are more interested.  Definetly take spanish with her!!!

She was a great instructor. I definitely recommend taking her class if you can. Usually teaches late afternoon classes, so it kinda sucks having to go to Spanish on a Friday afternoon. But she makes it worth your time. Gives out helpful handouts and is always willing to help.
Senora Logue is a great teacher to have! She's always energetic and loves to joke around. The class isn't overly difficult, but it is demanding.  But she's the best spanish teacher i've had so far.

She is an excellent teacher. Spanish is definitely not a strong point of mine and she is very patient and always willing to help. She's hilarious too and really gets down on your level and never makes you feel stupid when you don't know what you're talking about...TAKE HER IF YOU CAN!
Very helpful, funny, speaks in English often enough.  Easy class focusing on verb tenses and vocab.  Grades essays generously.
VERY HELPFUL!! Willing to stay late to help you out. A very good instructor!

summary_comment: Professor Castaldi is highly regarded for his helpfulness and approachability; students find him easy to understand, especially if they have a background in Italian. His lectures are valuable for understanding the course material, though attendance is not graded. The course structure relies heavily on a midterm (30%) and a final (70%), with grades being generally fair but detailed-oriented, and movie analysis plays a significant role in the assessments.
summary_comment_short: Professor Castaldi is highly regarded for his helpfulness, especially when students seek assistance. His lectures are crucial for understanding the material, particularly due to the emphasis on memorizing specific details, and attendance, although not graded, significantly aids in performance.

Ratings.comment: Really helpful if you approach him for help. Native Italian, I found him easy to understand but Italian is my minor. Others couldn't understand at all. Midterm was 30% and much harder than the final (70%). You must remember the random little facts he says in class. Attendance isn't counted toward grade but EXTREMELY helpful. Most movies were great.

To get an A going to class is a must.  Take notes during lecture for the essays on the mid term and exam. movies are ok.  as long as you go to class, do the readings and pay attention to lecture you'll do ok. only points are from a midterm (30% of grade) and final (70% of grade) make sure to incorporate the readings on the exams for an A
if you wanna do well you have to go to class and take notes. the 2 books are useless. i got an A in the class without opening either of them.
I thought he was far from an easy grader. He did let us choose the subject of our oral exam, however. He's a nice guy and very helpful but he doesn't grade so easily.

The grades were based off of a midterm and final but he was an easy grader. Interesting lecture on the background and history about the movies. Attendance is not mandatory but get an A you have to go.

Couldn't decide if I like him or not.  Easy teacher, class was simple enough, movies got better as time went on.  But only a midterm and final, and you have to watch the movies and read the material to do really well on them.
Highly recommended.  He's a great teacher, and also pretty funny.
Funny guy, pretty good teacher. A little harsh on grading...every mistake is taken into account. However, overall, pretty interesting. He at least seemed like he enjoys teaching
He was awesome at teaching and reall interested in what he taught.  I definitely recommend to take Italian from him, because he's not too hard, but he makes the class really interesting.
Great teacher, extremely enthusiastic/energetic, knowledgable, and willing to help as much as is needed.  Strongly recommend.
Really easy test grader, even if you suck at Italian, you can get a decent grade in his class.

summary_comment: Professor Ashton is highly regarded for his engaging and passionate teaching style, making even challenging subjects like Spanish interesting and enjoyable. Students appreciate his availability and willingness to assist with any questions or needs, though his attractiveness can sometimes distract from the material. His creative and memorable teaching methods, such as breaking a bottle to illustrate a point, further enhance the learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ashton is highly regarded for his engaging and passionate teaching style, making even challenging subjects like Spanish interesting and enjoyable. His dedication to helping students and willingness to go above and beyond in his support is evident, though his attractiveness reportedly makes it difficult for some to focus.

Ratings.comment: Hottest teacher i have ever had.  Will help you with anything you need and is really interested in the material. Only downside, sometimes it´s difficult to remember your spanish when you´re looking at him... actually, its difficult to remember anything when you´re looking at him.
soooooo hot!!!!!! I never missed class with Timo!
Great teacher, able to make even Spanish intersting.  Helps if you have questions.  Class was always fun.

Once we got into a disagreement about the use of present progressive.  I thought he was going to get a worksheet from his bag, but instead he pulled out an empty bottle.  He drew a circle on the floor and then broke the bottle on his desk.  He motioned me to the ring with a taunt, saying, "This is how they do it in Mexico, chico."  Best class ever.
No Comments
He's a wonderful teacher! One time he offered to stay after class and helped me on a paper he assigned for my class to write on.
Had him as a teacher when he was working on his Masters. GREAT person!
He is so nice, interested in teaching, and attractive it is impossible not to love him! So hot it is cool.
So nice, interested in students, easy on the eyes too!
Great guy to get along with!

summary_comment: Professor Boney is an enthusiastic and clear lecturer who moves quickly but keeps classes engaging with real-world examples and a touch of humor. While some students found her unhelpful and cold, others appreciated her high standards and dedication to the subject, noting that her fast pace made the class dynamic rather than boring. Overall, her teaching style is effective for those who engage actively with the material.
summary_comment_short: Professor Boney is an enthusiastic and clear instructor who moves quickly through material but maintains student engagement with sarcasm, humor, and real-world examples. However, her teaching style can be challenging for those who do not actively participate or keep up with the coursework, and some students find her demeanor cold or unhelpful outside of class.

Ratings.comment: Was the best German class I took, but not the easiest. She's only cold to those who obviously didn't care.  She met me outside of her office hours twice and really helped me when I asked for it. She goes fast, but that made the class interesting and not boring.
She wasn't helpful even when you showed your need. Not plesant at all. Very good lecturer however moves fast. Generally mean I guess is a good word for her.
What a disaster. I no longer have a desire to be a German major. The fact that she doen't dress appropriately is distracting in itself

She goes fast sometimes, but she always tried to make the class a little fun and interesting. If you go to class and do most of your homework it's pretty easy. It's obvious she likes what she's doing and her enthusiasm never made me fall asleep.
Very clear and helpful
No Comments
No Comments
Sarcasm and humor made the class fun. Used real-world examples to tie into the text. Honest. Makes no allowances for students' lack of participation or failure to study.

i liked this class.  i felt like she explained things well but got a little aggravated because most students don't care about the course.  she was sarcastic (which i find funny) and has a softer side.. she just chooses when to show it.
Total ****, tendency to throw things at students.  Talks crap about students, doesnt really care about students

summary_comment: Professor Pedros-Gascon is highly regarded for his intelligence and passion for literature, which he effectively communicates in class. He is described as energetic, helpful, and kind, though some students find his grading strict and his accent challenging at times. Overall, he is considered a solid and engaging instructor who fosters a supportive learning environment.
summary_comment_short: Professor Pedros-Gascon is highly regarded for his intelligence, passion for literature, and engaging teaching style, which are evident in his classes. However, his grading is noted to be strict, with students emphasizing the importance of adhering strictly to course material.

Ratings.comment: Antonio is a wonderful teacher.  Very intelligent.  He loves literature and it shows.  He's got tons of energy, and he's a genuinely nice guy who cares about what he's doing.  He was very helpful to me whenever I had a problem of any kind.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
Fun in class. However, he grades really hard. If you take him do not expect any leeway. He goes straight by the book. I would not recomend him.

This guy is great!  He's very helpful and fun in class.  If you don't understand what he says at times, he'll gladly speak it to you in English.  He also throws in some humor in his teachings to make class a little bit less of a drag.  No complaints here, Antonio es el hombre!
Antonio is a wonderful professor and highly intelligent. His love for teaching is obvious, and I learned a lot in his class.
Average
GTA from Spain.  Good guy, kind of hard to understand from time to time.  Doesn't teach the test, but you still learn a lot.

summary_comment: Professor Pino is an excellent teacher known for his exceptional instructional quality and warm demeanor towards students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Pino is an outstanding teacher known for his excellent instructional methods and warm demeanor towards students. His overall teaching quality is highly regarded, making him a valued educator.

Ratings.comment: Excellent teacher.  Very nice to students.

summary_comment: Professor Beckman is highly knowledgeable but struggles with clear communication, making her lectures challenging to follow. Despite being a genius in her field and offering generous grading, her teaching style is confusing and not well-suited for all students, particularly those without strong coding backgrounds. She is, however, very supportive during office hours and engaging in discussions.
summary_comment_short: Professor Beckman is highly knowledgeable but struggles with clear communication, often requiring students to interpret her lectures. Despite her expertise and some positive aspects like generous grading and willingness to help during office hours, her teaching style can be confusing and challenging for students.

Ratings.comment: While P. Beckman obviously knows what she's talking about, her ability to articulate what she wants to say is pretty low. I had to interpret a lot of what she was saying after she said it. It helps that she had a sharp TA and the grading for the class assignments/labs almost boiled down to if you tried or not, which was nice.

Dr. Beckman is a genius; however, she is not a good teacher, at least not of this class.  She is confusing, hard to follow, scatterbrained, and expects students (mostly ling majors) to have a firm grasp on computer code.  She also gives an excessive amount of homework.  She's very nice and energetic, though.  Still, I wouldn't recommend the class.

Mary is pretty awesome! She is a genious! Extremely easy grader and she loves what she is doing!  Teach yourself "R" before you take her course b/c you will use it a lot!  She holds amazing discussions and knows what she is talking about!  I absolutely recommend her has a prof!  Wonderful person and even worked with Peter Ladefoged!

600.01 was a tough class.  Make sure you've taken ling 500 at least before this class.  It is assumed that you know the IPA and everything in the acoustic and auditory phonetics textbook already.  Mary is really nice though and will gladly help you during her office hours.  Oh, and be ready for confusing computer programs like Praat and R.
No Comments
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Gutierrez-Rexach is generally perceived as an easy instructor, with many students finding his classes straightforward and graded primarily on completion. While some praise his ability to make complex topics accessible and engaging, others criticize him for unclear explanations and perceived rudeness during presentations. Overall, his teaching style varies widely among students, ranging from highly effective and enjoyable to frustrating and unfair.
summary_comment_short: Professor Gutierrez-Rexach is known for making complex topics more accessible, though his teaching style is generally perceived as easy, with a focus on straightforward assignments and clear expectations. However, some students have noted that he can be less effective in larger classes or when not fully engaged, occasionally coming across as rude or unclear in his explanations.

Ratings.comment: Very easy class. He lectured for ~50 minutes and then let the class go. A Powerpoint and a paper were the big assignments, along with very easy homework assignments that were completion grades.
Easy. Easy easy easy easy easy. Everything was graded for completion. Super easy. Facil. Easy.
Wonderful instructor.  He brought the material to life!
Not an easy topic, but he makes it less hard. Very nice and kind.
Great class, great teacher. Learned a lot.
He is the best. Excellent instructor, very nice and funny. He knows a lot and he is eager to help you. Disregard previous comment (probably from one student who was caught cheating)

I've had him twice in my graduate classes, I must say he is indeed a very bad teacher. He knows a lot and likes making remarks about how stupid we, the students, were. His explanations are not clear, his course evaluations differed from that stipulated in the syllabus. He assigns grades based on his perception of your intelligence. Avoid his class.

His class is a very straight forward class (for example what he teaches is on the test), but sometimes he can be a little rude (for example in 601 we had presenations and he read other things and was not paying attention).  Other than than he is very nice and helpful.

summary_comment: Professor Mkhize is highly regarded for her exceptional kindness and helpfulness, making her one of the most appreciated instructors at Ohio State University. Students appreciate her approachable nature and her focus on inclusivity and equality, as well as her easy-going attitude towards language perfection, which contributes to a supportive and engaging learning environment.
summary_comment_short: Professor Mkhize is highly regarded for her exceptional kindness and helpfulness, making her one of the most beloved instructors at OSU. Students appreciate her supportive approach and find her classes engaging despite occasional challenges with her accent.

Ratings.comment: the nicest instructor that I had so far in OSU. She is extremely helpful and kind! Her accent sounds exotic:) class is also interesting.

She's one of the nicest teachers I have ever had. She is extremely helpful and, in class discussions, she is wants to know everyone's opinion. Her accent makes it sometimes difficult to understand her, but overall I was able to learn a great deal from her and would be interested in furthering my education in this subject because of her.
Gabi is so nice and helpful. You really can talk to her about anything. I learned a lot from her and now I'm more aware of what I do and say in regards to women and equality. Thanks Gabi.

She aint got that American accent down and yuh know the class will be boring but wow is it easy and wow was she nice. i think like the first midterm average was like an 88. it's cakebreezy easy take it fellow students of higher edcucation
Best ever. Very helpful fun class. Why would anyone take Spanish and suffer when this is offered.
Gabi is so freaking awesome!  She is super nice and really helpful.  She takes the class pretty lightly in terms of speaking Zulu perfectly.  She just wants you to show up and to try!

summary_comment: Professor Castillo-Trelles is highly enthusiastic and engaging, making her classes enjoyable and fast-paced. She is an excellent communicator and a native speaker, which enhances learning. However, some students find her classes challenging due to the heavy workload and occasional tardiness, and feel she could be more supportive with difficult material.
summary_comment_short: Professor Castillo-Trelles is highly engaging and enthusiastic, making the class enjoyable and fast-paced while effectively conveying a significant amount of information. However, she can be inconsistent with her availability and assigns a substantial amount of homework, which can be challenging for non-majors.

Ratings.comment: SUPER ENTHUSIASTIC !! Was a fun class that went by fast while I still learned a lot!!

She has favorites in the class and isn't really helpful when it comes to understanding tough material. She was often late to class and sometimes we didn't have enough time in class to learn all the material needed.  Way too much HW for a non-major class and she floods your e-mail box.

She's an excellent teacher. Not only is she a native speaker but she communicates well with her students. Her classroom is fun and if you do all of your work and study like you're suppose to you shouldn't have any problems.

Carolina was awesome!  She very flamboyant and kind of a nut, and each day in her class is always something fun to look forward to.  Very helpful and student-oriented, and pretty cute to ;-)  I had all native Hispanics for my Spanish classes and they were great, and I hear they're a lot better than non-native instructors.

summary_comment: Professor Brelo is highly regarded for her engaging and friendly personality, which fosters a collaborative learning environment where students make many friends through interactive activities. She is an effective and dedicated instructor who challenges students while ensuring the material is accessible, making her particularly well-suited for relearning or advancing in French.
summary_comment_short: Professor Brelo is highly regarded for her engaging and friendly personality, which fosters a collaborative learning environment where students make many friends through interactive activities. She is an effective and dedicated instructor who challenges students while ensuring material is accessible and well-understood.

Ratings.comment: Great personality!
Fun, fair, and dedicated prof.  I made lots of friends in her class because she had us interacting with each other so much.

She was a great teacher.  After not taking French since my junior year in highschool, having her for an intensive french teacher was great!  She taught at a rate that was easy to understand, but at the same time challenged thought.  Great teacher!

summary_comment: Professor Cardona is generally considered a reliable and approachable instructor who emphasizes consistent attendance and engagement. Her classes are methodical and straightforward, though some find them structured and occasionally boring. While she is willing to help and prepares students well for tests, there are occasional issues with clarity regarding assignments and online quizzes.
summary_comment_short: Professor Cardona is generally considered a methodical and helpful instructor who emphasizes consistent attendance and participation. Her classes are described as straightforward and structured, though some find them somewhat boring or challenging due to the emphasis on speaking Spanish. Students appreciate her willingness to help but note occasional confusion regarding assignments and online quizzes.

Ratings.comment: Nice lady, simple class. It's really methodical, you fall into a routine that lasts the entire semester. My high school spanish class was more difficult. Just show up, pay attention, and you're set.

Very easy, simply keep up and read the stories and you will be fine.  Not much stress on grammar.  The class format is structured, but can be boring.  Also, she was very unclear at times about homework and quizzes online.  Not very helpful in that category.  Other than that, she is very willing to help, and the midterms and final were very easy.

Very nice and very willing to help. Of course not always clear..you have to speak spanish all the time! Tests are hard, but she doesn't make them. She does prepare you for them, however. Great teacher!
She is horrible.
She's a really nice person! Just keep up on the work (I did fine).

she's one of those teachers that makes you stand up in front of the class with a group and make fools of yourselves. lol. but she's a very good teacher, she takes her job seriously and she makes sure you understand the material before you go on to a higher level. I was very prepared for 104.
bad, real bad... No hablo spaniol! see, that is all I have learned!
Overall a good teacher. The class difficulty is slightly easier than average probably. Tests are somewhat challenging. Keep up on your workbook homework, she'll give you open-workbook pop quizes.
Tests are not super easy, but she is very nice. She is always willing to help you in any way that she can.

summary_comment: Professor Onarato is highly regarded as an exceptional teacher, consistently praised for her effective classroom management and supportive approach. Students strongly recommend her class, noting significant improvements in speaking skills and overall Italian proficiency.
summary_comment_short: Professor Onarato is widely regarded as an outstanding teacher, with students consistently praising her for running a well-organized and highly beneficial class. Her teaching approach effectively enhances students' speaking skills and ensures clear communication, leading to significant improvements in Italian proficiency.

Ratings.comment: Awesome teacher!!!
BEST TEACHER EVER!!!
Great teacher.  I recommend her very highly.  Her class is very well run and helpful.  You will definitely not regret taking her class.
Carla is an amazing teacher. She helps you develop your speaking skills more than your reading/writing comprehension. She is a great teacher.

Carla is an amazing teacher!  She's from Rome, but she never rattles off randomly in Italian.  She always makes sure you know what she's talking about.  Believe me, your Italian will improve just by listening to her!
She's AWESOME!!!

summary_comment: Professor Odden is known for his engaging and humorous teaching style, which many find enjoyable and entertaining. However, his classes require significant time commitment, particularly with homework and exams. While some appreciate his easy grading and clear knowledge of the subject matter, others criticize his teaching approach as sometimes vague and potentially degrading, especially for those who are sensitive to sarcasm or prefer more straightforward instruction.
summary_comment_short: Professor Odden is known for his engaging and humorous teaching style, which many find entertaining and enjoyable. However, his classes require significant time commitment and can be challenging, particularly for topics like phonology.

Ratings.comment: He was cool. The work took a lot of time (homework and midterms alike).
He's an easy grader, interesting in class, although I'm not very interested in phonology.  I ended up liking phonology more after the class, that must say something.

He is a really fascinating guy! I enjoyed his class! Loved it actually even though I am not good at phonology I love phonology! He is a bit vague at times when explaining things. If you don't like sarcasm and humour, don't take Big Dave's class! He is humorous and sarcastic which could offend sensitive people! Great prof!
He's got a sense of humor, grades easy, and clearly knows what he's talking about.  Unless you get scared off by the Socratic method, he's the best teacher you'll ever have.

This professor plays favorites. His remarks to papers and assignments are very unhelpful. The way he talks to students can be very degrading. If you try to speak up in class, more than likely he'll make you feel like an idiot. He also expects his students to know all the material coming into the class... then, what's the point of teaching it?
I love 'Big Dave'.
Great guy, fascinating class!
Very fun guy, keeps class interesting with his tangents!

summary_comment: Professor Midlick is highly regarded for her clarity and precision in teaching, making her classes engaging and enjoyable. Students appreciate her availability and the ease of her assessments. However, some note that her teaching effectiveness varies, particularly for those seeking a deeper understanding of the subject matter.
summary_comment_short: Professor Midlick is highly regarded for her clarity, precision, and ability to make classes enjoyable and engaging. However, some students have noted issues with her teaching effectiveness, particularly in accurately pronouncing words and providing comprehensive knowledge of the subject matter.

Ratings.comment: She is an amazing teacher. She's very clear and precise, makes class extremely fun, helps you whenever you need it, and doesn't make/grade the quizes/tests hard at all. I highly suggest you take her class!
she is so hot and smart. i really think i love her. if she wasnt my professor she would be mine. she is that hot. if only she liked girls

If you take italian to get through your GECs shes great, very nice and easy to understand, its a easy class. If you really want to learn, this class is a waste of time. Her accent is nonexistant and I havent learned anything that I couldnt learn by reading the book. She says "Va Bene" and "Benissimo" too much and her clothes are quite interesting.
very nice, funny, made class really fun and learned a lot.
She made the class fun and worth going to.  She was a lil corny at times, but overall, i learned alot.  She taught well and made you learn it. good teacher for 102 imo

She was always helpful, the class was easy as hell, but knowing what I know about romance languages, she was a terrible instructor.  she couldn't pronounce words with the correct accent, and just didn't know much in general.
She's fun, helpful and absolutely delightful!
No Comments
awesome
Wouldn't have been so bad if she was teaching middle schoolers, but head shoulders knees and toes doesn't fly after age 5!
awesome teacher and awesome class.  you make learnign italian fun!!
She is the best teacher I have ever had. she makes learning fun and she is sexy as hell.
Christina was an excellent teacher.  I absolutely loved her class, and hope she teaches more Italian classes next summer.

summary_comment: Professor Gullette is an effective and engaging instructor who successfully conveys required material in an interesting manner, though his classes can occasionally feel disorganized leading up to exams. He is highly recommended for his genuine care, availability for extra help, and ability to make the subject enjoyable, even for non-majors. Students find him helpful, fair, and generally pleasant to have.
summary_comment_short: Professor Gullette is an effective and engaging instructor who successfully imparts the necessary material while keeping the content interesting. Despite occasional organizational challenges, particularly before exams, he is dedicated to student success and provides valuable support through study sessions and office hours.

Ratings.comment: Overall great guy who teaches the required material but makes it interesting and knows when lecture material is boring and to move quickly. So lucky to have had him and not someone else, definitely recommend taking his class.

He is fairly laid back but at times can be disorganized with days previous to an exam when we're all overwhelmed. He always makes himself available for extra help and you can tell he genuinely cares about making sure everyone does well. He holds awesome study sessions, which I recommend attending.

Peter is one of the most awkward teachers I have ever had, but you get used to it very quickly. He absolutely loves Spanish and tries his best to make it fun. Knows the language very well, especially for it being his second language. Actually had fun in the class and would take him again without a doubt
He is very helpful and understands that most of the students don't plan to major in Spanish. That said, he's a fair grader. I highly suggest Peter!
Very good teacher.
Peter is a very nice man. And he is very easy on the eyes ;) but he is very helpful, even though his classes can be fairly awkward at times. I would take him again!

summary_comment: Professor Devos is generally perceived as friendly and helpful, though his effectiveness as a 104 instructor is widely criticized due to his limited Spanish fluency and difficulty answering questions. Despite mixed reviews, many students appreciate his willingness to assist and provide study tips, and some would take his class again.
summary_comment_short: Professor Devos is generally perceived as friendly and helpful, though his teaching of advanced courses is questioned due to his limited fluency in Spanish and tendency to correct himself frequently. Students find his grading inconsistent and his class both easy and challenging depending on the topic.

Ratings.comment: friendly and helpful.
First time ever teaching 104. Horrible. Spoke more English than he did Spanish in class, and his fluency is less than par. A little eccentric, but exasperating.
Horrible 104 teacher, he needs to stick to teaching 103. He corrects himself all the time and is unable to answer many questions. I normally enjoy spanish, but now that I have had him, I hate it!
This class is easy.. He grades very easily, and sometimes gives answers to tests..Take this Spanish class is possible...you'll get an easy A!

His grading can be hard on some things, but really easy on others. At first I didn't like him, but he is really nice and wants to help his students. He gives hints and if you ask nicely he will cut the class some slack
Good teacher.  always gave helpful hints for what to study.  daily attendance, but it's typical for a spanish class.  would like to have him again.

summary_comment: Professor Tippets is highly regarded for his engaging and personable teaching style, making complex Spanish grammar both interesting and enjoyable. His ability to connect theoretical concepts with practical usage enhances student understanding and retention. Students appreciate his fairness, willingness to help, and thorough knowledge of the subject matter.
summary_comment_short: Professor Tippets is highly regarded for his engaging teaching style and ability to make complex topics like Spanish grammar interesting and relevant. Students consistently praise his fairness, willingness to help, and deep knowledge of the subject matter.

Ratings.comment: One of the best teachers ive had here at Ohio State  He makes his stuff interesting plus he knows how to keep his students interested.  The fact that he is young make him more personable.
Great at explaining Spanish grammar and relating it to actual usage in conversation.

Ian is an incredible teacher! He somehow finds a way to make grammar fun. after learning the same grammar concepts over and over again, he was the first teacher I have ever had to teach it from a different angle. He was born to teach!
Ian is very fair and willing to help. If you put the work in, you will get the grade you deserve.
Great teacher! Actually made spanish grammar fun and interesting...Quizzes were moderately difficult, but homework was based on completion and I felt prepared for both the midterm and final

Ian is a good teacher but came across as kind of uptight at times.  Also he always teaches right up to the last minute of class, even if that means he has to kind of drag things out.  Nice guy though and very approachable outside of class.  Definitely knows his stuff.
He's really great at his job!
funny, charismatic, always made the class worth going to...even so early in the morning. definitely take him if at all possible.
Very nice guy, extremely helpful, super funny, wish I had him for all my Spanish classes.   Try to get into his section if you can!
Great teacher, a linguistteaching spanish, knows a lot of information
